He bought all the necessary supplies, such as screens and reflectors for silk-screen print developing and he opened a shop at home where he currently works. After years of experience and using his sales person skills acquired in a previous job, it wasn’t hard for him to start his own clientele always guaranteeing the best prices. With time, he purchased better tools, such as computers and others being this the only way to successfully manage this business for over 12 years. He needs a loan of $450 that will be canceled in 3 months to invest in material and to take advantage of the Christmas season to finish all the calendar requests he has already booked.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase work material

loans.name: Gerónima Sofía

texts.es:
La señora Gerónima es socia del Banco Comunal “Dante Nava” del distrito, provincia y departamento D. Puno. Tiene 73 años D. edad, es casada  y madre D. 3 hijos. 
Con su primer préstamo D. S/. 300 compró casacas nuevas para venderlo en su puesto D. trabajo. Tiene casi 5 años trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que vive con 2 nietos.
Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprarán árboles D. navidad que venderá en la campaña naviD.ña. 
Geronima desea continuar trabajando para tener su carreta D. salchipapas.
texts.en:
Ms. Gerónima F. is a member of the Dante Nava microfinance institute in the district, province and department of Puno. She is a 73-year-old married mother with 3 children. With her first 300.00 PEN loan, she purchased new jackets to sell them at her stand. For almost five years, she has been working with the microfinance institute. She tells us that she lives with 2 grandchildren.

With this 1,000.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 4 monthly installments, she will purchase Christmas trees to be sold this holiday season.

Gerónima wishes to continue working so that she can one day have her own street food cart to sell salchipapas—Peruvian street food maD. of pan-fried sausages and French fries.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Christmas trees

loans.name: Heidi

texts.es:
La señorita  Heidi es socia del Banco Comunal “Flores la Pampilla” del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 21 años de edad y es soltera sin hijos. 
Con su primer préstamo de S/. 300 compró ropa de bebe para venderla en su puesto de trabajo. Tiene casi un año y medio trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que estudia computación. 
Con este préstamo de S/. 900, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará mayor cantidad de ropa de bebe para venderla en las fiestas de navidad. 
Heidi desea continuar trabajando para terminar su carrera, tener su propia tienda y su casa propia.
texts.en:
Miss Heidi is a member of the Flores la Pampilla microfinance institute in the district, province and department of Puno. She is 21 years old, single and has no children. With her first 300.00 PEN loan, she purchased baby apparel that she sold in her stand. She has been working with the microfinance institute for almost a year and a half. She is also currently taking computer science courses.

With this 900.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 4 monthly installments, she will purchase a greater amount of baby apparel to be sold during the Christmas festivities. Heidi wishes to continue working so that she can finish her degree and have her own store and house.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase baby apparel

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La señora Hilda es socia del Banco Comunal “Flores la Pampilla” del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 29 años de edad, es casada y madre de un hijo. 
Con su primer préstamo de S/. 300 compró golosinas para venderlas en su tienda. Tiene casi 5 años trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que es enfermera técnica pero no ejerce su carrera. 
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará juguetes y pirotécnicos para la campaña navideña. 
Hilda desea continuar trabajando para construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Hilda is a member of the “Flores la Pampilla” Communal Bank located in the district, province and state of Puno. She is 29 years old, married, and mother of one son. With her first loan for S/ 300 she bought candy to sell in her store. She has been working with the Communal Bank for almost 5 years and she tells us that she is trained as a nurse technician but does not practice this profession. With this loan for S/. 1,000, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy toys and fireworks for the Christmas season. Hilda wishes to continue working to build her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy toys and fireworks.

loans.name: Karina Virginia

texts.es:
La señorita Karina es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Villa del Lago II” del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 25 años de edad y es soltera sin hijos. 
Con el primer préstamo de S/ 500 compró productos de belleza de unique para vender. Tiene casi 4 años trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que estudia nutrición en la universidad.
Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará mayor cantidad de productos de belleza de unique.
Karina desea continuar trabajando para llegar a ser directora de su empresa de productos de belleza y montar un restaurante de comida andina nutritiva.
texts.en:
Karina is a member of the “Mujeres de Villa del Lago II” Communal Bank located in the district, province and state of Puno. She is 25 years old, single, and does not have children. With her first loan for S/ 500 she bought Unique beauty products to sell. She has been working with the Communal Bank for almost 4 years and she tells us that she studies nutrition at the university. With his loan for S/. 2, 500, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy a large quantity of Unique beauty products. Karina wishes to continue working to become director of her beauty product business and open a restaurant of nutritious Andean food.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beauty products

loans.name: Nsia

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania and SELFINA!  This is 33 year old Nsia I. M.. She is married with three children between the ages of 2 and 8. 

Nsia is quite the entrepreneur as she runs two businesses: a kuku (poultry) business and a tailoring business.  Seems a bit unrelated to the average person, but it makes sense here in Tanzania. A kuku business is a simple, profitable, and popular business here in Tanzania. You simply buy chicks, tend to them for 5 weeks, and then sell them in the market. It does not take all day to tend to the chickens, once in the morning and once in the afternoon, so a go-getter like Nsia also has time to run another business. Her tailoring business is a bit more complicated as she needs to properly measure and sew outfits to her customers' specifications, and customers can be quite demanding!

Her businesses are doing well and her monthly profits are approximately US$600. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase additional chicks and feed for her kuku business, as well as materials for making clothes for her tailoring business. She thanks you in advance for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional chicks and feed for her kuku business, as well as materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
La señora Lucy es socia del Banco Comunal “Dante Nava” del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 30 años de edad, es casada y madre de un hijo. 
Con su primer préstamo de S/. 300 compró cosméticos, bisutería para venderlos en su puesto de trabajo. Tiene casi 8 años trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que su quisco ha variado de productos, tiene pelotas, juguetes y regalos para toda ocasión.
Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará peluches, cofres de hueso y tintes para cabello para vender en la campaña navideña.
texts.en:
Señora Lucy is a member of the communal bank "Dante Nava" in the district, province, and department of Puno. She is 30, is married, and has one son. With her first loan of 300 nuevos soles, she purchased cosmetics and jewelry to sell at her stand where she works. She has worked for almost 8 years with the communal bank, and she tells us that she sells various products at her kiosk. She has balls, toys, and gifts for every occasion. With this loan of 3,000 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase stuffed animals, jewelry boxes, and hair dyes to sell during the Christmas season.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase stuffed animals, jewelry boxes, and hair dye.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio inició el negocio ya que necesitaba de una actividad económica para solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar a sus padres económicamente ya que son personas adultas mayores. Comenzó el negocio en Junio del 2000 trabajaba junto con la muchacha que es su ayudante en una fabrica y una vez que fueron despedidos decidieron asociarse e iniciar un  negocio de elaboración y venta de donas y empanadas. Al inicio tuvieron que tocar muchas puertas para dar a conocer su producto y poder vender, pero una vez que los fueron conociendo se ha dedicado a surtir los pedidos que diariamente  les solicitan. 


El necesita un préstamo por MXN $6,000 que pagara en 6 meses para poder comprar materia prima y con esto bajar el costo  y consecuentemente tener mayor utilidad para continuar reinvirtiendo en el negocio.
texts.en:
Antonio started this business because he needed an activity to cover his personal expenses and to financially support his parents as they are both elder people. He opened his business in June 2000 after him and his partner, a woman that used to work with him at a factory, were fired. After that, they decided to become partners and get into the business of making doughnuts and “empanadas”. At the beginning they had to knock on many doors to be able to sell their products, but once customers started to know them they have expanded their business and they are now devoted to prepare and deliver the many requests they receive every day. He needs a loan of $450 that will be canceled in 6 months to purchase raw material that will allow them to lower the cost of their products to have a better utility and to continue re-investing in this business.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw material

loans.name: Lucila Yobana

texts.es:
La señora Lucila es socia del Banco Comunal “Wiñay” del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 40 años de edad y es soltera sin hijos. 
Con el primer préstamo de S/ 300 compró repuestos para vender en su taller de mecánica. Tiene casi 3 años trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que ha trabajado en el sector transportes y se compró una computadora nueva para la inscripción de vehículos.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, pretende independizarse  y comprar lubricantes y un scanner para su taller de mecánica.
texts.en:
Señora Lucila is a member of the communal bank, "Wiñay," in the district, province, and department of Puno. She is 40 and is single with no children. With her first loan of 300 nuevos soles, she bought parts to sell in her mechanic's shop. She has worked with the communal bank for almost 3 years, and she tells us that she has worked in the transportation sector and has bought a new computer for vehicle registration. With this loan of 1,700 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she hopes to become independent and to purchase lubricants and a scanner for her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase lubricants and a scanner

loans.name: Rosario Isabel

texts.es:
Rosario inició el negocio en Marzo de 2004, porqué deseaba obtener un ingreso propio para no tener que depender totalmente de su esposo en el aspecto económico y además quería contribuir ayudando con los estudios de sus hijos. Empezó  gracias a una persona que le ofreció  productos naturistas para uso persona, pero al notar los resultados que le dieron empecé a ofrecerlos entre familiares y amigos
Ella siente que ha ido progresando porque desde hace un año también se dedico a vender joyería de plata la cual también logro vender entres sus clientes de los productos naturistas y gracias a su negocio puede costear la carrera universitaria de su hija.
Ahora necesita de un préstamo por MXN $5,000 que pagara en 10 catorcenas para comprar mercancía que le permitirá comprar mas productos para poder cubrir pedidos de sus clientes y también para comprar joyería de plata aprovechando esta temporada navideña que se acerca y en la que la gente compra más para hacer regalos
texts.en:
Rosario started the business in March of 2004. She wanted to have her own income and not totally depend on her husband economically. She also wanted to help pay for her children's education. She started thanks to a person who offered her natural products for personal use. When she noticed the results, she began offering them to family and friends.

She feels her business has improved because she began selling silver jewelry a year ago. She was able to sell the jewelry to her customers who buy the natural products. Thanks to her business she can pay for her daughter's university education.

Now she needs a loan for MXN $5,000 to buy merchandise which she will pay back in 10 bi-monthly installments. This will allow her to buy more products to cover her customers' orders and also buy silver jewelry, taking advantage of the upcoming Christmas season when people buy more to give as presents.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maritza Yovana

texts.es:
La señora Maritza es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Villa del Lago II” del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 30 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de 2 hijos menores a los que apoya económicamente. 
Con el primer préstamo de S/ 500 compró gaseosas para vender al por mayor. Tiene casi un año trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que ha aumentado la cantidad de productos que compra al contado de las distribuidoras.
Con este préstamo de S/.1,300, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará mayor cantidad de gaseosas para seguir distribuyendo al por mayor.
Maritza desea continuar trabajando para apoyar a sus hijos para que lleguen a ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Señora Maritza is a member of the communal bank, "Mujeres de Villa del Lago II" in the district, province, and department of Puno. She is 30, lives with her boyfriend, and has 2 young children who are her dependents. With her first loan of 500 nuevos soles, she purchased soft drinks to sell wholesale. She has worked with the communal bank for almost a year, and she tells us that she has increased the amount of products that she buys from distributors with cash. With this first loan of 1,300 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy a larger quantity of soft drinks to keep distributing as a wholesaler. Maritza hopes to keep working to support her children so they will become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase a large quantity of soft drinks

loans.name: Marcelina Amerita

texts.es:
La señora Marcelina es socia del Banco Comunal “Dante Nava” del distrito, provincia, y departamento de Puno. Tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y madre de 4 hijos. 
Con su primer préstamo de S/. 300 compró diversos productos para venderlos en su tienda. Tiene casi 3 años trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que recientemente perdió a una hija después de un largo tratamiento.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará mayor mercadería para venderla en su tienda. 
Marcelina desea continuar trabajando para apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Marcelina is a member of the “Dante Nava” Communal Bank located in the district, province and state of Puno. She is 45 years old, married, and has 4 children. With her first loan for S/ 300 she bought various products to sell in her store. She has been working with the Communal Bank for almost 3 years and she tells us that recently she lost a daughter after a long illness. With his loan for S/. 1,500, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy a large amount of merchandise to sell in her store. Marcelina wishes to continue working to support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Maria luisa inició el negocio  por el deseo de trabajar  y salir adelante, de ser una persona independiente con deseos de superación y así poder obtener su propio ingreso para poder ofrecerles un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Comenzó el negocio en  junio de 2008. Antes se dedicaba a la venta de joyería pero una vecina la  invitó a trabajar con ella en la venta de comida y ahí se dio cuenta de que era buena ganancia por lo que decidió independizarse con ayuda de su mamá.
Poco a poco se han ido incrementando sus ventas entre sus vecinos y conocidos y personas que también van por recomendación a comprar comida a su casa.

Ella necesita un préstamo por MXN $3000 que pagara en 8 catorcenas  para comprar mercancía y algunos activos principalmente utensilios de cocina que le hacen falta como ollas, sartenes, cucharas, platos, etc. y también compra de materia prima como aceite, verduras, fríjol, arroz, etc. para poder brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria Luisa started her business because of her desire to work and get ahead. She wanted to be an independent person with a desire to achieve and in that way have her own income to offer a better future for her children. She started the business in June 2008. Beforehand, she used to sell jewelry but a neighbor invited her to work with her selling food and realized there were good earnings in it. She became independent with her mother's help. Slowly, sales have incremented among her neighbors and people that come to buy food at her home by recommendation.

She needs a $225 loan ($3000 MXN) to buy merchandise and some cooking utensils that she needs like: pots, pans, spoons, plates, etc. Also, raw materials like: oil, produce, beans, rice, etc. in order to provide a better service for her customers.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She will purchase garlic and hot peppers

loans.name: Romel González Group

texts.es:
G/s ABORIGEN de la comarca san francisco de la comunidad de Nindiri, compuesto por personas de bajos recursos económicos y que lo único que necesitan es un financiamiento de adim para hacer crecer sus negocios, ellos su créditos lo utilizan en capital de trabajo compran en el mercado municipal de Masaya por mayor y venden al detalle en su casa de habitación, quieren fortalecer sus negocios por que dicen que tenerlo en sus casas le permite cuidar de sus hijos y de su hogar.
Don Maylorc vende tarjetas de celulares de movistar y claro , el comenzó su negocio con un pequeño capital que le obsequiaron sus padres, por ser una persona bien trabajadoras y honesta con los prestamos de adim logro que  la empresa claro le diera la oportunidad de tener  un teléfono móvil en su casa y hoy presta este otro servicio.  Doña Elisa tiene la oportunidad de contar con la ayuda de su esposo, los cuales entre los dos preparan los nacatamales y los comercializan en el mercado de Masaya. Su mayor sueño es de llegar a tener un negocio en el mercado municipal de Masaya, pues ellos tienen experiencia en la comercialización de frutas.
texts.en:
The “Aborigen” group from the San Francisco area of Nindiri is made up of people with few economic resources who need funding from Kiva's partner ADIM to help their businesses grow. They will use the money as working capital to buy wholesale merchandise at the Masaya municipal market. They will then sell the merchandise at retail prices from their homes, which allows them to work while taking care of their children and homes.

Maylorc sells Movistar and Claro brand prepaid cellular phone cards. His parents gave him a small amount of capital to start his business. Since he is a very hardworking and has been responsible with previous loans from ADIM, the Claro company gave him the opportunity to have a mobile phone at his home. He has now expanded his business to include the sale of prepaid cards.

Elisa works with her husband making pork tamales steamed in banana leaves and selling them at the Masaya market. Her dream is to have her own stand in the market, since she and her husband have experience selling fruit.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to invest in more and better products

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es:
Víctor Hugo inició el negocio porque necesitaba un ingreso que le permitiera apoyar a su casa con los gastos, ya que vive con sus padres  y junto con su hermano iniciaron el negocio, en un lote donde originalmente solo estaba el auto lavado. Ahora ya es una plaza donde los dueño son familiares, y acondicionaron el local acorde a los negocios dentro de la Plaza. Comenzó el negocio en mayo del 1994 por iniciativa de su hermano montaron el auto lavado donde son socios., ya que por la falta de estudio no les era posible colocarse en un empleo un poco mejor redituado. 
Desde que iniciamos les ha ido muy bien ya que a parte de que están  en una plaza Comercial, los  mismos clientes la han ido recomendando gracias al   excelente trabajo que realizan, ya que el auto lavado tiene mas afluencia de clientes

El necesita un préstamo por MXN $3,000 que pagara en 6 meses para  comprar una aspiradora para hacer un mejor trabajo, ya que ese es uno de sus servicios distintivos, porque desmontan el interior para hacer el aspirado a profundidad.
texts.en:
Victor Hugo started the business because he needed and income to support his household with the expenses since he lives with his parents. Together with his brother, they started the business at a lot where originally only the car wash was built. Now it is a square where his relatives are owners and they conditioned the lot according to the existing businessess inside the square. He started the business in May of 1994. At his brother's initiative, they established a car wash where they are partners and due to their lack of education it was impossible for them to get better compensated jobs.

Since they started, it has been going very good since besides that they are located at a commercial square, the same clients have been recommended them thanks to the excellent work that they do. The car wash has a good flow of clients.

He needs a $ 225 loan ($3,000 MXN) that he will pay back in 6 months. He will use the money to buy a vaccum cleaner to do a better job. This is one of their distinctive services because they unmount the interior to do a deeper vaccum.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a vaccum cleaner

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señorita María es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Villa del Lago II” del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 22 años de edad y es soltera sin hijos. 
Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 compró prendas de vestir para venderlas en su puesto de trabajo. Tiene casi un año y medio trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que es estudiante de trabajo social en la universidad.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,100, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará mayor cantidad de ropa para vender en la campaña navideña.
María desea continuar trabajando para terminar su carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the 'Mujeres de Villa del Lago II' Community Bank, in the district, province and department of Puno. She is 22 years old, single and doesn't have children. With her first loan of S/. 300 she bought clothing to sell in her stall. She has worked with the community bank for almost a year and a half and she tells us that she is studying social work at university. With this loan of S/. 1,100, to be repaid in 4 instalments, she will buy a larger quantity of clothes to sell during the Christmas season. Maria hopes to continue working so she can complete her university studies.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing

loans.name: María

texts.es:
La señora María es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Villa del Lago II” del distrito, provincia, y departamento de Puno. Tiene 45 años de edad, es conviviente  y madre de 4 hijos mayores. 
Con el primer préstamo de S/ 500 compró artículos de segundo uso y ferretería para vender en su puesto de trabajo. Tiene casi 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que ha aumentado su capacidad de compra de artículos de segundo uso.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará mayor cantidad artículos de segundo uso y ferretería para aumentar sus ingresos.
Maria desea continuar trabajando para apoyar en la compra de una casa, un auto y aumentar las ventas en su negocio.
texts.en:
Señora María is a member of the community bank "Mujeres de Villa Del Lago II" of the district, province, and department of Puno. She is 45 years of age, married, and mother of four grown children. With the first loan of 500 Soles, she bought second-hand articles and hardware to sell in her work. She has almost two years experience working with the community bank and tells us that she has increased her capacity to purchase second-hand goods. With this loan of 1000 Soles, which will be repaid in four months, she will buy a greater quantity of second-hand articles and hardware to increase her income. Maria wants to continue working to purchase a house and a car and to increase the sales in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy second-hand articles and hardware.

loans.name: Virgen

texts.es:
Virgen inició el negocio porqué al llegar a la colonia donde vive actualmente su esposo batallaba para encontrar trabajo y había gastos de sus hijos y de ellos que tenían que cubrir y ella quería apoyar a su esposo. Comenzó en el mes de Mayo de 2002 ayudando a su esposo a vender pescado y chorizo, después  el encontró un trabajo estable pero ella decidió seguir con el negocio de venta de pescados y mariscos. En la actualidad, aparte de elaborar y vender tamales los fines de semana, también le ayuda a una vecina a elaborar comidas para los alumnos y maestros de una escuela secundaria y eso le permite tener una entrada más para mejorar las condiciones de vida de mi familia.

Ella necesita un préstamo por MXN $5,000 que pagara en 10 catorcenas  para poder comprar pescados y mariscos y materia prima para elaborar tamales, sobre todo en esta época de frío y de fiestas navideñas que es cuando mas se vende.
texts.en:
Virgen started her business because when she arrived to her husband's neighborhood, she struggled to find work and there was the kids' expenses and theirs that needed to be covered and she wanted to support her husband. Virgen started on May of 2002 helping her husband to sell fish and chorizo. later, he found a stable job but she decided to continue the business of selling fish and seafood. Presently, besides elaborating and selling tamales during the weekends, she also helps her neighbor with the preparation of meals for the students and teachers of the secondary school and that allows her to have an extra income to improve the quality of life for her family.

She needs a $375 loan ($5000 MXN) to be able to buy more fish and seafood and raw materials to elaborate the tamales, during this cold and holiday season when they sell the most.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying raw materials for tamales

loans.name: Marisol Felipa

texts.es:
La señora Marisol es socia del Banco Comunal “Dulce Amanecer” del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y madre de 2 hijos. 
Con su primer préstamo de S/. 300 compró prendas de vestir para venderlas en su puesto de trabajo. Tiene casi 2  años trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que ha aumentado sus ingresos al vender mayor cantidad de ropa. 
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará ropa para bebe para venderla en su puesto. 
Agustina desea continuar trabajando para apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Marisol is a member of the 'Dulce Amanecer' Community Bank in the district, province and department of Puno. She is 42 years old, married and the mother of 2 children. With her first loan of S/. 300 she bought clothing to sell in her stall. She has worked with the community bank for almost 2 years and she tells us that she has increased her income by selling a greater quantity of clothes. With this loan of S/. 1,200, to be repaid in 4 instalments, she will buy baby clothes to sell in her stall. Marisol wishes to continue working in order to support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase baby clothes

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
La señora Marleny es socia del Banco Comunal “Wiñay” del distrito, provincia, y departamento de Puno. Tiene 38 años de edad, es soltera y tiene un hijo.
Con el primer préstamo de S/ 300 compró repuestos para vender en su taller de mecánica. Tiene casi 3 años trabajando con el banco comunal. 
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, pretende comprar repuestos para su taller de mecánica.
Ella desea continuar trabajando para aumentar la venta de repuestos en su taller.
texts.en:
Ms. Marleny V. is a member of the “Wiñay” microfinance institute in the district, province and department of Puno. She is 38 years old, single and has one son. With her first 300.00 PEN loan, she purchased spare parts to sell in her auto repair shop. She has been working with the microfinance institute for almost 3 years now.

With this 1,000.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 4 monthly installments, she plans on purchasing spare parts for her auto repair shop.

Marleny wishes to continue working so that she can increase her spare parts sales.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
La señora Martina es socia del Banco Comunal “Dante Nava” del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 59 años de edad, es soltera y madre de 5 hijos.
Con su primer préstamo de S/. 300 compró zapatillas para venderlos en su puesto de trabajo. Tiene casi 5 años trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que ha aumentado su venta de zapatilla y zapatos en este tiempo.
Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará zapatos, lana e insumos para artesanías. 
Martina desea continuar trabajando para llegar a tener su casa propia y apoyar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Señora Martina is a member of the "Dante Nava" communal bank in the district, province, and department of Puno. She is 59-years-old, is single, and has 5 children. With her first loan of 300 nuevos soles, she purchased slippers to sell at the stand where she works. She has worked with the communal bank for almost 5 years. She tells us that she has increased her sales of slippers and shoes in this time. With this loan of 3,000 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy shoes, wool, and supplies to make crafts. Martina hopes to continue working so she can have her own home and support her children.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase shoes, wool, and supplies to make crafts.

loans.name: Myriam Vicenta

texts.es:
La señora Myriam es socia del Banco Comunal “Wiñay” del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 43 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos. 
Con el primer préstamo de S/ 300 compró cosméticos para vender en su tienda y en su domicilio. Tiene casi 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y es dueña de una fotocopiadora, además es profesora.
Con este préstamo de S/. 600, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará más cosméticos e insumos para su fotocopiadora.
Myriam desea continuar trabajando para ayudar a sus hijos a ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Señora Myriam is a member of the communal bank, "Wiñay" in the district, province, and department of Puno. She is 43, is married, and has 4 children. With her first loan of 300 nuevos soles, she purchased cosmetics to sell in her store and in her home. She has worked with the communal bank for almost 2 years. She tells us that she sells cosmetics, owns a photocopier, and is also a teacher. With this loan of 600 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy more cosmetics and supplies for her photocopier. Myriam hopes to keep working to help her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase cosmetics and supplies for her photocopier

loans.name: Elena Pascuala

texts.es:
Elena H. Chávez forma parte del Banco Comunal “Manuela Ramos de Tinco” de la provincia de Carhuaz.

Elena tiene 37 años y 04 hijos con su conviviente, ella menciona que no ha tenido problemas difíciles que enfrentar y que en la actualidad ella apoya a su conviviente que es agricultor, con su trabajo, que requiere de mucho esfuerzo, Elena se dedica a la comercialización de Hierbas aromáticas y medicinales que compra por terreno en bruto y se encarga de cosechar para luego venderlos en paquetes en la feria de la ciudad de Huaraz, Zenaida comenta que cuando empezó hace cuatro años, ella vendía solo lo que producía en su casa y en la actualidad ha crecido regularmente el negocio porque compra por lotes las hierbas para cosecharlas, aunque cuando abundan en su temporada, ella tiene que desechar la hierba porque es perecible y no sabe de qué manera venderlas, por tal motivo Zenaida ha optado también, por diversificar su negocio vendiendo frutas que compra en el distrito de Tinco que los vende junto a las hierbas en la ciudad de Huaraz.
 
Con el préstamo de s/.1800.00 que recibió por parte del movimiento Manuela Ramos por medio de su Banco Comunal, que pagará en ocho cuotas invertirá en la compra de tunas (fruto de la región) y frutos para venderlos en la feria de Huaraz los días lunes y Jueves.
 
Elena piensa que es importante aprender para mejorar en todos los aspectos.
texts.en:
Elena H. Chávez is a member of the Community Bank “Manuela Ramos de Tinco” in the province of Carhuaz. Elena is 37 years old and has 4 children with her partner. She hasn’t really had hard problems in the past, but she would like to help her partner, who is a farmer, with his work, as it requires hard work and dedication. Elena sells herbal essence and medicinal herbs that she buys in lots of land to later on grow them and sell them in packages at the fair of the city of Huaraz. Elena tells us that when she started four years ago she used to sell only what she produced at home, but as the business expanded, she decided to buy herbs in lots of land to grow them, although during high seasons of production she needs to dispose some herbs as they are non-durable and she doesn’t know how to sell her over stock. For that reason, she also decided to diversify her business and start selling fruit that she buys in the district of Tinco to later on sell them together with her herb in the city of Huaraz. With this $600 loan she requested from the Manuela Ramos moment via the Community Bank, which will be paid back in 8 months, she will purchase tunas (local fruit) and other fruit to sell at the fair of the city of Huaraz on Monday and Thursday. Elena believes it is important to learn to improve you business in every possible aspect.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tunas (local fruit) and other fruit

loans.name: Pamela

texts.es:
La señorita Pamela es socia del Banco Comunal “Wiñay” del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 18 años de edad, es soltera, sin hijos y tiene 4 hermanos menores a los que apoya económicamente. 
Pamela nos cuenta que este es su primer préstamo y que estudió para ser chef. Tiene casi medio año trabajando con el banco comunal. 
Con este préstamo de S/. 300, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará insumos para preparar pavos rellenos en navidad.
Pamela desea continuar trabajando para apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Miss Pamela is a member of the “Wiñay” microfinance institute in the district, province and department of Puno. She is 18 years old, single, and has no children. However, she has 4 underage siblings whom she supports financially.

Pamela states that this is her first loan, and that she studied to become a chef. She has been working with the microfinance institute for almost six months.

With this 300.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 4 monthly installments, she will purchase the ingredients necessary to prepare stuffed turkeys for Christmas.

Pamela wishes to continue working in order to help support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make stuffed turkey

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
La señora Petrona es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres D. Villa del Lago II” del distrito, provincia y departamento D. Puno. Tiene 68 años D. edad, es viuda y madre D. 5 hijos mayores y vive con una hija y dos nietos. 
Con el primer préstamo D. S/ 300, compró ajo, choclo y rocoto para vender en el mercado D. Yunguyo. Tiene casi 5 años trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que ha trabajado siempre en el mercado D. Yunguyo y posteriormente se mudó a Puno para acompañar a su hija y a sus nietos quienes estudian en esta ciudad.
Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,200, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará mayor cantidad D. ajo, choclo y rocoto para seguir vendiendo en el mercado.
Francisca desea continuar trabajando para aumentar sus ganancias para dejar herencia a sus nietos.
texts.en:
Ms. Petrona R. is a member of the “Mujeres D. Villa del Lago II” microfinance institute in the district, province and department of Puno. She is a 68-year-old widowed mother with 5 grown up children. She lives with one of her daughters and two grandchildren.

With her first 300.00 PEN loan, she purchased garlic, corn and hot peppers to sell at the market in Yunguyo. She has been working with the microfinance institute for almost 5 years, and she states that she has always worked at the Yunguyo market. She later moved to Puno to join her daughter and grandchildren, who study in this city.

With this 1,200.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 4 monthly installments, she will purchase a greater quantity of garlic, corn and hot peppers to keep selling at the market. Francisca wishes to continue working in order to increase her earnings and leave an inheritance for her grandchildren.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase garlic, corn and hot peppers

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina H. D. C. forma parte del Banco Comunal “mujeres del futuro” D. la provincia D. Huaraz.

Alejandrina tiene 61 años y cuatro hijos con su esposo, ella comenta que no ha tenido muchos problemas en su vida personal siempre las ha podido enfrentar, aunque ya no tiene a ninguno D. sus hijos junto a ella se siente acompañada cuando sus hijos D. tiempo en tiempo llegan a visitarla, Alejandrina se dedica a la venta D. verduras en un puesto ambulatorio en el pasaje San Cristóbal D. la ciudad D. Huaraz, ella comenta que ha crecido regularmente porque recuerda que empezó en este negocio con menos D. 10.00 y en la actualidad ella invierte diariamente más D. 40.00, en los productos que compra D. los vendedores mayoristas que traen desD. la zona costa y desD. el  callejón D. Huaylas, alejandrina comenta que se siente tranquila y que las utilidades que obtiene son suficientes para ella y para el apoyo a su esposo.
  
Con este préstamo D. s/.500.00, que pagará en cuatro cuotas invertirá en la compra D. cebollas, tomates y zanahorias.
 
Alejandrina desea recibir capacitaciones para mejorar su negocio y su vida personal.
texts.en:
Alejandrina H. D. C. is a member of the “Mujeres del Futuro” (Women of the Future) microfinance institute in the Huaraz province.

Alejandrina is 61 years old and has 4 children with her husband. She states that she has not had many problems in her personal life because she has always been able to face them. Even though none of her children live with her, she does not feel alone because they visit her from time to time. Alejandrina sells vegetables in a cart on San Cristóbal road in the city of Huaraz. She states that her business has steadily grown. She remembers that she stated the business with less than 10.00 PEN and she now invests 40.00 PEN a day purchasing products from the wholesalers who bring their goods from the coastal area and from the Huaylas alley. Alejandrina says that she feels at ease and that the profits she earns are enough for her and to help out her husband.

With this 500.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in four monthly installments, she will purchase onions, tomatoes and carrots.

Alejandrina wishes to receive training to improve both her business and personal life.


Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables (onions, tomatoes, etc.)

loans.name: Rocio Marleni

texts.es:
La señora Rocío es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Villa del Lago II” del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 20 años de edad y es soltera sin hijos. 
Con el primer préstamo de S/ 500 compró ajo para vender en su triciclo de manera ambulatoria en la calle. Tiene casi un año trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que actualmente está estudiando computación e informática.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará mayor cantidad de ajo para seguir vendiendo en su triciclo.
Rocío desea continuar trabajando para seguir estudiando y llegar a ser profesional, además poner una tienda.
texts.en:
Miss Rocío is a member of the “Mujeres de Villa del Lago II” microfinance institute in the district, province and department of Puno. She is 20 years old, single and has no children.

With her first 500.00 PEN loan, she purchased garlic in order to sell it on her urban delivery tricycle as a street vendor. She has been working with the microfinance institute for almost a year, and she states that she is currently studying information technology.

With this 1,200.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 4 monthly installments, she will purchase a greater quantity of garlic in order to continue selling it on her work vehicle.

Rocío wishes to continue working so that she can keep studying and one day become a professional. Furthermore, she hopes to set up her own store.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase garlic

loans.name: Abelina Santa

texts.es:
Abelina J. D. M. forma parte del Banco Comunal “Niño Manuelito II” D. la provincia D. Huaraz.

Abelina tiene 59 años, es casada y tiene 06 hijos, Abelina comenta que no ha tenido problemas difíciles que enfrentar, y su negocio ha sido su mayor logro porque D. esta manera apoya a su esposo que es albañil, ella se dedica a la elaboración D. tejidos con lana sintética D. prendas D. vestir, como chompas, chalinas, medias, guantes, etc, que los venD. a pedido a las mujeres mayoristas desD. hace 20 años aproximadamente, este trabajo lo alterna con la compra y venta D. animales menores que compra D. las zonas rurales D. Huaraz y los venD. en la feria D. Huaraz los días lunes y jueves, ella comenta que el tejido no le brinda muchas utilidades porque produce en pocas cantidades pero siempre la saca D. dificultades, razón por la cual también realiza la  venta D. animales menores.

Con este préstamo D. s/.1500.00, que pagará en ocho cuotas invertirá en la compra D. lana sintética y así mismo cuyes y gallinas para las fiestas naviD.ñas.
 
Abelina afirma que le gustaría capacitarse para mejorar en sus negocios.
texts.en:
Abelina J. D. M. is a member of the “Niño Manuelito II” microfinance institute in the province of Huaraz.

Abelina is a 59-year-old married mother with 6 children. She states that she has not had to face difficulties, and that her business has been her biggest achievement because with it, she can support her husband, who is a bricklayer. She weaves knitwear out of synthetic wool for a living, making garments like sweaters, scarves, socks, gloves, etc. that she has been selling to women wholsalers by custom order for approximately 20 years. She also buys and sells small animals for a living. She buys the animals in the rural areas of Huaraz, then sells them at the local market on Mondays and Thursdays. She states that knitting does not bring in too many profits because she only makes a small amount of knitwork, but it always helps her out a bit. For that same reason, she also sells small animals.

With this 1,500.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in eight monthly installments, she will purchase synthetic wool, as well as guinea pigs and chickens for the Christmas festivities.

Abelina states that she would like to receive training in order to improve her business.


Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase synthetic wool, guinea pigs and chickens

loans.name: Gladis Adriana

texts.es:
Gladis P. F. forma parte del Banco Comunal “Manuela Ramos de Tinco” de la provincia de Carhuaz.

Gladis tiene 31 años, y dos hijos con su conviviente, ella comenta que desde que falleció su mamá se ha sentido sola, siendo este hecho la mayor dificultad que ha tenido que enfrentar, Gladis afirma que ha crecido mucho en su negocio, considerando dicho crecimiento como su mayor logro. Ella comercializa animales mayores y menores, carne vacuna que lo vende en la feria de Carhuaz hace ya 04 años, comenta que empezó con s/300.00 comprando animales menores y vendiéndolos en la feria de Carhuaz como cuyes y gallinas y que en la actualidad tiene invertido en todo su negocio un aproximado de s/15 000.00 en animales vacunos, carneros, gallinas y cuyes que compra de las zonas rurales y los vende en carne o vivos, en la feria de Carhuaz, ella tiene que enfrentar los peligros que significa trasladar a los animales en camionetas, comenta que incluso una vez sufrió un accidente cuando se dirigía a su lugar de venta.
  
Con este préstamo de s/.3000.00, que pagará en ocho cuotas invertirá en la compra de ganado ovino.
 
Gladis comenta que el crecimiento que ha tenido es debido al esfuerzo individual y familiar.
texts.en:
Gladis P. F. is a member of the community bank “Manuela Ramos de Tinco” in the province of Carhuaz. Gladis is 31 years old and has 2 children with her partner. She says that since her mother's death she has felt alone. This has been the most difficult situation that she has ever faced. Gladis says that she has expanded her business a lot and that she considers this her greatest accomplishment. She sells both large and small animals. She has sold beef at the Carhuaz market for the past 4 years. She started with 300 soles, buying small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens and selling them at the Carhuaz market. She currently has a total of 15,000.00 soles invested in her business, in the form of cattle, sheep, chickens, and guinea pigs which she buys in rural areas and then sells live or butchered at the Carhuaz market. She bears the risks of transporting the animals in vans, saying that she once had an accident on her way to market. With this 3,000.00 soles loan which she will repay in 8 months, she will buy sheep. Gladis says that the growth of her business is due to her efforts and the support of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep.

loans.name: Rosa Luz

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal “Wiñay” del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 46 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos menores de edad. 
Con su primer préstamo de S/. 300 compró productos de belleza, chocolates y lácteos. Tiene casi 3 años trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que el banco le permitió cambiar de rubro a su negocio en diferentes oportunidades para ahora dedicarse a servicio de turismo. 
Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, continuará capacitándose para mejorar su negocio.
Rosa desea continuar trabajando para capitalizarse y ser independiente de préstamos.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the “Wiñay” community bank in the district, province and department of Puno. She is 46 years old, married, and has 3 minor children. With her first loan of 300 soles, she purchased beauty products, chocolates, and cheeses. She has been working with the community bank for almost 3 years and tells us that the bank has allowed her to change her line of business to seize opportunities such as currently to dedicate herself to tourism services. With this 3,000.00 soles loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will receive training to improve her business. Rosa wants to continue working to make more money and become debt-free.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To receive training to improve her business.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es:
Zenaida P. G. forma parte del Banco Comunal “Manuela Ramos de Tinco” de la provincia de Carhuaz.

Zenaida tiene 44 años, tiene cuatro hijos con su conviviente, Zenaida comenta que ha tenido problemas difíciles que no desea recordar, menciona que su mas grande logro ha sido superarse, apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios y mejorar su casa, ella se dedica a la comercialización de animales menores y productos de temporada que compra en las zonas rurales del distrito de Tinco y los vende en la feria de Carhuaz actividad que realiza desde hace 10 años, ella comenta que ha crecido su negocio tal es así que ahora ya no compra solo cuyes y gallinas también compra cerdos.
 
Con este préstamo de s/.1000.00, que pagará en seis cuotas invertirá en la compra de cerdos para crianza.
 
Zenaida desea recibir talleres de capacitación para mejorar su negocio y su vida familiar.
texts.en:
Zenaida P. G. is part of the “Manuela Ramos de Tinco” community bank in the province of Carhuaz. Zenaida is 44 years old and has 4 children with her partner. Zenaida says that she has had difficult problems which she does not wish to remember and mentions that her greatest accomplishments have been to improve her life, support her children in their studies and make improvements to her home. She sells small animals and seasonal products which she buys in rural areas of Tinco and then sells in the Carhuaz market. She has been active in this business for the past 10 years. She tells us that she has been able to build her business to a point where she can now buy not only guinea pigs and chickens, but pigs as well. With this 1,000.00 soles loan, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy pigs to raise. Zenaida wishes to receive training workshops to improve her business as well as her home life.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs to raise.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel inició el negocio para obtener un ingreso que le permitiera vivir de una manera digna ya que necesitaba dinero para vivir y cubrir sus necesidades ademas de  ayudar con los gastos y servicios de la casa en donde  vivía. Comenzó  en Febrero de 2005,  vendiendo primero entre sus vecinos y  amistades, después lo empezò a hacer casa por casa. Ahora con el apoyo de créditos ha podido crecer mas en su negocio y tener mas clientes, lo que le permitirá también invertir en juguetes para la época navideña que se acerca

El necesita un préstamo por MXN $5000 que pagara en 10 catorcenas para comprar  juguetes que le permita tener un mejor surtido que ofrecer a sus clientes en esta temporada de fiestas navideñas que todos quieren estrenar ropa y regalar juguetes.
texts.en:
Miguel started his business to be able to generate an income that will allow him to live in a dignified way. He needed money to live and cover his primary needs and also help with the expenses and services of the house where he lived. He started in February 2005, selling first among his neighbors and friends and later from household to household. Now with the credit support, he has been able to grow his business more and increase his customers. It has allowed him also to invest in toys for the Christmas season that is coming up.

He needs a $375 loan ($5000 MXN) to buy toys and to allow him to have a better assortment for his customers during this holiday season when everyone wants to show new clothes and give toys as gifts.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise

loans.name: Juana Roxana

texts.es:
La señora Roxana es socia del Banco Comunal “Dante Nava” del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 40 años de edad, es soltera y madre de 3 hijos.
Con su primer préstamo de S/. 300 compró abarrotes y cerveza para vender en su puesto de trabajo. Tiene casi 3 años trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que su negocio ha mejorado.
Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará mayor cantidad abarrotes. 
Juana desea continuar trabajando para tener una bodega.
texts.en:
Roxana is a member of the "Dante Nava" community bank in the district, province, and department of Puno. She is 40 years old, single, and the mother of 3 children. With her first loan of 300 soles, she purchased groceries and beer to sell. She has been working with the community bank for almost 3 years and tells us that her business has improvement. With this loan of 2,000 soles, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy larger quantities of groceries. Juana wishes to continue working in order to have a proper store.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries for resale.

loans.name: Olga Maria

texts.es:
Olga P. I. forma parte del Banco Comunal “Manuela Ramos de Tinco”de la provincia de Carhuaz.

Olga tiene 47 años es casada con 05 hijos, aunque tuvo que superar el accidente de su esposo en el trabajo, Olga comenta que su mas grande logro ha sido tener a sus hijos y verlos profesionales, por ello recibe la ayuda constante de ellos, Olga se dedica a la producción y comercialización de melocotones, que siembra en los terrenos que heredó de su padre y así mismo los comercializa en la feria de Carhuaz, hace 15 años. Las 500 matas melocotoneros son cuidadas por sus hijos y su esposo. Ella menciona que desea seguir mejorando su producción porque hasta ahora le ha ido muy bien con su trabajo, por ello también ha logrado educar a sus hijos y seguir creciendo.
 
Con este préstamo de s/.3000.00, que pagará en ocho cuotas invertirá en la compra de abono y fertilizantes.
 
Olga durante sus 07 años como socia en su Banco Comunal desea seguir creciendo con sus préstamos y así mismo capacitarse para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Olga Pena I. forms part of the Community Bank "Manuela Ramos de Tinco" from the province of Carhuaz. Olga is 41 and is married with 5 children, even though she had to overcome her husband's accident at work, Olga has said that her biggest achievement has been having her children and watching them as professionals, because of this she receives their constant help. Olga is dedicated to the production and sale of peaches, which she grows on the land that she inherited from her father and she sells them in the Carhuaz fair for 15 years. The 500 peach trees are cared for by her children and her husband. She mentions that she hopes to continue improving her production because until now it has gone very well with her work, because of it she has been able to educate her children and keep growing. With this loan of s/. 3,000 which will be paid in eight payments, she will invest in the purchase of compost and fertilizers. During her seven years as a member of her communal bank, Olga has hoped to continue growing with her loans and herself to be able to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying compost and fertilizers

loans.name: Olga Sofía

texts.es:
La señora Sofía es socia del Banco Comunal “Dante Nava” del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 31 años de edad, es separada y madre de 2 hijos. 
Con su primer préstamo de S/. 500 compró combustibles para venderlos en su puesto de trabajo. Tiene casi un año trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que también se dedica a la venta de cigarrillos al por mayor y hace tejidos para vender.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará mayor cantidad de cigarrillos para vender en las fiestas de navidad y año nuevo. 
Ella desea continuar trabajando para llegar a tener su tienda propia.
texts.en:
Ms. Sofía C. is a member of the “Dante Nava” microfinance institute in the district, province and department of Puno. She is 31 years old, separated and has 2 children.

With her first 500.00 PEN loan, she purchased fuel to sell at her stand. She has been working with the microfinance institute for almost a year now, and she states that she is also a cigarette wholesaler and sells handwoven knitwear.

With this 1,500.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 4 monthly installments, she will purchase a greater quantity of cigarettes to sell during the Christmas and year-end festivities.

Ms. C. wishes to continue working so that she can one day open up her own store.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cigarettes

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia Ramírez Sáenz forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Yungainas al Progreso” D. la provincia D. Yungay.

Julia es casada, tiene 43 años y dos hijos, Julia comenta que todo le ha ido bien, que todos sus problemas han sido sencillos D. superar y que siempre ah contado con el apoyo D. su esposo y D. sus pequeños, siendo esto su mas granD. logro, tener una familia constituida y ya más D. 10 años D. casada, es así que Julia colabora con su esposo en el negocio, que es la venta D. carne en el mercado D. Yungay en el puesto n°10 , carne que compran del camal para luego venderlo directamente, ella menciona que ha bajado el negocio D. la carne, porque con el alza D. los precios ya los clientes ya no compran mucho este producto, pero D. todas maneras, ella afirma que seguirá aún con este negocio por ser un negocio que tiene junto a su esposo más D. 10 años.
 
Con este préstamo D. s/.800.00, que pagará en seis cuotas lo invertirá en la promoción D. su hijo.

Julia comenta que necesita saber sobre otros tipos u otras alternativas D. negocio para poder seguir trabajando y creciendo.
texts.en:
Julia Ramírez Sáenz is a member of the community bank “Mujeres Yungainas al Progreso” in the province of Yungay. Julia is married, 43 years old, and has 2 children. Julia says that everything has gone well, that she has overcome all her problems and that she has always been able to count on her husband's and children's support. She feels that having a tight-knit family is her greatest achievement, after 10 years of marriage. Julia works together with her husband in their business, which is the sale of meat in the Yungay market in stall # 10. They buy the meat to sell direct. She tells us that meat sales have slowed because of higher prices and customer no longer buy as much. Regardless, she tells us that she will continue in this business, which she has been doing for more than 10 years together with her husband. She will use the 800 soles loan for her son's graduation. Julia says that one needs to know about other businesses or other alternatives in order to continue working and growing.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For personal use:  to pay for her son's graduation expenses.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
La señora Valentina es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Unidas al Triunfo” del distrito, provincia y departamento. Tiene 57 años de edad, es separada y tiene 5 hijos mayores de edad. 
Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 compró mercadería para vender en su puesto de trabajo en el puerto. Tiene 18 ciclos trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que vive con su hija, su nieto y su yerno. 
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará panetones y demás mercadería para ser vendida en las fiestas de navidad.
Valentina desea continuar trabajando para apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Valentina is a member of the community bank “Mujeres Unidas al Triunfo” in the district, province, and department. She is 57 years old, separated, and has 5 adult children. With her first 300 soles loan, she bought merchandise to sell in her stall in the port. She has been working for 18 cycles with the community bank and says that she lives with her daughter, her grandson, and her son-in-law. With this 1,200 soles loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy panettones and more merchandise to sell during the Christmas holiday. Valentine wants to keep working in order to support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy panettones and other merchandise.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin es productor de leche de vaca, misma que es comercializada a la Empresa PIL (Planta Industrializadora de Leche); también cuenta con un carro con el que trabaja en su misma comunidad transportando alimentos para los ganados, por que en el sector no entra movilidad; la esposa colabora con el cuidado de los ganados. Edwin tiene dos hijos de 4 y 6 años de edad y vive con su familia en la comunidad Cotacota – Pucarani Provincia Los Andes a una dos y media de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de una vaca lechera de mediana  calidad, lo cual que le ayudará para mayor producción de leche, y en consecuencia un mejoramiento de sus ingresos.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica a Edwin para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Edwin is a producer of cow's milk, which is sold in the PIL business (Industrialized Milk Plant). He also has a car with which he works in his own community transporting feed for cattle because mobility is limited in his area. His wife works with him in tending the cattle. Edwin has two children of 4 and 6 years of age and lives with his family in the community Cotacota-Pucarani in the Andes Province about an hour and a half from El Alto. The loan will be used fro the purchase of a milk cow of average quality, which will help him to improve milk production, and consequently improve his income. This is his first loan from Impro, whose evaluation showed Edwin qualified to receive the loan he is requesting.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela es productora de leche de vaca; tiene dos vacas de cuya producción de leche provienen sus ingresos con los que cubre su manutención y estudios universitarios. Vive en la casa de sus padres en la comunidad Muruamaya- Viacha Provincia Ingavi a dos horas de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de una vaquilla para su posterior producción de leche.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del prestamos solicitado.
texts.en:
Mariela is a producer of cow's milk. She has two cows, whose milk production provides income which covers the cost of living and university studies for her children. She lives in her parents' home in the community of Muruamaya- Viacha Province Ingavi, about 2 hours from the city of El Alto. The loan will be used to purchase one female calf for its later production of milk. This is her first credit with Impro, her evaluation showed that she is qualified to receive the loan she is requesting.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle.

loans.name: Eloy Julio

texts.es:
Eloy es chofer propietario de un taxi mismo que trabaja como trufi interciudad La Paz – El Alto. Esta es su principal fuente de ingreso con la que cubre la manutención de su familia. Eloy vive en casa alquilada ubicada en  la Zona Alto San Pedro Ciudad de La Paz.
 
El préstamo lo destinará la reparación de su herramienta de trabajo (taxi) para poder continuar prestando servicio de transporte publico.
 
Es segundo crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago le permite solicitar otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Eloy is a chauffeur and has his own taxi that he uses for transport between La Paz and El Alto. This is his principal source of income with which he covers the cost of living for his family. Eloy lives in a rented house located in the Alto San Pedro Zone in the city of La Paz. The loan he is requesting will be used for repairing his taxi in order to be able to continue providing service as a public transport. This is his second loan with Impro, his good payment history allowed him to request another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance of his Taxi

loans.name: Safiétou

texts.fr: Safiétou Mané, 48 ans, mariée  mère de 02 enfants à sa charge est membre du banc villageois de Kandé Alassane depuis 8 ans. Elle veut acheter un réfrigérateur, des sacs de pain de singe (fruit du baobab), du sucre pour  préparer et vendre des glaces, des jus et des crèmes glacées. Son souhait est de renforcer son activité afin d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.  Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Safiétou Mané, age 48, is married and the mother of two children who are in her care. She has been a member of the village loan group of Kandé Alassane for eight years and wants to buy a refrigerator, sacks of "monkey bread" (the fruit of the baobab tree), and some sugar to make and sell ice, juices, and ice cream. Her wish is to bolster her business to improve her family's living conditions. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator, baobab fruit, and sugar to make ice, juices and ice cream

loans.name: Willy

texts.es:
Willy es chofer propietario de un taxi que trabaja como trufi inter-ciudad La Paz – El Alto, la esposa es comerciante de masitas que  comercializa en las ferias populares. Estas dos actividades se convierten  en sus principales fuentes de ingreso. Viven en casa de la hermana de Willy, ubicada en  la Zona Exaltación de la Ciudad de El Alto.
 
El préstamo lo destinará la reparación de su herramienta de trabajo (taxi) para poder continuar prestando servicio de transporte publico.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación socio económica realizada permite aprobarle el préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Willy is an owner-driver of a taxi who has a route between the cities of La Paz and El Alto. His wife sells cookies at local fairs. These two activities are their main source of income. They live in Willy's sister's home, in the neighbourhood of Zona Exaltación in El Alto. The loan will be use to repair the taxi in order to continue to be able to offer public transportation services. This is his first loan with Impro; the socio-economic evaluation results qualify Willy for the loan requested.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To do maintenance on his taxi.

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr: Astou F., veuve est membre du banc villageois de Kandé Alassane depuis 7 ans et demi. Elle veut acheter de l’huile de palme, de la pâte d’arachide, des bidons et des seaux pour renforcer son petit commerce. Les produits sont achetés à Yarang et revendu à Ziguinchor. Elle vend aussi  des cacahuètes à tout moment. Elle participe aux dépenses familiales et contribue au bien être de sa famille. Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Astou F. is a widow. She has been a member of the village loan group of Kandé Alassane for seven and a half years and wants to buy some palm oil, peanut butter, containers, and buckets to bolster her modest business. Goods are purchased in Yarang and are resold in Ziguinchor. Astou also sells peanuts anytime. She is helping to cover family expenses and contributes to the well-being of her family. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in palm oil and peanut butter

loans.name: Miriam Francisca

texts.es:
Miriam, como muchas mujeres bolivianas, es madre soltera de tres hijos de 18, 9 y 6 años de edad; el esposo la abandonó hace cinco años y ella se convirtió  en padre y madre de sus hijos. Miriam trabaja como comerciante de víveres y también tiene una tienda donde confecciona polleras y mantas para cholitas. Vive en la casa de su padre ubicada en la zona Villa Ingenio – Rio Seco, de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de materia prima (telas) para confeccionar mayor cantidad de polleras y mantas, pues esta actividad es la que le genera mayores ingresos.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada permite la aprobación del préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Miriam, like many Bolivian women, is a single mother of three children, ages 6, 9 and 18; her husband abandoned her five years ago and she became both mother and father to her children. Miriam sells food and also has a shop where she makes traditional gathered skirts and shawls for mestizo women. Miriam lives with her father in a house located in the Villa Ingenio–Rio Seco area of El Alto. The loan is for the purchase of fabric for making high quality skirts and shawls, as this is the business that generates most of her income. This is her first loan with Impro. After an assessment she was approved for the loan she had requested.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca inició el negocio porqué siempre le ha gustado el comercio, además de que por donde vive no había quien vendiera verduras lo cual la motivó a empezar a venderlas y poco a poco ha ido agregando más productos. Comenzó  en Agosto de 1992,  a vender verduras desde que llego a su actual domicilio, posteriormente abrió una tiendita, pero por cuestiones de una enfermedad tuvo que cerrarla y quedarse solamente con el negocio de las verduras. Hoy en día de nuevo ha comenzado a levantar su tiendita y ya la tiene más surtida.

Ella necesita un préstamo por MXN $5,000 que pagara en 10 catorcenas  para comprar más verduras y abarrotes que le permitan tener bien surtida su tienda para este mes de diciembre en que las ventas aumentan por motivo de las fiestas navideñas.
texts.en:
Francisca started her business because she has always liked commerce. Also, because in the area that she lives there was no one that sells any produce and that motivated her to start selling it and slowly, she has been adding more products. She started selling produce on August 1992 as soon as she arrived at her current address. Lately, she opened a small shop but due to health reasons, she had to close it and only stayed with the produce business. Today, she has started again to build up her small shop and provide it with more assorted products.

She needs a $375 loan to buy more produce and groceries that will allow her to keep the shop with a good assortment of products during the month of December when the sales increase due to the holiday festivities.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama T., 43 ans, mariée  mère de 07 enfants dont deux filles déjà mariées est membre du banc villageois de Kandé Alassane depuis 8 ans. Elle veut acheter des tissus teintés, des bijoux, de l’huile de palme et des poissons séchés pour renforcer son commerce. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer à la charge familiale Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Mariama T., age 43, is married and the mother of seven children, including two daughters who are already married. She has been a member of the village loan group Kandé Alassane for eight years and wants to buy some dyed fabrics, jewelry, palm oil, and dried fish to bolster her commerce. Her income enables her to help cover family expenses. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in dyed cloth, palm oil, and dried fish

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.es:
El señor Joaquín González Matinez vive en casa de sus padres, en la zona  de Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz, con su hijo.
El señor Joaquín trabaja como costurero en su taller, elaborando buzos deportivos que comercializa a los comerciantes minoristas de La Paz.
Requiere el crédito para el incremento de capital ya que la compra de tela en poca cantidad le significa un costo mayor de producción y sus ganancias se minimizan.
Esta es la quinta vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califican favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. Joaquín González Matinez lives with his son in his parents' house in the Sopocachi neighborhood of La Paz. Joaquin makes athletic clothing in his workshop, which he then sells to retailers in La Paz. Joaquin needs this loan for working capital, since when he buys fabric in small quantities his production costs increase and his profits decrease.

This is the fifth time Joaquin has requested a loan from IMPRO, and he has received a good credit score following a socioeconomic analysis, so he qualifies for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric in bulk

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
Ignacio inicio  el negocio ya que  requería  de una actividad económica redituable para asegurar que su hijos pudieran tener una educación universitaria como el deseo que el tenia. Comenzó el negocio en Marzo de 1995  era ayudante en su juventud de un taller de vidriería y   cuando se caso se vio en la necesidad de independizarse y tener su propio taller gracias a su empleo anterior el ya tenia muchos clientes potenciales que conocían de la calidad de su trabajo y esto le a facilitado las cosas para tener un negocio de éxito. 

El necesita un préstamo por MXN $5000 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar una mayor cantidad de mercancía para atender un mayor numero de clientes y ampliar su mercado.
texts.en:
Ignacio started his business in order make enough money to ensure that his children would have the opportunity to get a college education, which he wishes he had had. He started his business in March of 1995. In his youth he was an assistant at a glass workshop and when he got married he saw the need to be independent and have his own workshop. Thanks to his previous work he had many potential clients who knew the quality of his work. This has helped him to build a very successful business.

Ignacio needs a loan for $5,000 MXN, which he will repay in 6 months. With the loan he will purchase a larger quantity of supplies so that he can work with more customers and grow his business.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
El señor Jesús Q. Q. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Pasankeri, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con sus dos hijos ya que su esposa falleció.
El señor Jesús comercializa llamas que compra en la región del altiplano y los vende en una población distante a dos días arreando el ganado.
El crédito es para la compra de una mayor cantidad de llamas pues no cuenta con suficiente capital para que le salga ganancias que le permitan subsistir.
Esta es la tercera vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califican favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Jesús Q. Q. Lives in his own home in the Pasankeri neighborhood on the west side of the city of La Paz. He is a widower and lives with his two children.

Jesus sells llamas, which he buys in the highlands of western Bolivia. He then shepherds the herd of llamas to a town two days away, where he sells them. This loan will be used to buy more llamas, since Jesus doesn't have enough investment money to earn enough to live on.

This is the third time Jesus has requested a loan from IMPRO. He has received a good credit score following a socioeconomic analysis, so he qualifies to receive this credit.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more llamas

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Marcela es madre de 3 hijos: Patricia de 39 años, Jesús de 36 años y Coral de 33 años, todos adultos.
Ella inició el negocio en Abril de 2003 porqué necesitaba tener un ingreso para sostenerse ella y una hija que tenía muy enferma ya que hace mas de cinco años su esposo los abandonó y dejo de ayudarles. Lamentablemente su hija murió tiempo después inicio el negocio gracias a una vecina que la animó a que vendiera productos de belleza ya que ella le decía que estos productos siempre tienen una buena demanda. Poco a poco fue progresando porque sus clientes fueron aumentando al igual que sus ganancias y al día de hoy le va bien. Además de la venta de cosméticos en esta temporada navideña ella elabora manualidades alusivas a la navidad con lo que incrementa un poco más sus ganancias.

Ella necesita un préstamo por MXN $10,000 que pagara en 12 catorcenas para comprar cosméticos y materia prima para la elaboración de sus que le permitirán atender los pedidos que tiene de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Marcela is a mother of three children: Patricia of 39 years, Jesús of 36 years and Coral of 33 years, all of whom are adults. She started her business in April of 2003 because she needed sufficient income to support herself and one of her daughters, who was very sick and whose husband abandoned and stopped supporting them over five years ago. Sadly, her daughter died a short while after she started her business. She started selling beauty products after being encouraged to sell them by a neighbor who said that there was always a good demand for beauty products. Little by little she made progress as she increased her customer base as well as her income, which is still progressing to this day.
