She sells juices, fruit extracts and vegetables, and her business is located in the city’s Central Market, where she serves her customers. With this loan for S/. 3,000, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy fresh fruits such as bananas, pineapples, papayas, sacks of sugar, milk, dark beer, soda pop and the consumables needed to make breakfast dishes such as sandwiches, Juanes fried rice and other dishes. She wants to be stocked with what she needs in order to take care of her customers well. Elsa lives with her husband and 3 children. She is 34 years old and has been working with the Communal Bank for 7 years. She is content with the support she receives. Her goal is to expand her business and for her children to grow up to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fresh fruits such as bananas, pineapples, papayas, sacks of sugar, milk, dark beer, soda pop and other consumables

loans.name: Elvina

texts.es:
La señora Elvina, socia del BC “Los Jazmines”, vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia y distrito de Moyobamba. Tiene 61 años de edad,  es madre de 05 hijos quienes ya son independientes. Se dedica a la venta de menestras sancochadas y mote en un puesto en el mercado central de la ciudad.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará diferentes variedades de frijoles como huasca, canario, pinto entre otros, así como maíz para mote para sancocharlos y venderlos al menudeo, también comprara leche en grandes cantidades para la preparación de quesos y satisfacer los gustos de sus clientes.  

Elvina es una mujer muy trabajadora que quiere crecer en su negocio, desea más adelante surtir su negocio con mayor variedad de productos a ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Elvina is a member of the Community Bank “Los Jazmines” (The Jasmines). She lives in the San Martín region, province and district of Moyobamba. She is 61 years old and has 5 children who are already independent. She sells stews in a shop at the city central market. She will use this $1000 loan, which will be paid off in 6 months, to purchase different varieties of local beans, such as huasca, canario, pinto among others, as well as corn for stews and beans in packages for retail sale. She will also buy milk in bulk to make cheese and so satisfy her customer’s remand. Elvina is a hard working woman that wants to see her business grow. She would like to be able to offer a larger variety of products to her customers in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase different varieties of local beans, such as huasca, canario, pinto and others to make stews

loans.name: Exsilda

texts.es:
La señora Exsilda, socia del BC “Santa Ana”, vive en la Región San Martín Provincia y distrito Moyabamba, se dedica a la venta de  abarrotes en general y frutas y su negocio está ubicado en su propia casa.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será cancelado en 06 meses, comprará  productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar en saco, detergentes de diferentes marcas, conservas, leche en cajas, artículos de higiene personal y otros productos que requiere para surtir su negocio y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.

Exilda tiene 62 años de edad y es madre de 06 hijos. Ahora vive con su esposo quien se dedica a la agricultura. Está agradecida con el apoyo brindado porque le permite crecer en su negocio. Su meta es arreglar su casa para darle seguridad a su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Exsilda is a member of the Santa Ana Communal Bank. She lives in the San Martín Region, in the Province and district of Moyabamba. She sells groceries in general and fruit. Her business is located in her own house.

With this loan for $350 (S/.1,000), she will buy basic necessities such as rice, sacks of sugar, different brands of detergents, canned goods, boxed milk, personal hygiene products and other products she needs to stock her business and satisfy her customers' needs. The loan will be repaid in 6 months.

Exsilda is 62 years old and the mother of 6 children. Now she lives with her husband who works in agriculture. She is thankful for the support given to her because it allows her to build up her business. Her goal is to fix her house to provide security for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sacks of sugar, detergents, canned goods, boxed milk, personal hygiene products and other products.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
La señorita Gabriela es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen de Cancharani” de la provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno. Tiene 41 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de 5 hijos. Con su primer préstamo de S/. 500 compró insumos para su negocio de comidas preparadas. Tiene casi 3 años  trabajando con el banco. Nos cuenta que su negocio ha crecido y ahora también vende miel y almanaques.
Con este préstamo de S/.1500 que pagará en 6 cuotas, lo usará para comercializar adornos de navidad.
Gabriela desea continuar trabajando para construir su casa y tener su propio local para vender miel.
texts.en:
Gabriela is a member of the Community Bank “Virgen de Cancharani” of the province and department of Puno. She is 41 years old. She lives with her partner and has 5 children. She used her first $150 loan to purchase supplies of her business of home made food. She has been working with the bank for almost 3 years. She comments that her managed to diversify her business so she is currently also selling honey and calendars. She will use this new loan of $500, which will be paid off in 6 months, to purchase Christmas ornaments. Gabriela wishes to continue working to save money to build her home and buy her own store where she could sell honey.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Christmas ornaments.

loans.name: Gema

texts.es:
La señora Gema, socia del BC “MUJERES AUDACES”, vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia y distrito de Moyobamba, se dedica a la venta de comida tipo menú y su negocio está ubicado en su propia casa, lugar donde diariamente acuden gran cantidad de clientes por la buena sazón y trato que les brinda. 

Con este crédito de S/ 3,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará insumos como arroz, azúcar en saco, aceite en galón, fideos y otros que necesita para la preparación de sus platos a ofertar a sus clientes. También quiere hacer algunos arreglos a su local como pintarlo y comprar mesas y sillas.

Gema es una mujer perseverante y muy amigable, tiene 39 años de edad, vive con sus dos hijos, quienes la impulsan a esforzarse cada día más y con su esposo. Desea para el futuro contar con un recreo turístico y vender comidas típicas de la región.
texts.en:
Gema, a member of the communal bank, Bold Women, lives in the San Martin region, in the province and district of Moyobamba. She sells meals out of her own home, a place where a large number of customers visit every day for the great seasoning (in the food) and the good service that Gema offers. With this loan of $1,000, which will be paid back in six months, she will buy ingredients like rice, sacks of sugar, gallons of cooking oil, pasta, and other things that she needs to prepare her meals to offer her customers. She also wants to do a few things around her house/business, such as paint it and buy tables and chairs. Gema is a persevering woman and very friendly. She is 39 years old and lives with her two children who inspire her to work hard every day. She also lives with her husband. In the future, she would like to have tourism-related business and sell food typical to the region.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, pasta, and other ingredients

loans.name: Grimanesa

texts.es:
La señora Grimanesa, socia del BC “Santa Ana”, vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia y distrito de Moyobamba, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de cecina y chorizo de cerdo, así como a la venta de carne fresca de cerdo, además tiene dos puestos de venta en el mercado central de la ciudad.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual será cancelado en 06 meses, comprará  cerdos de diferentes tamaños para luego sacrificarlos y preparar sus productos y así poder atender los pedidos que le hacen sus clientes, también quiere arreglar su casa y el ambiente donde prepara la cecina y chorizo que vende.

La señora Grimanesa  tiene 62 años de edad,  es madre de 07 hijos quienes ya son independientes, ahora vive con una de ellas quien la apoya en sus actividades y sobre todo la acompaña. Está agradecida con el apoyo brindado porque le permite crecer en su negocio. Su meta es arreglar bien su casa para poner su negocio.
texts.en:
Grimanesa, member of the Saint Ann Communal Bank, lives in the San Martin Region, in the province and district of Moyobamba. She cooks and sells pork jerky and sausage, as well as sells fresh pork. She has two booths at the central market in the city. With this loan of $675, which will be paid back in six months, she will buy different size pigs to butcher and prepare for her products so that she will be able to meet her customers' orders. She also wants to fix up her house and the area where she prepares the jerky and sausage that she sells. Grimanesa is 62 years old. She is the mother of seven children who are already grown. She now lives with one of her daughters who helps her with her work and accompanies her with everything. She is grateful for the loan because it will allow her to grow her business. Her goal is to fix up her home for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pigs and fix up the area where she prepares jerky and sausage

loans.name: Janeth Del Pilar

texts.es:
La señora Janeth del Pilar es socia del BC “El Alto Mayo”, vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia y distrito de Rioja. Se dedica a la venta de artículos de mercería como vinchas, esmaltes, correas, ganchos, pulseras, colets y juguetes. Su negocio está ubicado en su puesto en el mercado Grau de la ciudad.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 06 meses, comprará   aretes, collares, esmaltes, vinchas y todo tipo de juguetes para surtir bien su negocio y contar con lo necesario para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.

Janeth del Pilar tiene 35 años de edad, vive con su esposo y tiene dos hijos que son estudiantes y quienes la ayudan en atender el negocio. Su meta es surtir más su negocio para que no le falten ventas.
texts.en:
Janeth del Pilar is a member of the Alto Mayo Communal Bank. She lives in the San Martin Region, in the province and district of Rioja. She sells merchandise such as hair clips, nail polish, belts, bracelets, and toys. Her business is located in a booth at the Grau Market in the city. With this loan of $350, which will be paid back in six months, she will buy earrings, necklaces, nail polish, hair clips, and all sorts of toys to stock up her business and have everything necessary for satisfying her customers' needs. Janeth del Pilar is 35 years old. She lives with her husband and has two children who are in school and who help her run the business. Her goal is to stock up her business so she doesn't lose sales.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase earrings, necklaces, nail polish, hair clips, and toys for her inventory

loans.name: Lita

texts.es:
La señora Lita, socia del BC “El Alto Mayo”, vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia y distrito de Rioja. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general y su negocio está ubicado en un lugar alquilado en una calle céntrica de la ciudad, lugar donde acuden a diario sus clientes.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual será cancelado en 06 meses, comprará  algunos productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar en saco, aceite de diferentes tamaños y marcas, conservas y detergentes de diferentes marcas, leche evaporada, artículos de higiene personal y bebidas heladas con la finalidad de satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.

Lita tiene 29 años de edad, vive con su hijo y su esposo quien la apoya en su negocio. Está agradecida con el apoyo brindado porque le permite crecer en su negocio. Su meta es seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Lita, a member of the Alto Mayo Communal Bank, lives in the San Martin Region, in the province and district of Rioja. She sells groceries, and her business is located in a rented space on the city's main street, where her customers visit daily. With this loan of $1,000, which will be paid back in six months, she will buy needed products such as rice, sacks of sugar, different size bottles and brands of cooking oil, canned food, different brands of detergent, evaporated milk, personal hygiene items, and cold drinks so that she can meet her customers' needs. Lita is 29 years old. She lives with her husband, who helps her with the business. She is grateful for this loan because it will allow her to grow her business. Her goal is to continue growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sacks of sugar, different size bottles and brands of cooking oil, canned food, different brands of detergent, evaporated milk, personal hygiene items, and cold drinks

loans.name: Lilia Esther

texts.es:
La señora Lilia Esther, socia del Banco Comunal “El Alto Mayo”, vive en el Departamento de San Martín, provincia y distrito de Rioja, se dedica a  la  venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, zapatillas y artículos de regalos. Su negocio está ubicado en su propia casa, lugar donde llegan sus clientes.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700, el cual será cancelado en 06 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños como polos, blusas, camisas, pantalones y juguetes para aprovechar las fiestas de navidad y  poder satisfacer así los requerimientos de sus clientes.

Tiene 41 años de edad, es madre de 05 hijos, 2 de ellos todavía están a su cargo y quienes son su motor para seguir trabajando. Su meta es mantener bien surtido su negocio.
texts.en:
Lilia Esther, member of the Alto Mayo Communal Bank, lives in the San Martin Region, in the province and district of Rioja. She sells clothing for women, men, and children, as well as sneakers and gift items. Her business is located in her own home, where her customers visit. With this loan of $575, which will be paid back in six months, she will purchase women's, men's, and children's clothes such as polo shirts, blouses, button-up shirts, and pants, as well as toys to have on hand for the Christmas holiday and to be able to satisfy her customers' demands. She is 41 years old and the mother of five, two of whom are still in her care and who are her inspiration to continue working. Her goal is to keep her business well stocked.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase women's, men's, and children's clothes such as polo shirts, blouses, button-up shirts, pants, as well as toys

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: 2 scroll saws, 3 dozen, large padlocks, 1 dozen jeans, 1 dozen camouflage pants, and 1 dozen large files.

loans.name: Lorfia

texts.es:
La señora Lorfia, socia del BC “Santa Ana”, vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia y distrito Moyabamba. Se dedica a la venta de  abarrotes y frutas y su negocio está ubicado en su propia casa.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual será cancelado en 06 meses, comprará  productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar en saco, detergentes de diferentes marcas, conservas, leche en cajas, artículos de higiene personal, frutas y demás productos que requiere para surtir su negocio y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.

Lorfia tiene 33 años de edad, es madre de 02 hijas quienes son su razón de lucha diaria. Está agradecida con el apoyo brindado porque le permite crecer en su negocio. Su meta es crecer en su negocio llegar a surtirlo más y arreglar su casa  para darle seguridad a su negocio.
texts.en:
Lorfia, member of the Saint Ann Communal Bank, lives in the San Martin Region, in the province and district of Moyabamba. She sells groceries and fruit out of her own home. With this loan of $500, which will be paid back in six months, she will buy needed items such as rice, sacks of sugar, different brands of detergent, canned food, cartons of milk, personal hygiene items, fruits, and other items needed to stock up her business and satisfy her customers' needs. Lorfia is 33 years old. She is the mother of two girls who are her reason for fighting each day. She is grateful for this loan because it will allow her to grow her business. Her goal is to grow her business, stock it better, and fix up her home to ensure her business' safety.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sacks of sugar, different brands of detergent, canned food, cartons of milk, personal hygiene items, fruits, and other items

loans.name: Jose Benito

texts.es:
El Nombre del Señor José Benito B. M. tiene la edad de 51 años, su estado civil es casado, Don José tiene 1 hija su edad es de 29 años y labora como docente de primaria, su compañera de vida labora en una tienda llamada Brodway, sus propósitos son invertir en materia prima para obtener mas productos ya que esto es muy importante para el ya que necesita realizar la elaboración de los productos que los clientes le pidan sus deseos son que su negocio sea el mejor de todos ya que hay mucha demanda a lo  que el se dedica y sus sueños son de darle un mejor mantenimiento a su negocio ya que por lo que los clientes tendrían mayor interés en su tienda y así podría ofertar mejor su producto.


La actividad económica a la que se dedica es joyero en lo que realiza el siguiente trabajo anillos, pulsera, cadenas, chapas, la ubicación de su negocio es de la iglesia el calvario 1 cuadra y media abajo, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 2 años, sus inicios se dan a la edad de 16 años y mas tarde decide ingresar a un taller y al paso del tiempo decide instalar su mismo negocio e inicia con las siguientes herramientas una mesa, sopletes y balanza por lo que se decide instalar este negocio y obtuvo clientes por algunos amigos que le conocían y estos hicieron que Don José tuviera fama con su joyería por lo que fue algo muy difícil de lograr pero con el apoyo de su familias y amistades lo hizo realidad, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita la compra del material como lo es el oro y tiene que buscar donde se lo oferten de forma mas factible para realizar cada uno de sus productos.
texts.en:
Mr. José Benito B. M. is 51-years old and married. He has a 29-year old daughter who works as an elementary school teacher and his wife works at a store called Brodway. Mr. Jose intends to invest in raw materials for his products. This is very important, as there is already high demand for his work, and he hopes to improve his business and better maintain his store to attract more customers. He works as a jeweler, making rings, bracelets, necklaces, and earrings in a workshop one and a half blocks from the Calvario church. Mr. José has owned his business for 2 years; he began working at age 16, later taking a job in a workshop and after some time deciding to set up his own business. Starting with only a table, blowtorch, scale, and a few customers acquired through friends, Mr. José built the reputation of his jewelry shop with much difficulty but with the support of his family and friends. This loan will finance working capital to buy raw materials at the best prices, such as the gold used in his fine work.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for raw materials

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Fidela

texts.es:
La señora Fidela es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen D. Cancharani” D. la provincia D. Puno, en el departamento D. Puno. Tiene 56 años D. edad, es casada y madre D. 3 hijos. Con su primer préstamo D. S/. 500 compró triciclos. Tiene casi 3 años  trabajando con el banco. Nos cuenta que compró triciclos y tiene locales alquilados en su casa.
Con este préstamo D. S/.1500 que pagará en 6 cuotas comprará más triciclos y aumentar su negocio.
Fidela desea continuar trabajando para tener una librería.
texts.en:
Fidela is a member of the Virgin of Cancharani Communal Bank in the province and district of Puno. She is 56 years old, married, and the mother of three. With her first loan of ~$165, she bought tricycles. She has been working with this bank for almost three years. She tells us that she bought tricycles and rents rooms in her home. With this loan of $500, which will be paid back in six installments, she will buy more tricycles to expand her business. Fidela wants to continue working so she can have a bookstore.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tricycles

loans.name: Susana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Susana  inició su negocio porque con el ingreso que recibía como empleada no era  posible cubrir  sus gastos, junto a su hermano decidieron poner una pequeña tienda de abarrotes para cubrir las necesidades básicas de la familia.  Comenzó el negocio en enero del 2003, empezaron en el local en el que están ahora, originalmente solo vendían refrescos y botanas, con un poco de abarrotes. Ahora la venta principal son los abarrotes, y desean agregar la venta de  salchichonería y lácteos. Desde que inicio la tienda a la fecha ha ido incrementando los  clientes gracias la buen servicio que brindan.


Ella necesita un préstamo por MXN $4,500 que pagara en 6 meses para  adquirir más mercancía que le permitirá abarcar otro tipo de mercado o clientes, lo cual incrementara los ingresos y mejorara la imagen de la tienda.
texts.en:
Susana started her business because the money she earned as a domestic worker wasn’t enough to cover her living expenses. Together with her brother, she decided to set up a small grocery store to pay for their family’s basic needs. They began the store in January of 2003, in the same location it is in today, originally selling only soda, snacks, and a few grocery items. They now sell mostly groceries and wish to add a delicatessen and dairy products to the store. Since opening, the grocery store has attracted more and more customers thanks to good customer service. Susana needs a loan of 4,500 MXN, which she will pay back in 6 months, to buy merchandise that will meet all of her customers’ needs. These additional sales will both increase income and improve the store’s reputation.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
La señora Felicitas es socia del Banco Comunal “Dante Nava” de la provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno. Tiene 42 años de edad, es soltera  y  madre de 7 hijos. Con su primer  préstamo de S/. 300 compró  productos naturistas. Tiene casi 2 años trabajando con el banco. Nos cuenta que apoya a sus hijos.
Con este préstamo de S/. 600 que pagará en 4 cuotas comprará  productos naturistas.
Felicitas  desea continuar trabajando para que sus hijos terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Felicitas is a member of the Community Bank “Dante Nava” in the province and department of Puno. She is 42 years old. She is single and has 7 children and she is her only financial support. She used her first $100 loan to purchase natural products. She has been working with the bank for almost 2 years. She will use this $200 loan, which will be paid off in 4 months to purchase more natural products. Felicitas wants to continue working to support her children so they can finish school.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase natural products

loans.name: Flor De Vida Group

texts.es:
La asociación denominada “Flor de vida” pertenece a la familia de  Pro-Mujer hace más de cuatro años , esta  se encuentra en la zona de villa Adela, de la ciudad de El Alto, a la fecha  cuenta con 15 miembros y han demostrado ser un grupo organizado en cuanto a sus cuotas de crédito.
Dentro el grupo la mayoría tienen hijos, casi todos en edad escolar, intentan ofrecer a sus hijos además de una  educación básica, estudios universitarios para así asegurarles un mejor futuro. 
Además de la artesanía en ropa, actividad a la que se dedica Zenobia, la mayor parte de la asociación de dedica al comercio en general,  venden verduras en el mercado central de la Ceja de El Alto, otras de las socias son vivanderas. Todas necesitan mayor capital para ampliar sus negocios, considerando que esta época del año aumenta su clientela.
texts.en:
The “Flor de Vida” association (‘Flower of Life’) has been a part of the Pro-Mujer family for more than 4 years. It is located in the Villa Adela region of El Alto city and currently has 15 members, who have proved themselves very organized in regards to their timely loan payments. The majority of the group members have children, most of school age, and they try to provide both basic and higher education opportunities to their children for a better future. Besides Zenobia’s work making handicrafts and artisanal clothing, the other members have different small businesses, selling vegetables in the Ceja de El Alto central market or working as street vendors. All need more capital to expand their businesses, especially since they have more customers during this time of year.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to expand business

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
La señora Eusebia es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Villa del Lago II” del distrito de Puno, provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno. Tiene 25 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de 3 hijos menores a los que apoya económicamente. Eusebia con el primer préstamo de S/ 300 compró ropa y artículos de segundo uso para vender en su puesto de trabajo. Tiene casi 2 años trabajando con el banco. Nos cuenta que con lo ganado con los préstamos ha ganado lo suficiente para comprarse un auto y una motocicleta.
Con este préstamo de S/. 3000, el cual pagará en 4 cuotas comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería para venderla en su puesto.
Eusebia desea continuar trabajando para  comprarse otro auto.
texts.en:
Eusebia is a member of the Community Bank “Mujeres de Villa del Lago II” (Women of the Lake Village II) of the district, province and department of Puno. She is 25 years old. She lives with her partner and 3 small dependent children. With her first loan of $100 she purchased clothes and second hand items to sell at her shop. She has been working with the community bank for 2 years and she tells us that with the money obtained and the loans she received the got enough money to purchase a car and a motorbike. With this $1,000 loan, that will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase more products to sell at her shop. Eusebia would like to keep working to be able to purchase a second car.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de ropa de segunda mano.

loans.name: Pablo Emilio

texts.es:
El microempresario Pablo Emilio Malespín Narváez tiene 64 años de edad, es casado con 3 hijos todos mayores de edad y viven en sus propios hogares. El señor Malespín se dedica a la actividad de fotógrafo desde hace 35 años aproximadamente y con esta actividad a podido darle el estudio a sus hijos así como una profesión.

Por el tiempo que tiene de dedicarse a la actividad de fotógrafo el señor Malespín tiene una buena cantidad de clientes quienes lo buscan para actividades de cumpleaños, matrimonios, bautizos, promociones entre otras actividades que los blufileños tradicionalmente celebran y que buscan como guardar esos recuerdos.

Sin embargo por la inconsistencia de los precios del material se requiere comprar en cantidades para de esa manera poder mantener el precio estable por cada fotografía.  Por tal razón requiere del financiamiento para la compra de los siguientes productos:

60 rollos de película 135x36 a US$ 4 dólares cada rollo, 20 cajas de película polaroid a US$ 25 dólares cada caja de película, 5 unidades de tinta para impresora a US$ 30 dólares cada unidad y 5 docenas de baterías AA a US$ 22 dólares cada docena.
texts.en:
Micro-entrepreneur Pablo Emilio Malespín Narváez is 64 years old. He is married and has three children that are already independent. Mr. Malespín has been a photographer for over 35 years, activity that allowed his to pay for his children’s education. After all this time devoted to this profession, Mr. Malespín has acquired a vast clientele that requests for his services for birthday parties, weddings, baptisms, promotions and other reunions traditionally celebrated by the blufileños (inhabitants of Bluefields, Nicaragua) so they can save their memories. However, due to the inconsistency in the price of the material he needs to purchase large amounts of products to maintain a stable price for his services. This is the reason why he is looking for financing to purchase the following items: 60 135x36 film rolls at a price of $ 4 each, 20 Polaroid film boxes at $ 25 each, 5 units of printer ink at $ 30 each and 5 dozens of AA batteries at $ 22 each dozen.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 60 135x36 film rolls at a price of $ 4 each, 20 Polaroid film boxes at $ 25 each, 5 units of printer ink at $ 30 each and 5 dozens of AA batteries at $ 22 each dozen.

loans.name: San Gabriel Group

texts.es: En la zona de villa Tejada, se encuentra ubicado el centro focal del mismo nombre, a este pertenece la asociación “San Gabriel “.Un grupo muy simpático y particular formado por catorce mujeres que trabajan de manera organizada hace mucho tiempo.  Las actividades que realiza la asociación, son de todo tipo, una de  ellas tiene una pensión, donde ofrece almuerzos todos los días, también se  dedican a venta de relojes y otros accesorios; venta de mandiles, venta de ropa y otros. Ahora por las fiestas navideñas, además de la venta tradicional de sus productos, quieren vender adornos navideños, focos y otros productos que sean fácilmente comercializados por estas fechas.Por lo que necesitan mayor capital para la compra de mercadería, para  poder ampliar sus negocios y generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
There is a center in the villa Tejada area that goes by the same name. It pertains to the San Gabriel Association, a charming group comprised of fourteen women who have been working in an organized manner for a long time. The members of the association partake in different business activities. One of them has a guesthouse in which she offers lunch everyday, other members sell watches and other accessories, while still other members sell aprons, clothing and other goods. Because of the holiday season, they want to sell Christmas ornaments, lights, and other products that are easily sold this season. They need more capital to purchase merchandise so that they can expand their businesses and increase their profits.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es: Agustina tiene 52 años, es madre soltera, vive con sus dos hijas menores de edad. Se dedica a su tiendita de abarrotes que abrió hace 8 años a base de mucho esfuerzo, ya que en su hogar tuvo que ser padre y madre y afrontar sola las dificultades de la vida, pero gracias a su gran capacidad para los negocios y las ventas tuvo grandes oportunidades que supo aprovechar y así obtuvo la tiendita que tanto quería a la cual se dedica íntegramente, sin descuidarla, estando siempre abierta frente a las demandas de sus vecinos, las cuales hay que aprovechar y brindar una atención de calidad es su prioridad, logrando rentabilidad en su negocio a pesar de los costosos precios de las mercaderías. Agustina está en su tercer préstamo con MFP, y siempre ha sido una clienta muy responsable y entusiasta dentro de su grupo, ya que motivaba a las socias frente a situaciones difíciles. Con el dinero que solicita implementará la mercadería para su tienda y así convertirla en una de las más competitivas dentro de su localidad.
texts.en:
Agustina is a 52-year-old single mother who lives with her two underage daughters. Eight years ago, after much effort, she opened up her own general store because she had to be both the mother and father of the household, facing the difficulties of life on her own. However, thanks to her great business abilities, she was able to take advantage of the opportunities that came her way. Thus, she obtained the general store she had always wanted. She is fully dedicated to her shop; she never neglects it and keeps it open to meet her neighbors’ demands. Customer service is her priority, and she manages to make hers a lucrative business despite the high prices. This is Agustina’s third loan with MFP, and she has always been a very responsible and enthusiastic client in her group since she motivates the other members to face adversity. With the money that she is requesting, she will obtain more goods for her store, thus making it one of the most competitive shops in her locality.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods for general store

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 29 años, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos. Hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de quesos que compra en comunidades alejadas para luego traerlos a las ciudades y venderlos en los mercados, dentro de su labor, lo que más le agrada realizar es la comercialización, y lo tedioso es ir a los pueblos lejanos. Pero de todas maneras esta actividad es muy rentable, ya que los pobladores solicitan todos los días quesos frescos y muy ricos, típicos de zonas rurales donde los preparan. Carmen es nueva en MFP, pero se muestra muy comprometida y responsable  ante los demás. Invertirá lo que solicita en la compra de mayores cantidades de queso, para venderlos, ya no tan solo en su ciudad, sino también en las ciudades aledañas.
texts.en:
Carmen is 29 and lives with her husband and 3 children. She has sold cheese that she buys in remote communities and takes to the cities to sell in the markets for 4 years. What she likes most about her job is selling. The tedious part is going to far away towns. But this business is very profitable because the people who live in the city request fresh and very delicious cheeses from her every day that are traditional to the areas where they are prepared. Carmen is new to Microfinanzas Prisma, but she has shown that she is committed and responsible above all. She will invest her loan in the purchase of larger quantities of cheese to sell, not only in her city, but also in nearby cities.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a larger quantity of cheese to sell

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
La señora Manuela, socia del B. C “El Alto Mayo”, vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia y distrito de Rioja, se dedica a la venta de Raspadillas aprovechando el clima caluroso de la zona y vende de manera ambulatoria en una de las esquinas de la plaza de la ciudad.

Con este préstamo S/. 800, el cual será cancelado en 06 meses, comprará insumos para la preparación de raspadillas como esencias, vasitos, sorbetes y sobretodo invertirá en la compra de otra máquina y su respectivo carrito para raspadillas, porque ve que su negocio tiene acogida y no tienen mucha competencia.

Manuela tiene 35 años de edad, vive con sus 4 hijos y con su esposo. Sus hijos la apoyan en época de vacaciones. Es una persona amable y trabajadora. Su meta es tener crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Manuela, a member of the community bank “El Alto Mayo”, lives in the region of San Martín in the province and district of Rioja. She is a street vendor and sells snow cones on one of the corners of the town square, taking advantage of the warm climate of her region. With this S/. 800 loan, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy in bulk the products she requires to make the snow cones: flavoured syrups, cups and straws. Above all, she will invest in another machine and cart for snow cones as she sees that her business is well received and that there is not much competition. Manuela is 35 years old and lives with her 4 children and her husband. Her children help her during school holidays. She is friendly and hard-working. Her goal is to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy in bulk for the preparation of her snow cones (crushed ice with syrup).

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es:
La señora Marilu es socia del Banco Comunal “El Alto Mayo”, vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia y distrito de Rioja, se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida tipo menú vende de manera diaria, da pensión a quienes lo requieren y desarrolla su negocio en su propia casa. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará los insumos como arroz, azúcar en saco, aceite en galón, fideos, verduras y carnes  y otros insumos que necesita para la preparación de sus platos a ofertar a sus clientes. 
La señora Marilu tiene 41 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus 03 hijos, dos de ellos aún estudian y dependen de ella, además son la razón para luchar cada día. Más adelante quiere arreglar su casa y ampliar más su negocio.
texts.en:
Marilu belongs to the "El Alto Mayo" Communal Bank and lives in the San Martín Region in the Rioja district and province. She earns a living by preparing and selling menu-of-the-day type food. She offers food and accomodation to those needing it and carries out her business in her own house. With this loan of US$350 (S/. 1,000) which will be paid over six months, she will buy ingredients such as rice and sugar by the sack, oil by the gallon, pasta, vegetables, meat and other goods that she needs for the preparation of the meals to offer to her clients. Marilu is 41 years old and lives with her husband and their 3 children. Two of the children are still studying and dependent on her, and moreover are the reason to keep pushing onwards every day. In the future she wants to fix up her house and expand her business further.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy rice, sugar by the sack, oil by the gallon, pasta, vegetables, meats and other goods

loans.name: Diana

texts.es: Diana tiene 30 años, es madre soltera y tiene una hija de 4 años con quien vive. Ella es secretaria, pero para cubrir los gastos de su hija tuvo que dedicarse adicionalmente a la crianza de animales menores, sobre todo de cuyes, los cuales cuida de manera especial, ya que hay que separarlos y seleccionarlos adecuadamente para que tengan un adecuado crecimiento. Diana está pensando en instalar módulos de crianza para mejorar la crianza de sus animales, lo difícil es matarlos para luego venderlos en los mercados de su ciudad. Este es su 5to préstamo con MFP, y hasta la fecha ha sido cumplida con sus  pagos respectivos. Con el dinero que solicita podrá instalar los módulos de crianza para sus cuyes que tanto desea.
texts.en:
Diana is 30 years old, is a single mother, and has a four-year-old daughter, who lives with her. She is a secretary but in order to cover her daughter’s expenses, she had to also raise young animals, especially guinea pigs. She cares for these animals in a special way, since she has to separate them and select them adequately so that they will grow well. Diana is thinking of installing breeding modules to improve the breeding of her animals. It is difficult for her to kill them so that she can sell them later in the markets in the city. This is her fifth loan with MFP and so far has been compliant with her payments. With the money that she is requesting, she will be able to install the breeding modules for her in-demand guinea pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve the pens where she takes care of her guinea pigs

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita, socia del BC “MUJERES AUDACES”,  vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia y distrito de Moyobamba, se dedica a la venta de comida tipo menú y desarrolla su negocio en un local alquilado en una de las calles céntricas de la ciudad a donde acuden gran cantidad de clientes por la buena sazón y trato que les brinda. 

Con este crédito de S/. 2,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará los insumos como arroz, azúcar en saco, aceite en galón, fideos, verduras, carnes y otros insumos que necesita para la preparación de sus platos a ofertar a sus clientes. 
La señora Margarita tiene 47 años de edad, vive con su  esposo y con sus dos hijos que cursan estudios superiores y quienes la impulsan a esforzarse cada día más. Desea para el futuro contar con su restaurante bien arreglado porque hace poco que está en ese lugar.
texts.en:
Margarita, a member of the “Bold Women” communal bank, lives in the San Martín region, in the province and district of Moyobamba. She works selling traditional food as part of a fixed menu, and her business is run out of a rented space on one of the main streets in the city where many customers come for the delicious flavor and the way she treats them. With this loan of 2,000 soles ($675), which she will repay over 6 months, she will buy ingredients such as rice, sacks of sugar, gallons of oil, noodles, vegetables, meat, and other ingredients that she needs to prepare her dishes to sell to her customers. Margarita is 47 years old and lives with her husband and two children who are in secondary school. Her children inspire her to keep working every day. In the future she would like to have a nicer restaurant because she has not been in her current space for very long.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sacks of sugar, gallons of oil, noodles, vegetables, meats, and other ingredients

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith tiene 23 años y vive con sus padres. Ella tiene un gran don para embellecer a las personas, y utiliza esta habilidad para  ganarse la vida en su salón de belleza, el que instaló hace 2 años, siendo dentro de todo, los cortes de cabello, lo que le más le agrada realizar, ya que son éstos los que logran dar a sus clientes una nueva imagen que resalte su atractivo. Edith tiene en su salón de belleza una alternativa para salir de la pobreza en la que vive, y gracias a que  no hay muchos salones de belleza puede atender a gran cantidad de personas. Este es su 7mo préstamo con MFP, y hasta hoy no ha tenido ningún problema en pagar sus cuotas. Con el dinero que solicita implementará su salón de belleza con diversos instrumentos y productos indispensables para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Edith is 23 years old and lives with her parents. She has a great gift of making people beautiful. She uses this ability to earn a living in her beauty salon, which she began 2 years ago. She lives giving haircuts since with these, she succeeds in giving her clients a new image that makes them more attractive. Edith has, in her beauty salon, an alternative to the poverty in which she lives. Because there aren’t many beauty salons, she can take care of more people. This is her seventh loan with MFP, and until today she hasn’t had any problem in repaying punctually. With the money that she is requesting, she will stock her beauty salon with many instruments and indispensible products to continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her beauty salon with necessary products

loans.name: Maria Consuelo

texts.es:
La señora María Consuelo, socia del BC “Santa Ana”, vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia y distrito Moyabamba. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general y frutas, su negocio esta ubicado en su propia casa.

Con este préstamo de S/. 800, el cual será cancelado en 06 meses, comprará  productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar en saco, detergentes de diferentes marcas, conservas, leche en cajas, artículos de higiene personal y otros productos que requiere para surtir su negocio y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.

La señora María Consuelo tiene 35 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos quienes aún dependen de ella. Está agradecida con el apoyo brindado porque le permite crecer en su negocio. Su meta es surtir más su negocio y arreglar su casa  para darle seguridad a su negocio.
texts.en:
María Consuelo, a member of the Santa Ana Communal Bank, lives in the San Martín region, in the province and district of Moyabamba. She works selling groceries in general as well as fruit, and her business is located in her home. With this loan of 800 soles ($275), which she will repay over 6 months, she will buy essential products such as rice, sacks of sugar, detergents of various brands, preserves, boxes of milk, personal hygiene products, and other products that she needs to stock her business and satisfy the needs of her customers. María Consuelo is 35 years old and is the mother of four children who are dependent on her. She is grateful to have this assistance because it will allow her to grow her business. Her goal is to better stock her business and fix her home to give her business better security.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sacks of sugar, detergent, boxes of milk, personal hygiene products, and other items

loans.name: Flor

texts.es: Flor tiene 34 años, es madre soltera y vive con sus tres hijos. Se dedica a la venta de comida en la calle desde hace 3 años y su buena sazón en la preparación de alimentos hace que las personas regresen a consumir sus deliciosos platos, los cuales ofrece  a precios módicos. Además, Flor trata de brindar a sus clientes la mejor atención posible para asegurar su fidelidad e incrementar sus comensales, y por ende sus ingresos. Lo pesado de su labor es tener que levantarse muy de mañana y preparar todo lo necesario para luego salir a vender. Es una clienta nueva en MFP, y desea seguir trabajando con este grupo de socias a las cuales esta integrándose. Flor invertirá en la compra de vitrinas, que faciliten su trabajo y capten la atención de las personas para poder consumir sus platillos.
texts.en:
Flor is 34 years old, is a single mother, and lives with her three children. She has sold food in the street for 3 years, and her good seasoning in the preparation of the food makes people return to eat her delicious plates, which she offers at modest prices. Also, Flor tries to give her clients the best attention possible to assure their loyalty and increase her customers. In this way, she will increase her income. The difficult thing is having to wake up very early in the morning and prepare everything that she needs to sell her food. She is a new client of MFP and wants to continue working with this group, which she is becoming integrated into. Flor will invest by buying a showcase, which will make her work easier and will capture people’s attention so that they will eat her food.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a showcase for her business

loans.name: Maria Lusmila

texts.es:
La señora María Lusmila, es socia del BC “Los Jazmines”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia y distrito D. Moyabamba. Se dedica a la venta D. mercería como ungüentos, desodorantes, betún, tijeras y artículos D. limpieza. Desarrolla su negocio en las afueras del mercado central D. la ciudad, también sale a recorrer los alrededores y dentro del mercado.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000, el cual será cancelado en 06 meses, comprará   escobillas, crema dental, peines, afeitadores, ungüentos, desodorantes D. diferentes marcas y presentaciones, pilas D. diferentes tamaños y demás productos que tiene mayor salida. Quiere surtir bien su negocio y contar con lo necesario para satisfacer las necesidades D. sus clientes.

María Lusmila tiene 69 años D. edad, es madre D. 04 hijos quienes ya son independientes, ahora ella vive con su esposo y con sus dos nietas que son estudiantes y a quienes está criando, además la ayudan atender el negocio. Su meta es poner su negocio en su casa.
texts.en:
María Lusmila is a member of Los Jazmines community bank. She lives in Región San Martín in Moyabama district and province. María sells merchandise such as ointment, deodorant, shoe polish, scissors and cleaning products. Her business has grown on the outskirts of the city’s central market. She travels to both neighboring areas and within the market itself. With this loan of $350 (1000 Peruvian nuevos soles), which will be repaid in six month, María will buy brushes, toothpaste, combs, shaving cream, various brands and types of deodorant, batteries in a variety of sizes and other popular products. She wants to increase her inventory in order to have on hand the necessities to meet the customer demand. Maria Lusmila is 69 years old and the mother of four grown children. At present she lives with her husband and the two grandchildren that they are raising. The grandchildren are still in school, but they also help her tend to the business. Maria’s goal is to run the business out of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of brushes, toothpaste, combs, shaving cream, deodorant, batteries and other products

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es:
La Señora Maria Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras”, vive en la región San Martín, provincia y distrito de Moyobamba, se dedica a la venta de productos de pan llevar como plátanos, menestras, yuca verduras, Mani y su negocio está ubicado en el mercado central de la ciudad,  lugar donde acuden diariamente a comprar sus clientes que son los visitantes del mercado.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará plátanos en racimos, yuca en sacos, frijoles en sacos de diferentes variedades así como maní en sacos y otros productos que necesita para surtir su negocio y atender las exigencias de sus clientes. 

María Victoria tiene 66 años, es madre de 12 hijos de los cuales solo 4 viven, ya todos son independientes. Ahora vive con su esposo y con uno de sus hijos quien la apoya en su negocio y acompaña a sus padres. Está agradecida por el apoyo brindado por Manuela Ramos que le permite crecer, tanto a ella como también a las demás mujeres trabajadoras, en sus respectivos negocios.
texts.en:
Maria Victoria is a member of the community bank “Mujeres Emprendedoras” (‘Women Entrepreneurs’) and lives in the San Martín region of the Moyobamba district and province. She sells bread as well as bananas, vegetable stew, yucca, and peanuts at the city’s central market everyday. With this loan of 2,000 PEN, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy bananas in bulk, sacks of yucca, peanuts and different types of beans, and other products to supply her business and meet her customers’ needs. Maria Victoria is 66-years old, mother of 12 children, only 4 of which are living and now independent. She currently lives with her husband and a son, who helps his parents and supports Maria Victoria in her work. She is grateful for the support provided by the Manuela Ramos microfinance program, CrediMUJER, which has made it possible for her, as well as so many other working women, to improve business.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bananas, yucca, beans, peanuts, and other products in bulk

loans.name: Sartawi Group

texts.es:
La asociación denominada “Sartawi” pertenece a la familia de  Pro-Mujer hace tres  años aproximadamente. La mencionada asociación  pertenece al centro focal de Villa Exaltación, ubicada  en la zona del mismo nombre, de la ciudad de El Alto, a la fecha  cuenta con catorce miembros que  han demostrado ser un grupo organizado en cuanto a sus cuotas de crédito y actividades internas.
Existen diferentes negocios  dentro la asociación podemos decir que son comerciantes en su mayoría; venden comida, dulces, fruta, cosméticos, abarrotes, ropa usada, ropa nueva y otros. Comercializan sus productos en puestos fijos y también de manera ambulante.
La asociación Sartawi precisa de créditos para comprar mayor cantidad de productos ya que por las fiestas de fin de año, es seguro que sus ventas aumentaran y también sus ganancias.
texts.en:
The association called “Sartawi” has belonged to the Pro-Mujer family for about three years. That association belongs to the center of Villa Exaltación, located in the zone of the same name, in the city of El Alto. Sartawi has fourteen members, who have shown that they are an organized group through their credit payments and internal activities. The members of the association pursue different businesses, but they are mostly merchants. They sell food, sweets, fruit, cosmetics, groceries, used clothes, and new clothes, among other goods. They market their products in fixed stands and also through traveling sales. The association Sartawi needs loans to buy more products for parties at the end of the year. Their sales will certainly increase, as will their earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: They need loans to buy more products

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Mrs. Julieta S. is 36 years old and lives at Sunset Boulevard, Dawo, Dapitan City. She has been a single mother of five children since her husband left them in 2000. Three of her children are in school. Now, she finds herself again in a relationship and has been living with him for several years already. Their source of income is a sari-sari store. She has difficulty in raising her children considering the situation, but life must go on for Julieta. Her live-in partner also helps them financially through day labor.

Due to lack of capital, Julieta joined Paglaum MPC last April. She was inclined to be a member due to its benefits given to members. She has made good use of several loans and, at present, she is applying for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods and soft drinks for her sari-sari store. 

Julieta plans to make her sari-sari store into a mini-grocery someday, with a variety of goods for sale. She really strives hard to be able to send all of her children to school and to become fulfilled seeing her children finish their studies and  have comfortable careers.

loans.use: to buy canned goods & soft drinks for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Sang

texts.en:
Mr. Sang S. is 22 years old and is married to Yan Srey Mom, 26. They are residents of Kandal Province. The young couple makes a living working for a garment factory as garment workers. They currently get a salary of US$ 180 per month. They both are responsible for one young child who is attending school.

The young couple's living conditions are not so good because their house is so old and small for them. Therefore, Sang S. and Yan Srey Mom decided to request a loan to use as capital plus their savings to purchase house equipment to repair and decorate their house. The loan will help their family's life be a little more comfortable.

loans.use: To purchase house equipment

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.en:
This simple housekeeper from Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental is coping with life's challenges. At the age of 42, Clemencia S. admits that there is no room for her to rest comfortably and wait for unknown blessings. She and her husband Ernesto did not finish any college degree. Given that fact, the couple tried the fishing business. The first few months went by with unpredictable returns. But the couple did not give up. They continued and learned the business. At present, they own 2 units of pumpboats that give a weekly net income of PHP 800 to PHP 1,000. Not bad when they were just starting out.

To yield more income, they want to purchase additional fish nets which they can have for rent. They applied for a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. Clemencia has safeguarded her credit records with the cooperative. Being a member for almost 4 years, she shared that though the loan windows are readily available, the savings products of Paglaum are what she likes most.

Mr. and Mrs. S. have saved for the education of their children. They want their children to be able to fulfill their dreams by pursuing their studies. They conclude that Paglaum MPC has been a consistent partner in extending financial assistance for their livelihood. So if financial difficulties arise, they can always run to Paglaum.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish nets

loans.name: Tit

texts.en:
Tit B., 48, is a food seller and lives in Kandal Province. He runs a little restaurant where he sells rice and more types of food like Traditional Khmer Food, which he sells to students and passers-by. He is married to Kheav Chantha who is 48 years old and works with him in his business. She is a good mother to their three children; two of them are single and one is married.

To help a little more with the family's needs, all of her children are employed and working for companies; they currently earn a salary of US$ 190 per month. The couple is facing a difficulty with their living conditions: their old house is broken down and too small for them. B. and his wife would like to request a loan to buy house equipment to repair their old house. (In the photograph, the couple appears in front of their food shop.)

loans.use: To buy house equipment to repair their old house

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie R., 42, has 4 children and presently resides in Bato, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She has been a member of Pag-asa Center since June 2006. She has received several types of loan and recently she applied for PHP 15,000 to support her husband's farming activities. The family is cultivating a small parcel of land, and in order to have a good yield, fertilizer and insecticides are what they need.

Elsie's husband never gets tired of finding means to make a living. He also does fishing using their own "banca" (small boat). Their daily consumption is no longer a worry for the family. The couple also have a piggery where they focus on breeding pigs.

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative gave a glimpse of hope for their different business ventures since they want to expand their piggery and develop their rice field. Slowly they have been able to save for their children's studies, and they hope to live a comfortable life.

loans.use: purchase of fertilizer and insecticides

loans.name: Sophan

texts.en: Mr. Sophan L. is a villager in Samraong Village in Takeo Province. He is a pig breeder. Mr. Sophan L. is 55 years old and the father of three children. One of his children is employed in a garment factory while another one helps him in the business and the youngest one is attending the local school. Since this business is going well, he wants to expand, so he decided to ask for a loan of $375 to buy six more piglets. He would use the rest of the loan to buy more pig food to feed his pigs. His wife, Mrs. Keo Im, is a farmer who cultivates rice for a living.  She appears on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy six piglets and to buy more pig food to feed his pigs.

loans.name: Naem

texts.en: Mr. Naem S. is a farmer who lives in Samraong Village in Takeo Province.  Mr. Naem S. is 42 years old and the father of five children. One of the children is working in a garment factory while three are attending the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study.  He now faces a problem on his plantation because he does not have enough rice seeds to cultivate. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan of $500 to buy more rice seeds for cultivation.  He would use the rest of the loan to hire laborers to work in the field. His wife, Mrs. Prach Thoeurn, helps him on the plantation. She is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more rice seeds for cultivation and to hire laborers to work in the field.

loans.name: Morn

texts.en: Mrs. Morn K. lives in Press Leu village in Takeo province. She is a 46-year-old widow with three children. One of the children is working in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. She is a farmer who has a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Although she and her children work hard, they still do not earn an income which can provide decent living conditions for the family. In order to improve the family's living conditions, Mrs. Morn K. has decided to ask for a loan of $450 to buy a cow to start a breeding cow business.

loans.use: To buy a cow to start breeding cow business.

loans.name: Pich

texts.en: Mrs. Pich N. is a villager in Press Leu village in Takeo Province. She is a rice middleman who buys rice to keep in stock and resell later at a better price. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice to keep in stock. Her husband, Mr. Vul Vann, helps her in the current business. Mrs. Pich N. is 38 years old and the mother of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others attend the local school. Her husband is shown on the right of photo.

loans.use: To buy more rice to keep in stock

loans.name: Mrs. Hun Luon Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan goes to a group of eight people in Tong Rong village in Takeo Province. Mrs. Hun L. is the village bank president, selected by the members. She is a vegetable seller in the local market. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy different kinds of vegetables to resell. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this new loan. She is a 37-year-old widow with two children who both attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of vegetables to resell

loans.name: Mrs. Sahun Chhor Village Bank Group

texts.en: This loan goes to nine people in Phum Ty village, in Kampong Chhnang province, who formed a village bank loan group. They will each use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Sahun C. is the village bank president, selected by the members. She and her husband, Mr. C. Sahun, are construction workers. Since their work place is far from home, they spend a lot of money on transportation. In order to reduce these expenses, Mrs. Sahun C. decided to ask for a loan to buy a bike to go to work. She will use the rest of the loan to buy chickens for breeding. Mrs. Sahun C. is 28 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom attends the local school while the younger one, at age five, is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy a bike to get to work

loans.name: Mr. Sarun Um Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This is a village bank loan to a group that consists of ten people in PhU. Ty village in Kampong Chhnang province. Mr. Sarun U. is the village bank president. He is a vice village chief who makes a little salary. His wife, Mrs. Khun Chanda, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Aside from the plantation, she is a rice middleman who buys rice to keep in stock and then resell later at a better price. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it, so Mr. Sarun U. decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice to keep in stock. Mr. Sarun U. is 46 years old and the father of three children who all attend the local school. 

Two members in this village bank loan have end-of-term loans, and the rest have monthly payment loans. The end-of-term members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. These allow people to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09%, and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more rice to keep in stock

loans.name: Cristine

texts.en: Cristine P. is 25 years old and married to Eddie. The young couple were blessed with three children and live in Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. Cristine became a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative way back in April 2003. With the wide array of programs and services of the Cooperative, she decided to join Paglaum MPC. Two of their children are beneficiaries of Paglaum Community Development Foundation Incorporated (PCDFI), the mother organization, and at the same time, the social development partner of the Cooperative. With the education sponsorship of PCDFI to their children, the couple is aiming to survive on their daily expenses. Gifted with skills in carpentry, they tried their hand at the construction of fishing boats. In need of capital, they are reaching out to Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for a PHP 15,000 loan. Cristine and Eddie would like to own a motorized pumpboat in the future and hope to see their children fulfill their lifelong careers.

loans.use: Construction of fishing boats

loans.name: Mrs. Thy Klang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The group receiving this village bank loan consists of twenty people I. Thnal village I. Kampong Chhnang province. Mrs. Thy K. is a village bank president. She is a rice middleman who buys rice to keep I. stock and then resell later at a better price. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice to keep I. stock. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this new loan. Her husband, Mr. Uk Kry, is a construction worker who can make a little income to support the family. Mrs. Thy K. is 48 years old and the mother of four children who all attend the local school.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Eight members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Group members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s maI. product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. These allow people to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09%, and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more rice to keep in stock

loans.name: Mr. Sophat Orm Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Seventeen people in Thnal village in Kampong Chhnang province make up the group that will receive this village bank loan, and all the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mr. Sophat O. is the village bank president. He is a firewood seller in the local village. Since this business is going well, he wants to expand it, so he decided to ask for a loan to buy more firewood to resell. His wife, Mrs. Su Srey, is a farmer who has to 0.5 hectares to cultivate rice to earn a living. Mr. Sophat O. is 34 years old and the father of three children who all attend the local school. Group members Mrs. Sokhen O. and Mrs. KH. O. are not taking a loan themselves, but their husbands are, so their husbands are presented in the picture instead.     

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Fourteen members have end-of-term loans, and the rest have monthly payment loans. Group members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. These allow people to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09%, and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more firewood to resell

loans.name: Mrs. Sokhum Dang  Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan will go to sixteen people in Phum Soupy village in Kampong Chhnang province, and all the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Sokhum D. is a village bank president, selected by the members. She is a basket seller in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Sdao Kin, is a laborer who can make a small income to support the family. Although they try to work hard, they still earn only a little income to support the family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Sokhum D. decided to ask for a loan to buy three piglets to start a breeding business. Mrs. Sokhum D. is 39 years old and the mother of five children, one of whom is a laborer while the others attend the local school. Group member Mr. Yung N. is not taking a loan, but his wife is, so she is presented in the picture instead of him. 

All the members in this village bank have end-of-term loans, so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. These allow people to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09%, and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy three piglets to start a breeding business

loans.name: Lo's Group

texts.en:
This small loan request is being made by five borrowers, all residents of Siem Reap Province, led by Mrs. Lo P., a 40-year-old rice farmer and fish-seller in her village. Having started her business in 2000, she can earn on average $2 per day. Lo has three children, all teenagers attending school, and is married to 41-year-old Hin Samboeun, a fisherman. In order to increase income, Lo is requesting a loan to purchase rice from a local farmer to store and later sell at a profit.

The other four group members are:

Bit H., 31, a fish-seller seeking a loan to buy rice to sell for a profit;

Yem R., 41, a fish-seller requesting a loan to purchase rice to store for sale;

Lep L., a 33-year-old pig-raiser who wants to buy rice to sell for a profit;

Hin S., a 36-year-old construction worker who hopes to start a new business and is therefore requesting a loan to buy piglets to raise.

loans.use: To purchase rice to store for later sale.

loans.name: Chheng Oin's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chheng Oin N. is the leader of a group of four who all live in Pour Steang village in Kampong Cham province. She is a duck breeder. Since her duck breeding business is going well, she wants to expand it; therefore, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more ducks for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and improve the family living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Y Im, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. 

All the members in this group loan have end-of-term loans, so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. These allow people to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09%, and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more ducks for breeding

loans.name: Chhunmeng

texts.en: Mr. Chhunmeng M. was born in 1961, and he now lives in Choeung Wat village in Kampong Cham province. He is a nurse at the Provincial Health Care Center. His wife, Mrs. Yun Kim Yan, sells medicines. Since Mr. Chhunmeng M. has a lot of patients, he decided to ask for a loan to purchase more medicines to sell them for an income. He hopes to increase his income and provide a better life for his family. He is the father of three children, two of whom stay at home to do housework while the other attends the local school. His wife is shown on the right of picture.

loans.use: To buy more medicines to sell

loans.name: Khun

texts.en: Mrs. Khun K. is a farmer in Kna Ruong village in Takeo province. She owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Ros Rim, is a construction worker. Even thought they try to work hard, they still earn insufficient income to provide a better life for their family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Khun K. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to start breeding. She is 44 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while another is a laborer and the others are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow to start breeding

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en: Mrs. Sophy O. lives in Dork Por village in Takeo province. She buys coconuts to resell in the local village. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it; therefore, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more coconuts to resell. She would use the rest of the money to purchase a cart to transport her coconuts to sell door-to-door. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Nuo Chor, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Sophy O. is 39 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom attend the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is pictured on the right of photo.

loans.use: To buy more coconuts and a cart to transport them

loans.name: Leng

texts.en: Mrs. Leng K. lives in Dork Por village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Chhorn Touch, are farmers who own a piece of land to cultivate rice and vegetables to earn a living. On the farm, they face some problems with insufficient rice seeds and infertile soil. In order to solve these problems, Mrs. Leng K. decided to ask for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. In addition, she would use the rest of the loan to buy a pump to water the field to make her crop more productive. She is 43 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others attend the local school. Her husband is pictured with her in the photo.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds, fertilizer and a water pump

loans.name: Kimsan

texts.en: Mrs. Kimsan S. was born in 1974, and she now lives in Dork Por village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Suos Chhoeun, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice and vegetables. On the farm, they face an obstacle: their field is infertile, which diminishes their crops. In order to correct this problem, Mrs. Kimsan S. decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer. She would use the rest of loan to buy a cow for breeding. She is the mother of eight children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while another is a construction worker. Three of them attend the local school, and the others are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and a cow

loans.name: Nob

texts.en: Mr. Nob K. is a villager in Dork Por village in Takeo province. He is a coconut seller in the local village. Since this business is going well, he wants to expand it, so he decided to ask for a loan to buy more coconuts to resell. In addition, he would use the rest of the loan to buy a cart to transport his coconuts to resell door-to-door. He hopes to increase his income and improve his living conditions with this new loan. His wife, Mrs. Keop Long, is a farmer. Mr. Nob K. is 57 years old and the father of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others attend the local school. His wife is pictured on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more coconuts and a cart to transport them

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Mrs. Sam C. was born in 1954, and she now lives in Traping Chok village in Kandal province. She owns a small grocery store in the local marketplace. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery products for her inventory. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Mrs. Sam C. is a 54-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is a car repairer while the other one attends the local school.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products for her inventory

loans.name: Rith

texts.en:
Mrs. Rith S. is a villager in Dock Por village in Takeo province. She is a coconut seller in the local village. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she is asking for a loan to buy more coconuts to re-sell. She will use the rest of the loan to buy a cart to transport her coconuts to re-sell door-to-door. Her husband, Mr. Saom Sambo, helps her in the current business.

Mrs. Rith S. is 46 years old and the mother of seven children three of whom are employed in a garment factory while three others are attending the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more coconuts to re-sell and to buy a cart to transport her coconuts.

loans.name: Jura

texts.en:
Jura A., a 47-year-old teacher by profession, is married with three children. Ten years ago, Jura saw a need for students to be able to buy used books and office supplies, so he opened a store which he operates with his loving family for this purpose. Jura has plentiful orders for a variety of books and office supplies, and now is applying to IMON for a loan to fulfill his orders. The well-being of Jura’s family and his business are in your hands, and they are sincerely grateful for your support.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes:  a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as  Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R. further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment, forcing hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve the country’s agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients present a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase books and office supplies to expand the business.

loans.name: Sadriddinkhoja

texts.en:
