Sadriddinkhoja K. is a young and energetic entrepreneur who started his own business when he was 17 in order to support his parents. His business is selling glasses and bijouterie in his store, located at the center of the city. This business allows him to support his large family which consists of his wife, parents, two sisters and little brother. 

Today Sadriddinkhoja needs to increase the range of the goods he sells and so is requesting a loan of $1200 for the term of 12 months. This loan will allow him to expand his business, to earn more, and in the future to realize all of his projects.  Be an important part of the growth of Sadriddinkhoja’s business!  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes:  a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R. further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase glasses and bijouterie to expand the range of goods for sale.

loans.name: Azimjon

texts.en:
Azimjon M. is 36 years old and he’s married with three children. His wife is a housekeeper who looks after their children. Azimjon is the only breadwinner in the family and he is really hard working. He has a cafe where he sells the traditional meals and other foodstuff. He has been in this business for 3 years. Azimjon tries to have fresh foodstuff and tasty meals in his café, to ensure his clients enjoy eating, have a rest, and buy any other items they need. His business is stable, and this allows him to generate a significant income to ensure a good lifestyle for his family.

Azimjon’s children are now growing and the expenses of raising them are increasing too. Thus, Azimjon wants to increase his business to earn more money to cover the expenses of his children. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting a loan to expand his café. He plans to pay back the loan on time and thanks everyone for their support. Be an important part of the growth of Azimjon’s business.

loans.use: To expand his business in order to earn more money.

loans.name: Malohat

texts.en:
Malohat S. is 49 years old. She is married and the loving mother of two children. Malohat breeds calves and cows. She buys the calves at the market for a low price, then feeds them and resells them at the same market for a more profitable amount. Her husband, who is in the picture too, also helps with this business. Malohat works hard in order to make the business successful and generate a stable income for the family.

Now, Malohat is planning to purchase three calves to raise and then sell. With this purpose in mind, she is requesting a loan. Malohat would like to thank everyone for their support and promises to manage the loan without violations or delinquency.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. loans.use: To purchase cattle for breeding and selling.

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru: Сатторова Манзура 37лет мать двоих детей,разведённая.Проживает в городе Костакоз, работает санитаркой в поликлинике.Манзура со своим братом занимается купля продажей скота в выходные дни.Её брат помогает ей  как по жизни, так и по бизнесу.Он её посоветовал купить подешевле на рынке несколько баранов.Поэтому Манзура решила взять кредит в Микроинвесте.При мониторинге Манзура была на работе , поэтому её фото сделано в офисе.
texts.en:
Manzura S. is a 37-year-old divorced mother of two children. She lives in the town of Kostakoz, and works as a nursing assistant in a medical clinic. In partnership with her brother, Manzura buys and sells cattle on her days off. Her brother helps her out with both business and personal matters. He advised her to buy several rams at the market while they were cheap, and therefore Manzura has decided to take out a loan with MicroInvest. When we stopped by, Manzura was at work, so her photograph was take in the office.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying and selling of cattle

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.ru: Баходур парень в возрасте 26 лет имеет 4 детей,работает электриком на фабрике по производству соков и томатов г.Костакоз.Каждый воскресный день Баходур выходит на рынок и перепродает скот.Он уже 6 лет как занимается этим бизнесом.С ним многие советуются по выбору купли скота.Баходур хорошо понимает в породах скота.Поэтому для закупа дешёвого мелкарогатого скота он хочет взять кредит.
texts.en:
Bahodur is a 26-year-old who has four children. He works as an electrician in a factory in Kostakoz where juice and tomatoes are processed. Every Sunday Bahodur goes to the market and sells cattle. He has been in this business for six years. Many look to him for advice on how to choose cattle for purchase. Bahodur knows breeds of cattle very well, and therefore he would like to take out a loan for the purchase of inexpensive small-horned cattle.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of cattle

loans.name: Jitahidi Msakuzi Group

texts.en:
Amina Lukando, age 48, is a widow with four children ages 28, 25, 22 and 14. She has a vegetable and fruit business which she started 15 years ago. She works daily from 6am until 4pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of around $122.

This will be Amina’s third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her capital and managed to employ samba boys. She bought enough seeds for planting the vegetables and fruits and has repaid the loans successfully. She now hopes for a third loan to buy an irrigation machine.

Amina will share this loan with her loan group, Jitahidi Msakuzi, which totals 15 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Amina is sitting in the middle in front.

loans.use: To buy an irrigation machine.

loans.name: Chham

texts.en:
Chham M. is 46 years old, a resident of Kompong Tom province. He plays the Khmer musical instrument to provide entertainment for wedding parties and other ceremonies, as well as raising pigs from his house. He started his businesses more than 10 years ago, and currently earns the money of approximately $5 a day. He is married to Mom Yorn, with five children. One of his daughters is employed as a garment worker in the Phnom Penh City. Mom Yorn is 46 years old and earns a living by selling Khmer cake as well as raising pigs with her husband.

Mr. M. has applied for a loan to buy more pig food and a pumping machine to pump water for his family's using. (The picture shows M.'s wife because he was not available.)

loans.use: To buy more pig food and a pumping machine.

loans.name: Muhiddin

texts.ru: Мухиддин мужчина 45 лет , отец двоих детей, работает водителем собственного такси. Жена работает врачом в городской больнице.С детства Мухиддин помогал своему отцу за уходом домашнего скота,в основном у них были коровы.После смерти отца Мухиддин пошёл по его стопам и продолжил это дело.И до сих пор он занимается этим бизнесом по продаже скота.На сегодняшний день у него две большие коровы, и 5 баранов, которые он перепродаёт на воскресных рынках. Мухиддин для увеличения скота решил взять кредит.
texts.en:
Muhiddin is a 45-year-old man, the father of two children, and works as a taxicab driver. His wife is a physician at the town's hospital. From childhood, Muhiddin helped his father to care for their domesticated cattle; generally they had cows. After the death of his father, Muhiddin stepped into his shoes and continued the business, and to this day he trades in cattle. At present he has two large cows and five rams, which he will sell at the Sunday market. Muhiddin decided to take out a loan in order to increase his herd.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of cattle

loans.name: Uvumilivu Group

texts.en:
Rukia K., age 46, is married with three children ages 25, 22 and 18. She sells ladies clothes, bags and vitenge (traditional Swahili fabrics). She started this business in 1990 and works daily from 10am until 6pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of about $285.

This will be Rukia’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the first loan to buy sewing machines and opened a sewing shop and has paid the loans back successfully. She now hopes for a new loan to expand her shop by purchasing an interlocking machine and another sewing machine.

Rukia will share this loan with subgroup A of the Uvumilivu group. The subgroup has seven members who run groceries, a salon, and sell clothes and food. These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Rukia is first on the left.

loans.use: To buy an interlocking machine and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Walid

texts.en:
Walid K. is 32 years old and married with four children. The family lives with his parents in Shewa, Jalalabad city, Nangarhar province. He is a teacher at his village's school, and he also has a lot of experience in agriculture because he owns land in his village.  

Walid has two sons and two daughters who are very happy. His two sons attend school and also want to get a higher education. With this in mind, Walid has a plan to open a store in the school and has requested a loan for this purpose.

Therefore he contacted the lenders of AFSG to take out a loan to buy some supplies such as notebooks, pens, pencils, sharpeners, and other things. He will also use his own capital. He would like to thank Kiva and its lenders very much for their support.

loans.use: To buy some supplies for his school store.

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
Im A. is 49 years old and lives in Kompong Tom province. He owns and runs a horse-cart taxi, providing his service for passengers or merchandise transportation. He cA. earn A. income of $3 a day to help meet his family's expenses. He is married with eight children; seven of them are single and another one is married who lives away from home. Three of his children are employed as construction workers at the Thailand Country. His wife is a rice farmer and also is a good housewife.

Recently, A. cannot attract his clients as before because his old cart is often broken. Thus he decided to ask for a loA. to buy a new cart to replace the old one, and also to order rice to store and then sell for a profit. He is shown in the photo with his family.

loans.use: To buy a cart to replace an old one.

loans.name: Phat

texts.en:
Mr. Phat V. is a villager born in 1943. He now lives in Toek Nim village in Kandal province. He is a farmer who cultivates both rice and vegetable. His wife, Mrs. In Nai, helps him in the plantation. They have two children who are both employed in a garment factory.

Although they try to work hard, they still earn insufficient income and live in an old house in poor conditions. In order to improve these, Mr. Phat V. decided to ask for a loan to add to his savings to build a new house for the family. His wife is also presented with him in the picture.

loans.use: To add to his savings to build a new house for the family.

loans.name: Samnang Chum's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Samnang C. is a group leader of five who are all living in Kaeng Ta Sok village in Kampong Chhnang province. Mrs. Samnang C. is a farmer who cultivates both rice and vegetable. In vegetable farming, she faces a small problem because she does not have enough money to buy bean seeds to cultivate in the field. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Samnang C. decided to ask for a loan to buy more bean seeds. Her husband, Mr. Real Sophal, helps her in the farming. Mrs. Samnang C. is 44 years old and the mother of five children one of whom is working in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school.

All the members in this village bank loan have end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. The end-of-term (EoT) loan is AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time.

loans.use: To buy more bean seeds for cultivation.

loans.name: Rithy Moeung's Group

texts.en:
This group which consists of four people is located in Sontouch village in Kampong Chhnang province. Mrs. Rithy M. is the group leader. She is a rice middleman who buys rice to keep in stock and then re-sell later at a better price. This business is going well, so she wants to expand it and has asked for a loan to buy 1,000 kilograms of rice to keep in stock. Her husband, Mr. Chhoem Sarun, is a policeman who makes a small salary to support the family. Mrs. Rithy M. is 41 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are working as constructors while the others are attending the local school.

Mrs. Rithy M. will share this loan with the members of her group.

loans.use: To buy 1,000 kilograms of rice to keep in stock.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Im

texts.en: Im S. is 31 years old and married to Sim Mao, 33. They are residents of Kompong Tom Province. The couple are both rice traders who earn their living by purchasing rice from farmers and reselling it for a profit. They are responsible for their three children, all of whom are single and go to school. Because the sale of rice is the principal way for them to earn money to sustain their family's needs, Im S. and Sim Mao hope to enlarge their business operation. Thus, they would like to request a loan to buy additional rice to sell.

loans.use: To buy additional rice to sell.

loans.name: Nem Srey's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nem S. is a group leader of six who all live in Phum Tmey village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a farmer who owns 0.5 hectares for rice cultivation. Aside from this plantation, she is a fisherwoman who catches a small number of fish to support the family. In order to catch more fish, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fishnets and fishing line for her business. Mrs. Nem S. is a 32-year-old widow with three children two of whom are attending the local school while the remaining one is too young to work or study.

All the members in this village bank loan are end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. The end-of-term (EoT) loan is AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time.

loans.use: To buy more fishnets and fishing line for her business.

loans.name: Waliholla

texts.en: Waliholla is 39 years old and married with 3 children. He works hard in agriculture, and lives in Shewa, Nangarhar province. He has been involved in the business of agriculture for more than 5 years, and now wants to take out a loan from AFSG. He would like the loan to help his business grow, and promises to be a good client for Kiva and AFSG. Waliholla is certain that he can repay the loan on time and he is very happy about receiving this loan. He would like to thank everybody who helps him, in the poor country of Afghanistan.

loans.use: To increase his agricultural business.

loans.name: Mrs. Saory Horn Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank which consists of 12 people is located in Thlok Damnak Luong village in Takeo province and all the members will use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Saory H. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a 0.3 hectare plantation to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, she is a poultry breeder who raises chickens. Since this business is goI. well, she wants to expand it, so she is askI. for a loan to buy more chickens for breedI.. She will use the rest of the loan to buy chicken food to feed them. Her husband, Mr. S. Chim, is a cow breeder. Mrs. Saory H. is 22 years old and the mother of two children who are too young to work or study.

One member in this village bank loan is an end-of-term (EoT) loan and the rest have monthly payment loans. The client with the EoT loan is not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. The EoT loan is AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time.

loans.use: To buy more chickens for breeding and chicken food to feed them.

loans.name: Prohim

texts.en:
Mr. Prohim E. is a villager in Kanhong village in Kampong Chhnang province. He is a farmer who owns two hectares to cultivate rice. His wife, Mrs. Math Tiesas, is a housewife who cooks delicious food for the family. Although they try to work hard, they still earn insufficient income to support the family.

In order to improve the living conditions, Mr. Prohim E. decided to ask for a loan to start a cow breeding business. He hopes to increase their income after he sells his cow. Mr. Prohim E. is 38 years old and the father of four children, three of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is 10 months old.

loans.use: To buy a cow to start cow breeding business.

loans.name: South

texts.en: Mrs. South D. was born in 1957 and she now lives in Phlov Veay village, in Kampong Chhnang province. She owns a small store where she sells rice and grocery products. Since this business is going well, she would like to expand it. She has decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice to re-sell. South is a widow with three children, two of whom are working in a garment factory while the youngest one is attending the local school.

loans.use: Purchase more rice to re-sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Mrs. Touch D. lives in Kok village, in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a farmer, who earns a small revenue from a tiny piece of land where she cultivates rice. She now wants to expand her rice growing revenue and has decided to ask for a loan, which along with her savings will buy a additional plot of land to grow rice. Her husband, Mr. Nai Thol, helps her with the rice planting  Mrs. Touch D. is 50 years old and the mother of five children; one is employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: Requesting a loan to buy a plot of land to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Khun

texts.en: Khun N. is 38 years old and lives in Kompong Tom Province, where she makes a living catching fish for sale. She also sells the eggs of the ducks that she raises at home. She now earns a revenue of around $8 per day, and has operated her businesses for more than eight years. She takes care of four children, who are all teenagers and attend school. Her husband, Meung Mat, 34, helps her with her businesses. To expand the business and earn additional income, Khun N. needs a loan to buy more ducks to raise and to buy a second-hand motorcycle to transport the eggs and fish to the market. (Khun N., her husband, and her children are in the picture.)

loans.use: To buy more ducks to raise.

loans.name: Na

texts.en: Mrs. Na C. was born in 1980 and she now lives in Takol village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a farmer who cultivates rice on a 1 hectare plot of land. She is a 28 year old widow with one child who is attends the local school. Although she works hard, she still does not earn sufficient income to support the family. They also live in an old house that is in poor condition. In order to improve these conditions, Mrs. Na C. decided to request a loan to add to her savings and build a new house for her family. She hopes to provide a better life for her family with this new loan.

loans.use: requests a loan to add to her saving and build a new house for her family.

loans.name: Ghurzang

texts.en:
Ghurzang is a young man who is uneducated, but has lots of experience in the agricultural business. He has been involved in this business for more than 10 years in Shewa, Nangarhar province. Prior to this loan, he worked in agriculture in his own village, but now he has responsibility for his family. For the past 10 years he has tried many times to increase his sales of animals, but was unsuccessful. Then he was pleased to find AFSG in Jalalabad city, and decided to apply for a loan.

Now he requested an individual loan to enlarge his work and further his business with more success and become strong in his business and make a good monthly income for his family.

loans.use: To buy animals.

loans.name: Man

texts.en:
Man M. is 56 years old and widowed. She lives in Kandal Province, where she runs a little store selling various kinds of groceries such as prepared food, canned food, and sweets for kids. Most of her customers are neighbors. She started her business in 1990, and it is doing very well, and she currently earns approximately of $5 a day. She has three children: two are single and one is married. To help meet the family's expenses, two of her sons are employed as motorcycle taxi drivers.

Man M. hopes to build a washroom, but she is lacking the money to do that. Therefore, she would like to apply for a loan to build a restroom for her family. (She and her son are pictured.)

loans.use: To build a restroom.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy one more cow and three more pigs for her husband's business.

loans.name: Sao Yim

texts.en: Mrs. Sao Yim S. is a villager in Dock Por village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a rice seller in the local village. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice to re-sell to her customers. Her husband, Mr. Chea Sophat, is a teacher who can make a small salary to support the family. Mrs. Sao Yim S. is 40 years old and the mother of four children who are all attending the local school.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more rice to re-sell to her customers.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad Z. has been involved in agriculture for more than five years. He lives in a household of 12 members in Shewa. He is a very hard worker man, but he can't support his family so he would like to expand his business. He has therefore requested an individual loan of 30,000 Afghanis (USD$625) with a term of 27 months to complete his stock and buy some seeds and other items for his land. He wants to further his business, help his family and make a better life in Afghanistan.

Muhammad is happy with this loan process. He plans to open a shop for his brother in the future. He would like to thank all lenders, Kiva and AFSG for this fantastic process of small loans in his country. He would like to be a good businessmen in the future.

loans.use: complete his stocks

loans.name: Thoerun

texts.en: Mr. Thoerun C. is a farmer who lives in Kraing Khmer village in Kampong Chhnang province. His wife, Mrs. Chea Sreymom, is pig breeder. Although they try to work hard, they still live in an old house in poor conditions. In order to improve these living conditions, Mr. Thoerun C. decided to ask for a loan to add to his savings to build a new house for his family. Mr. Thoerun C. is 38 years old and the father of five children, one of whom is working in Malaysia while three others are attending the local school and the remaining one, two years old, is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to add to his savings to build a new house for his family.

loans.name: Thul's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Thul P. is a group leader of four members who all live in Khnong village in Kampong Chhnang province. Mrs. Thul P. and her husband, Mr. Chhai Chhon, are farmers who own a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn their living. In this plantation, they can gather only a little rice revenue which cannot support the family well. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Thul P. decided to ask for a loan to buy piece of land to cultivate to expand her rice revenue. Mrs. Thul P. is 37 years old and the mother of five children, four of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child four years old.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy piece of land to cultivate to expand her rice revenue.

loans.name: Sinat's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sinat M. is a group leader of four members, who all live in Phum Ty Buon village in Kampong Chhnang province. Mrs. Sinat M. is 28 years old and the mother of a child who is four years old, too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Koy Pearom, is a vet in the local village.

Mrs. Sinat M. sells clothes in the local village. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it. She decided to ask for a loan to purchase more fashionable clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.use: Buy more fashionable clothes for her customers

loans.name: Sabza Gul Group

texts.en:
Gul Khanum is the group leader of the Sabza Gul group. There are four members in this group. All of them would like to receive money for his/her own business.

Ziba Gul and Gul Khanum want to take a loan for the business of sewing. Sabza Gul wants to take a loan for her husband's business and S. Agha wants to receive a loan for his fruit cart. They all want to see progress in their businesses and to earn more money to support their families and solve their problems.

They say that these loans can be very useful because they provide a chance for poor entrepreneurs to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To expand a sewing business.

loans.name: Khoja Mirwais

texts.en:
K. Mirwais lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. His house is near Lese Maryam. He is single and he has a general store. He has been involved in this business for more than five years and has a good number of customers.

Mirwais wants to make his business larger. He has requested an individual loan of 50,000 afghani (USD$1,050) for a term of 18 months. With it, he wants to expand his business, buy necessities and complete his stock.

Mirwais is very happy about this program of loans in Afghanistan and wants to thank AFSG and Kiva lenders around the world.

loans.use: To expand his general store.

loans.name: Miroslav

texts.en:
Miroslav is married and has two children. He rents a store and sells various construction supplies that are used to build and fix houses. His large assortment, good prices and good location bring more and more clients to his store. Miroslav has been in this business for six years. He knows what is in demand and offers his clients what they need.

Miroslav is a very optimistic person and believes that his business can grow even more. His goal is to purchase the store so that he can save money on rent. Moreover, one of his children (his one-year-old daughter) has an eye problem and the family needs money for the surgery and following treatment.

Miroslav would like to receive a loan of 7,000 UAH (USD$900) to purchase more inventory. At this time the prices for construction supplies are low and he can make very good deals and receive more profit.

loans.use: To increase the inventory in his construction supply store.

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es:
El Sr. Feliciano tiene 47 años de edad, esta casado con la señora María Amarilla de 39 años con la que tiene 3 hijos, un varón de 19 años el cual trabaja en la empresa familiar y los otros dos son menores los cuales están a la tutela de sus padres.

 El mismo tiene experiencia desde los 18 años de edad trabajando como secretario para terceros donde aprendió la profesión. Actualmente cuanta con taller propio el mismo tiene todas las herramientas necesarios para dicho trabajo. El cliente viene desarrollando trabajos de mantenimiento, rectificaciones, parte eléctrica y todo lo relacionado a la parte mecánica de motocicletas.  El cliente comento que actualmente es el taller autorizado por chacomer (fabricante de motos de la marca Kenton)
El préstamo será destinado para la compra de una prensa mecánica, el cual será destinado para trabajos en el taller, con dicha herramienta el cliente hará más ágil sus trabajos de reparación y mantenimiento de motocicletas.
texts.en:
Señor Feliciano is 47 years old and is married to Señora Maria Amarilla, who is 39 years old. The couple has three children: a 19-year-old son who works in the family business, and two younger children who are still under their parents' guardianship.

Señor Feliciano began working as a secretary for motorcycle mechanics when he was 18 years old, and gradually learned the profession himself. He currently has his own repair shop, with all of the necessary tools to do his job. He performs maintenance, corrections, electrical work, and anything else involving mechanical work on motorcycles. His workshop was approved as an authorized maintenance location by the CHACOMER company (which manufactures Kenton brand motorcycles).

The loan will be used to buy a mechanical press to use in his workshop. This machine will allow him to refine the repair and maintenance work that he does on motorcycles.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a mechanical press

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
La Sra. Lorena cuenta con 30 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Robert Chamorro de 40 años, matrimonio tiene 3 hijos todos menores los cuales, 1 varón de 8 años, nenas de 6 y 4 años respectivamente.

 En el negocio trabaja la cliente y su marido esta en la parte de carnicería, el mismo compra las reces, luego lo faena y vende en el mismo negocio el cual ayuda al ingreso, además actúa de enganche para la venta de otros productos como fideos, arroz, aceites, sal, mandioca y otros que son de consumo diario. 

Tiene cliente formada por que lleva trabajado desde hace 5 años más o menos. Me comento que se inicio trabajando como vendedora de leche y poco a poco se hizo de capital y formo su propio negocio el cual hoy es una despensa y carnicería muy bien surtida.
El préstamo solicitado es para compra de sidras, cervezas y gaseosas ya que se aproximan las fiestas de fin de año.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lorena is 30 years old and married. Her husband, Robert Chamorro, is 40 years old. They have three children. Their son is eight years old and their daughters are six and four, respectively. Lorena and her husband own a grocery and butcher shop. He works with the supplies, and she works with the clients. Robert buys the animals himself, later he butchers and sells the meat in the same business. This process increases the business' income, because he acts as the conduit to sell other products such as noodles, rice, cooking oil, salt, tapioca, and other staples. Lorena and Robert have developed a base of clients over the past five years, since they opened the store. They began this work by selling milk, and little by little they earned the capital to start their own business, which is now a well-supplied butcher shop and store. The loan will go toward the purchase of cider, beer, and soda, as we're now getting closer to end-of-the year parties.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cider, beer, and soda

loans.name: Caritina

texts.es:
La señora es casada, tiene 54 años de edad, su conyugue se encuentra trabajando en Argentina como constructor, tiene un hijo mayor, vive en la ciudad de Pilar, en casa propia, en el barrio 12 Octubre de esta ciudad, en dicha residencia particular cuenta con las comodidades para el hogar, en el mismo domicilio posee un local de un taller de carpintería donde se realiza trabajos de todo tipo, ya sea compostura y trabajos por pedido. 
Esta en esta actividad como ya mas de 12 años, posee todas las maquinarias necesarias para el desarrollo de su actividad que fuera para dentro del taller.
Solicita el crédito para comprar madera para realizar trabajos que tienen pedidos para entregar.
texts.en:
Caritina is 54 years old and married. Her husband works in construction in Argentina. She has an adult son and she lives in the town of Pilar, in her own house in the neighbourhood of 12 Octubre. She has all she needs in her home, where she has a carpentry workshop to carry out all sorts of work, whether is be assembly or made-to-order. She has been in this business for more than 12 years and owns all the machinery needed for carpentry in her workshop. She is requesting the loan in order to buy materials for orders which they have to deliver.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy material for carpentry

loans.name: Mohamed Edouard

texts.fr: Mohamed pratique un élevage de volaille à l'échelle familiale. Il habite au quartier Château d'Eau et arrive ,grâce à ses activités , à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Il sollicite ce prêt pour renforecr son élevage et faire du petit commerce.
texts.en:
Mohamed has a home-size poultry farm. He lives in the Château d'Eau district. Thanks to his work, he manages to provide for his family. He is requesting this loan to bolster his poultry-raising business and to conduct small-scale commerce.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising poultry and small-scale commerce

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El Carlos Ramírez, tiene 46 años de edad, es casado, su conyugue se llama Zaida Verón, tienen dos hijos menores, un varón y una nena ambos menores de edad, vive en la ciudad de Mayor Martinez, vive en casa propia, en el centro mismo de esta ciudad, en dicha residencia particular cuenta con las comodidades para el hogar, en el mismo domicilio posee un local comercial denominado Comercial San Carlos , donde se comercializa todo tipo de artículos de primera necesidad, tienda, ferretería, carnicería, etc.
Es dueño también de dos líneas de trasporte de pasajeros que realiza viajes desde esta ciudad hasta la Ciudad de Pilar.
Es comerciante, esta en esta actividad más de 10 años, posee buena cantidad de mercaderías. Solicita el crédito para comprar animales para faenar.
texts.en:
Carlos Ramírez, 46 years old, is married. His wife is Zaida Verón; they have two young children: a son and a daughter, both minors. He lives in the town of Mayor Martinez, in his own home in the centre of the town. He has all the necessities of home, and runs a business called Comercial San Carlos out of his house, where he sells all sorts of basic goods for stores, hardware stores, butcher shops, etc. He also owns two passenger transports which travel between his town and the town of Pilar. He has been in this business for more than 10 years and has a good stock of merchandise. He is requesting the loan to buy work animals.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy animals

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El Sr. P. es casado tiene 4 hijos propietario de una empresa dedicada a la fabricación y reparación de camiones acoplados y semirremolques.
El predio cuenta con 2 terrenos para desarrollar su actividad espacio que le es insuficiente.
Con el crédito de la fundación podrá completar sus ahorros y comprara el terreno que esta ubicado al costado izquierdo del taller. 
El cliente esta muy agradecido con la Fundación Paraguaya ya que  podrá ampliar su local y aumentara sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Mr. P. is married and has 4 children. He owns a business rebuilding and repairing truck trailers and semitrailers. The premises are made up of 2 lots which is not enough space for the work he does. With this loan from the Foundation he will be able to supplement his savings and buy the lot to the left of his workshop. The client is very grateful to Fundación Paraguaya as he will be able to expand his workspace and increase his revenues.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise such as sugar, tea, milk, cookies, drinks of all kinds, etc.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Carmen vive en casa propia en la calle Guzmán de Rojas de la zona de Sopocachi, no tiene hijos es mujer sola, la actividad que tiene es la de comerciante ya que tiene una tienda ubicada en la zona de Llojeta, con esta actividad ella se mantiene, el crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital y surtir mejor su tienda con mayor variedad de productos (sodas, dulces, pan, leche, arroz, fideo, etc.) para atraer mas clientela.

El historial de la señora e muy bueno por lo tanto califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Carmen lives in her own home on Guzmán de Rojas Street in the Sopacachi neighborhood. She is single and has no children. She has her own store located in the Llojeta neighborhood, and this is how she earns her income. The loan that she has requested is to increase her capital and better stock her store with a better variety of products (sodas, sweets, bread, milk, rice, noodles, etc.) in order to attract more customers. Her credit history is very good, and because of this she qualifies for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more products for her grocery store

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La señora Marina vive en alquiler en la calle circunvalación de la zona de Pasankeri, de la ciudad de La Paz; trabaja en la Cancilleria en el área de servicio de té. El crédito que solicita es para salud ya que desde hace un mes sufre dolores de columna y el medico le dijo que necesitará varios exámenes para saber lo que tiene.

El historial de la señora es muy bueno por lo tanto califica para obtener un nuevo crédito. Es cliente nuestro desde el año 2006.
texts.en:
Marina lives in a rented home on Circunvalación street in the Pasankeri district of La Paz city; she works at the State Department in tea service. She asks for a loan for medical expenses. For a month she has suffered spinal pain for which the doctor said she will need various examinations to diagnose. Her credit history is very good, therefore she qualifies for a new loan. She has been an IMPRO client since 2006.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expenses for medical exams and analysis for spinal pain

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora se dedica a la compra y venta de chuño y queso que compra  de las mayoristas por cantidad para vender al detalle.
Vende su mercadería en las ferias de la zona sur. El crédito solicitado será para incrementar su capital de trabajo y comprar más queso y chuño.
Vive en la zona de Alto Irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz tiene cinco hijos, dos están a su cargo y su esposo es albañil. 
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito.
texts.en:
Teodora works buying and selling potato flour and cheese that she buys wholesale to sell in smaller quantities. She sells her merchandise at the markets in the southern part of the city. The loan requested will be used to increase her working capital and buy more cheese and potato flour. She lives in the Alto Irpavi neighborhood in the city of La Paz. She has five children, two of whom are under her care, and her husband is a bricklayer. This is the second time that she has requested a loan from Kiva partner Impro. Her history qualifies her for this loan. In other words, she has had a good payment history.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cheese and potato flour wholesale to sell in smaller quantities

loans.name: Avelina

texts.es:
Avelina se dedica a la compra de botellas de plástico al detalle para venderlas en cantidad en las empresas que reciclan botellas de plástico.
Vive en la zona de bajo Irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz; tiene dos hijos que esta a su cargo ya que es el única que genera ingresos en su familia porque es madre soltera. El crédito que solicita será utilizado para comprar 500 botellas de plastico y de vidrio, también comprará papel (alrededor de 500 kilos) para vender a las fábricas recicladotas y obtener mejores ingresos.
Es la Segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito.
texts.en:
Avelina buys plastic bottles at retail value and sells them in bulk to recycling programs. She lives below the Irpavi district in La Paz city and is a single mother supporting her 2 children. The loan she requests will be used to buy 500 plastic and glass bottles, and about 500 kg of paper to sell to the recycling programs and increase her earnings. This is her second loan from Impro; her good payment history qualifies her for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of plastic and glass bottles and used paper for sale to recycling programs

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Felipa es comerciante, su esposo se dedica a la elaboración de muebles y ella se encarga de realizar los contratos y ofertar sus productos de carpintería a pedido.
Vive en la zona Irpavi II de la ciudad de La Paz como cuidadora, es decir vive en unas dos habitaciones sin pagar alquiler a cambio de cuidar esa vivienda. tiene tres hijos que están en edad escolar. El crédito que ahora solicita es para la compra de madera, venesta y barniz para continuar en el negocio de elaboración de muebles junto con su esposo.
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito.
texts.en:
Felipa is a storekeeper. Her husband makes furniture and she is in charge of making contracts and offering their products to the workshops that order them. She lives in the zone Irpavi II in the city of La Paz as a nanny. This means she lives in two houses without paying rent in exchange for taking care of the homes. She has three children that are of school age. The loan that she is requesting is for buying wood, plywood, and varnish in order to continue the business of making furniture with her husband. This is the second time she has requested a loan with Impro. Her credit history qualifies her for a client rating 1 with Impro, which means that she has an excellent repayment history of her loans.

Translated from Spanish by Annie Sheng, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying wood, plywood and varnish for her furniture-making business

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar tiene una movilidad que trabaja como radio taxi, es soltero y el único que genera ingresos para sus gastos de alimentación y otros gastos.
Vive en la zona de Obrajes  de la ciudad de La Paz en casa alquilada
El crédito será destinado para la el mantenimiento de su vehículo ( Compra de llantas, chaperio y arreglo de motor).
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito.
texts.en:
Oscar has a car that he uses as a radio taxi (public taxi). He is single and the sole source of income for his food and other expenses. He lives in a rented house in the Obrajes neighborhood of La Paz. He plans to use his loan for maintenance of his vehicle (buy tires, do general repairs, and repair the engine). This will be his second loan with IMPRO. Oscar’s credit history has earned him a #1 rating, meaning he has paid off his loans completely and on time.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance costs for his taxi - purchase tires, repair the engine, do body work

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy se dedica a la venta de abarrotes los fines de semana ya que de lunes a viernes trabaja en una imprenta.
Vive en la zona de obrajes sector Collpajahuira de la ciudad de La Paz, tiene dos hijos que están a su cargo ya que es la única que genera ingresos porque es madre soltera. El crédito solicitado será utilizado en la compra de mercadería (arroz, fideo, dulces, sodas, etc.) para su posterior venta.
Es la Segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito.
texts.en:
On the week-ends Nancy sells groceries and from Monday through Friday she works at a printer's. She lives in the zone of production, in the Collpajahuira sector of the town of La Paz. She has two children and she alone generates the necessary income as she is a single mother. The loan requested will be spent on buying merchandise (rice, noodles, candy, soda, etc.) to be sold later.

This is her second loan from Impro, she is qualified as a number 1 client, meaning she punctually repays her loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for a grocery store.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y refrescos y es la única que genera ingresos en su familia ya que es viuda y tiene tres hijos.
Vive en la zona de obrajes de la ciudad de La Paz en casa propia.
El crédito será destinado para la compra de mercadería ( abarrotes, refrescos, dulces, y galletas)
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito.
texts.en:
Julia sells groceries and sodas. She alone generates income for her family as she is a widow with three children. She lives in her own house in the zone of production of the town of La Paz.

The loan will be spent on buying merchandise (groceries, sodas, candy and cookies). This is the second time she requests a loan from Impro, and she is qualified as a number 1 client, meaning she repays punctually her loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for a grocery store.

loans.name: Dianké

texts.fr: Dianké Sané, 59 ans, veuve, 01 enfant en charge est membre du banc villageois de Peyrissac depuis 7 ans et demi. Elle veut acheter de l’huile de palme pour renforcer son commerce. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer à la charge familiale Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Dianké Sané, age 59, is a widow and has a child to look after. She has been a member of the village loan group of Peyrissac for seven and a half years. She wants to buy palm oil to bolster her commerce. Her income enables her to help cover family expenses. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell palm oil

loans.name: Pirlicas

texts.en:
Pirlicas I. has a lot of experience in growing vegetables in greenhouses. On a small area of 0.15 hectares he plants tomatoes, potatoes, cucumbers, etc. In early spring he brings his vegetables to the market at the nearby cities of Cantemir or Cahul. With the earned money he supports his family. 

I. now needs a loan for autumn cultivatI. requirements of the land. With a loan of USD$1,150 he will cultivate and will prepare well the soil for spring. In the past, he has had three loans from Microinvest.

loans.use: cultivate soil.

loans.name: Dilan Satan

texts.fr: Dilan Satan S., 59 ans, mariée, 05 enfants scolarisés en charge est membre du banc villageois de Peyrissac depuis 3 ans. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre des robes et ensembles africains. Les revenus tirés de son commerce vont lui permettre d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Dilan Satan S., age 59, is married and has five children in school who are in her care. She has been a member of the village loan group of Peyrissac for three years. Her work consists in buying and reselling dresses and African suits. The income derived from her commerce is going to allow her to improve her family's living conditions. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in dresses and African outfits

loans.name: Ema Pilar

texts.es:
La señorita Ema es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Amigas” de la provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno. 
Tiene 20 años de edad, es soltera  sin hijos. Con su primer  préstamo de S/. 500 pagó sus estudios. Tiene casi 1 años trabajando con el banco. Ema nos cuenta que estudia enfermería
Con este préstamo de 500 nuevos soles que pagará en 4 cuotas pagara su titulación universitaria.
Ema desea continuar trabajando para comprarse una casa.
texts.en:
Miss Ema is a partner of Banco Comunal "Las Amigas" of the province of Puno, in the department of Puno. She is 20 years old, single with no children. With her first loan of S/.500 she paid her studies. She has been working with the bank for 1 year. Ema tells us she is studying nursing.

With this loan of 500 nuevos soles, to be repaid in 4 payments, she will pay her university degree. Ema wishes to continue work in order to buy a house.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal expenses. University degree.

loans.name: Elida

texts.es:
La señorita Elida es socia del Banco Comunal “Flores la Pampilla” de la provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno. Tiene 23 años de edad, es soltera y madre de 1 hija. Con su primer préstamo de S/. 300 compró productos de belleza. Tiene casi 5 años  trabajando con el banco. Nos cuenta que cambió de rubro, ahora vende celulares.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,100 que pagará en 4 cuotas comprará celulares para su negocio
Elida desea continuar trabajando para tener un local propio.
texts.en:
Miss Elida is a partner of Banco Comunal "Flores la Pampilla" of the province of Puno in the department of Puno. She is 23 years old, single and the mother of 1 daughter. With her first loan of S/.300 she bought beauty products. She has been working with the bank for almost 5 years. She tells us that at the moment she is selling mobile phones. With this loan of S/.1,100, to be repaid in 4 payments, she will purchase mobile phones for her business. Elida wishes to continue working in order to get her own premises.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase mobile phones.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa B., mariée, 03 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Peyrissac depuis 7 ans et demi. Son activité consiste à acheter des tissus et des fournitures pour faire des ensembles en tissus teintés, wax et bazin et vendre. Les revenus tirés de son commerce vont lui permettre d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Awa B. is married and has three children to look after. She has been a member of the village loan group of Peyrissac for seven and a half years. Her work consists in buying cloth and supplies to make suits out of dyed fabrics, 'wax' cloth, and damask to sell. The income derived from her commerce is going to allow her to improve her family's living conditions. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth and supplies to make suits to sell

loans.name: Fanta

texts.fr: Fanta S., 42 ans est veuve avec 07 enfants en charge dont 06 scolarisés. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Peyrissac depuis 7 ans et demi. Fanta veut renforcer son commerce d’huile de palme. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie et de santé de sa famille Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Fanta S., age 42, is a widow and has in her care seven children, of whom six are in school. She has been a member of the village loan group of Peyrissac for seven and a half years. Fanta wants to boost her commerce in palm oil. Her income enables her to help improve living conditions and her family's health. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in palm oil

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
La señora Dora es socia del Banco Comunal “Wiñay” del distrito de Puno, provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno. Tiene 58 años de edad, es casada y madre de 2 hijos a los que apoya económicamente. Dora con el primer préstamo de S/ 300 compró mercadería para venderla en su tienda. Tiene casi 3 años trabajando con el banco. 
Con este préstamo de S/. 1500 que pagaré en 4 cuotas comprará más mercadería para ser vendida en su tienda de abarrotes.
Dora desea continuar trabajando para apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Dora is a member of the communal bank "Winay", in the district and province of Puno. She is 58 years old and married with 2 children whom she helps support financially. With her first loan, Dora purchased merchandise to sell in her small general store. She has been working with the communal bank for almost 3 years now. With the new loan, which she will repay in 4 payments, she will purchase more merchandise for her business so that she can continue to support her family.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for her small general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm products to make more meals to resell

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es:
La señora Concepción es socia del Banco Comunal “Dante Nava” del distrito de Puno, provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno. Tiene 31 años de edad, es soltera y madre de 3 hijos. Concepción con su primer préstamo de S/. 300 compró lana para confeccionar prendas de vestir. Nos cuenta que con el negocio de los combustibles, al que ahora se dedica, ha aumentado su capital y sus ganancias. Tiene casi 4 años trabajando con el banco. 
Con este préstamo de S/. 1000 que pagará en 4 cuotas comprará combustibles y artículos de ferretería para venderlos en su puesto. 
Concepción desea continuar trabajando para construir su casa propia y tener un local donde vender sus productos.
texts.en:
Ms. Concepción es a member of the Dante Nava Communal Bank in the district and province of Puno. She is 31 years old, single and the mother of three children. With her first loan, Concepción bought wool to produce clothing. She tells us that selling fuel, to which she is currently dedicated, has improved her earnings. She has worked with this bank for four years. With this loan that she'll pay in four installments, she will buy fuel and hardware to sell at her work. Concepción hopes to continue working so she can build her own house and have a local place where she can sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Misty McNally, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fuel and hardware to resell

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es:
La señorita Celestina es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Amigas” de la provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno. Tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera sin hijos. Con su primer  préstamo de S/. 500 compró  una computadora  para su servicio de locutorio. Tiene casi 1 años trabajando con el banco. Nos cuenta que estudia turismo.
Con este préstamo de S/. 800 que pagará en 4 cuotas tramitará su título universitario.
Celestina desea continuar trabajando para comprarse su casa.
texts.en:
Miss Celestina is a partner of Banco Comunal "Las Amigas" of the province of Puno in the department of Puno. She is 24 years old, single with no children. With her first loan of S/.500 she bought a computer for use at her call center. She has been working for almost a year with the bank. She tells us she is studying tourism. With this loan of S/.800, to be repaid in 4 payments, she will process her university degree. Celestina wishes to continue working in order to buy herself a house.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal expenses. University degree.

loans.name: Familia Group

texts.en:
The Familia Village Bank is a new bank with 19 members, who after weeks of training are happy to begin their first loan cycle. Each of the members was invited to participate by the loan officer, and most of them live in the San Felipe and June 11th neighborhoods.  The group members are involved in a variety of businesses, like grains, sweets, basic dry goods, meat, vegetables, firewood, cosmetics, and food sales. Some sell from their homes, while others are street or market vendors.  The group members are requesting different loan amounts, like 300, 600 or 900 soles, and the group as a whole is requesting a total of 8,700 soles. They will use their loans to buy rice, sugar, pasta, meat, wheat, barley, cookies, caramels, cosmetics, firewood and wood.  The group members dream of owning prosperous businesses, owning their own stores (as opposed to renting), that their children will grow up to be working professionals, and of owning their own homes.
 
 Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

El Banco Comunal Familia es un Banco Nuevo que recien inicia con 19 socias, quienes después D. semanas D. capacitación inician con mucha alegría. Todas ellas fueron invitadas por L. promotora, L. mayoria D. ellas son del asentamiento humano San Felipe y 11 D. junio.
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta prendan D. cereales, golosinas, abarrotes en general, carne, verduras, leña, cosméticos y venta D. comida. Sus ventas los realizan en sus domicilios, ambulantemente, D. casa en casa y en mercados.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos, algunos montos son D. 300 soles, 600 soles y 900 soles, haciendo un total D. 8,700 soles D. préstamos en el Banco Comunal.
Los préstamos lo invertirán en L. compra D. azucar, arroz,  fideo, carne, trigo, cebada, galletas, caramelos, cosméticos, leña y madera.
Los sueños D. las socias es que sus negocios sean prósperos, tener locales propios, sus hijos sean profesionales y tener casa propia.

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, pasta, meat, wheat, barley, cookies, caramels, cosmetics, firewood and wood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and resell Christmas trees

loans.name: Aide

texts.es:
La señora Aide es socia del Banco Comunal “Flores la Pampilla” del distrito de Puno, provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno. Tiene 22 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de 1 hijo. Aide con su primer préstamo de S/. 300 compró productos para vender en su quiosco. Nos cuenta que estudió computación pero no ejerce su carrera por estar al cuidado de su bebe. Tiene casi 6 años trabajando con el banco. 
Con este préstamo de S/. 1200 que pagará en 4 cuotas comprará productos para vender en su quiosco, además de  juguetes. 
Aide desea continuar trabajando para llegar a ser propietaria de su casa.
texts.en:
Señora Aide is a member of the community bank “Flowers of Pampilla” from the District of Puno, in Puno Province, in the Department of Puno. She is 22 years old, has a common law husband, and is the mother of 1 child. With her first loan of S/.300, Aide bought products to sell in her kiosk. She tells us she studied computation but does not work in the field so she can care for her child. She has worked with our bank for almost 6 years. With this loan of S/.1200 that she would repay in 4 installments, she would buy products to sell in her kiosk, including toys. Aide wants to continue working so she can become the owner of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sweets and toys

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of fuel at wholesale.

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania and from SELFINA!!  This is 35-year-old Selina A D., who is divorced with two children aged 8 and 14. Selina has been running  a beauty salon business since 2003, a place where her friends and fellow women can gather and literally let their hair down.  Most beauty salons in Tanzania are places where you can buy long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair, blue hair, and then have it attached to your head, woven, cut, or braided, and made to look like your own.  It is quite a thing to be seen!

Selina works at her business ten hours a day, seven days a week, earning a monthly profit of approximately $200.  She is now requesting a loan of $775 in order to purchase an additional hair dryer, chairs, hair products such as wigs, and other cosmetics.  Due to the success of this business, she hopes to open another in the future, and she thanks you in advance for your support.

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase an additional hair dryer, chairs, hair products and other cosmetics

loans.name: Vanessa Kristabel

texts.es:
Vanessa se dedica al pintado de uñas y también manicure y pedicure, a domicilio, ya que no cuenta con un salón de esta especialidad.
Es la única que genera ingresos para los gastos de alimentación y estudios ya que se encuentra cursando la universidad.
Vive en la zona de Obrajes de la ciudad de La Paz es soltera y vive en la casa en anticrético de sus padres.El crédito solicitado será destinado a la compra de tintes, cremas,, shampoos, liquidos para permanentes, etc.
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito
texts.en:
Vanessa paints nails and does manicures and pedicures at people's homes because she does not have her own salon. She is attending a university and is the only one that earns income to cover her costs of food and education. She lives in the zone of Obraje of the city of La Paz, is single and lives in her parents' house under a special rental agreement (anticretico). The proceeds of the loan will go towards the purchase hair color, creams, shampoos, hair permanent solutions, etc.. This is the second time that she request a loan from Impro. Her history classifies her as a #1 client, meaning that she has complied with the terms of repayment of the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for her business.

loans.name: Marythza Rebeca

texts.es:
Marythza se dedica a la compra y venta de perfumes, trabaja con catálogos a pedido
Es soltera y también estudia, tiene 27 años y es la única que genera ingresos para sus gastos ya que es independiente. 
El crédito será destinado para la compra de mercadería ( perfumes y cosméticos.
Vive en la zona Santa rosa de la ciudad de El Alto del departamento de La Paz. 
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito.
texts.en:
Marythza buys and sells perfumes and works with orders from catalogues. She is single and a student. She is 27 years old and since she is independent, is the only one that generates income to cover her expenses. The loan will be used for the purchase of merchandise ( perfumes and cosmetics). She lives in the Santa Rosa zone of the city of El Alto of the department of La Paz. This is the second time that she request a loan from Impro. Her credit history classifies her as a #1 customer due to her good repayment history.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for the business.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings) from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania and SELFINA! This is 43-year-old Mariam A. M., married with four children between the ages of 20 and 26. Mariam has been running a bar since 2004. 

Her bar is a good place to relax and catch up with friends.  Many cannot think of a better way to end a hard day’s work than with an ice cold local beer, under the shade from the blaring Tanzanian sun, with one’s friends. 

Working at the business 16 hours per day, 7 days per week, and assisted by three employees, Mariam currently earns about $250 each month. She is now requesting a loan of $1000 in order to purchase additional stocks of beer, soda and drinking water, and in the future plans to increase her variety of stocks. Mariam thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of beer, soda and drinking water.

loans.name: Lourdes Susy

texts.es:
Lourdes se dedica a la venta de comida en una pensión lo cual le ayuda de gran manera en los gastos de alimentación ya que es una pensión donde le ayudan sus pequeños hijos.
La pensión y vivienda se encuentran ubicadas en la Zona de Obrajes de la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito será destinado para la compra de insumos ( arroz, fideo, papa, aceite, y otros).
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito.
texts.en:
Lourdes works selling food in a guest house, which helps her a great deal with the cost of feeding her family as the guest house helps her out with her small children. The guest house is located in Zona de Obrajes, in the city of La Paz. Her loan will be used to buy basic supplies such as rice, noodles, potatoes, cooking oil and other items. This is the second time that she has sought a loan from Impro. She successfully repaid her previous loan and is considered a model client.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Israel Alejandro

texts.es:
Israel  tiene una pensión donde vende por las noches cenas y refrescos, trabaja de lunes a domingo con su madre y por el día como guardia de seguridad
Vive en la zona de Obrajes de la ciudad de La Paz es soltero y su negocio le permite solventar las gastos de su mare.
El crédito será destinado para la compra de insumos ( arroz, fideo, papa, verduras, aceite y otros).
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito.
texts.en:
Israel has a cafe where in the evenings he sells dinner and refreshments. He works with his mother from Monday through Sunday and is a security guard during the day. He lives in the Obrajes zone of the city of La Paz. He is single and his business allows him to cover his and his mother's expenses. The loan will be used in the purchase of supplies ( rice, noodles, potatoes, vegetables, oil and others). This is the second time that he request a loan from Impro. His credit record classifies him as a #1 client, meaning that he has a good repayment history.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for the buisness.

loans.name: Johari

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Johari J. M. from Dar es Salaam, the married mother of a nine-year-old child. Johari has been running a tailoring business since 2003. 

At her tailoring business she purchases vitambaa (material), vitenge (a traditional Tanzanian cloth with wax print), and kanga (printed cotton fabric often with a border along all four sides) and makes them into clothing mainly for women.  She confided in us that what sets her tailoring business apart is that she is more skilled than others and is able to create different kinds of designs for her customers so they can stand out in a crowd. 

Working at the business 11 hours per day, 6 days per week, and assisted by her husband, Johari currently earns about $240 per month. She is now requesting a loan of $550 to purchase additional materials required for making clothes. In the future, she plans to carry a greater variety of materials in order to differentiate her products even further.  Johari thanks you for your support!


ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future

loans.use: To purchase additional materials required for making clothes.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
Felipe se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche lo comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche). Además trabaja como agricultor en la producción de papa, chuño y tunta.
 
Vive. en la comunidad Chojasivi de la Provincia Loa Andes del departamento de La Paz ubicado  a cuatro horas de la ciudad de La Paz.

Vive junto a su esposa quien le colabora en los quehaceres del ganado y su hogar que consta de 7 hijos. 
 
El crédito lo destinara en la compra de una vaca lechera y así incrementar  la producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo
texts.en:
Felipe raises cows and sells the milk production to PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche). He also works as a farmer, producing potatoes and also a variety of freeze dried potatoes popular in the region ( chuño and tunta). He lives in the community of Chojasive of the Los Andes province of the department of La Paz, located four hours from the city of La Paz. He lives with his wife who helps him with the care of the livestock and his home which consists of 7 children. The loan will be used for the purchase of a milk cow, which will increase the milk production and therefore his income. This is the first loan with Impro. The credit evaluation qualifies him to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock.

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey Aty Group

texts.es:
El comité está compuesto por 16 señoras trabajadoras de la compañía Cabañas de Caacupé, la mayoría de las integrantes se dedican al cultivo y ventas de plantas para jardín, son personas antiguas del barrios y todas se ayudan para poder comercializar sus productos.
Actualmente el grupo se encuentra en el 8 ciclo del programa de comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, y la misma están siendo beneficiada con un crédito promedio de gs. 540.000 cada integrantes.
La señora Beatriz presidenta del comité comenta que el grupo de mujeres están llevando acabo un proyecto que esta teniendo buenos resultados y es la siguiente, llevar a exponer sus productos en la cercanía de la basílica de Caacupé y otro grupo lo están haciendo en la ciudad de San Bernardino los fines de semana, los resultados son muy favorable ya que registraron muy buena venta estas últimas semanas.
Cada una de ellas realiza una actividad comercial específica que les permite aportar al ingreso familiar. Estas actividades son las siguientes:
Beatriz A.               - Vivero                     
Elizabeth B.           -  Despensa              
Reina A.                  -  Vivero                      
Mirecha C.             - Vendedora de ropas     
Sonia G.               - Vivero               
Estela R.          - Despensera                    
Rosita F.               Vivero                                          
Milca B.                 - Despensa                   
Ana B.                 Vivero                                              
Jimena A.     - Despensa                      
Norma A.              Vivero                     
Maria G.               - Vivero                      
Leticia H.          - Venta de ropas                 
Teodolina E.      - Despensa         
Cynthia A.           - Vivero                                
Estela F.             - Vivero 


Con los préstamos que le otorgo la Fundación Paraguaya las integrantes compraron gran cantidad de semillas, abonos, mangueras, macetas, otras compraron artículos para la despensa como, azúcar, yerba, leche, carne, galleta.
texts.en:
This group is made up of 16 hard-working ladies from the Cabañas de Caacupé company. The majority of them are farmers and own plant nurseries, selling plants for home gardens. They know the neighborhoods well and all of them help each other with product sales. Now the group is in its eighth loan cycle of the Hardworking Women committee, and they would benefit from a loan of gs 540,000 for each member. Mrs. Beatriz is the president of the committee, and she notes that this group of women is finishing a project. They are showing their products around the Caacupé basilica and in the city of San Bernardino on the weekends. The results are very favorable, and the ladies have recorded good sales in recent weeks. Each of them works in a specific field and contributes to her household income. These are: Beatriz A. - Hatchery Elizabeth B. - Grocery Reina A. - Nursery Mirecha C. - Clothing Sales Sonia G. - Nursery Estela R. - Grocery Rosita F. - Nursery Milca B. - Grocery Ana B. - Nursery Jimena A. - Grocery Norma A. - Nursery Maria G. - Nursery Leticia H. - Clothing Sales Teodolina E. - Grocery Cynthia A. - Nursery Estela F. - Nursery With loans from Fundación Paraguaya the group members will buy a large quantity of seeds, fertilizer, hoses, and flowerpots. Others will buy supplies for their groceries, such as sugar, tea, milk, meat, and chicken.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer, garden plants, and flowerpots. Some ladies will also buy merchandise for their grocery stores, such as sugar, tea, meat, flower, milk, coal, and all types of drinks.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomas  se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche lo comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche). Además trabaja como agricultor en la producción de papa.
 
Vive. en la comunidad Chojasivi de la Provincia Loa Andes del departamento de La Paz ubicado  a cuatro horas de la ciudad de La Paz.

Vive junto a su esposa quien le colabora en los quehaceres del ganado y su hogar que constya de 5 hijos. 
 
El crédito lo destinara en la compra de una vaca lechera y así incrementar  la producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo
texts.en:
Tomas makes a living raising dairy cattle and sells the milk production to PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche). He also works as a farmer growing potatoes. He lives in the community of Chojasivi of the province of Los Andes of the department of La Paz located four hours for the city of La Paz. He lives with his wife who helps with the care of the cattle and his home which includes 5 children. The loan will be used to purchase a dairy cow which will increase the production and therefore increase his income. This is the first loan with Impro. The credit evaluation qualifies him to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania and SELFINA! This is 48-year-old Tatu O M., a widowed mother of six children who is also responsible for supporting two dependents because they are orphans. Tatu has been running a mama lishe since 2005. 

A mama lishe is a local restaurant or café in Tanzania that usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long wooden benches. The food is all-local:  rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize flour), plantain (a cooked savoury banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of sauces.

Working at the business eight hours per day, five days per week, Tatu currently earns about $200 each month.  She is now requesting a loan of $400 in order to purchase rice, beans, wheat flower, maize flower, soda and drinking water, and in the future plans to expand her business.  She thanks you in advance for your support!


ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.
