One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future

loans.use: To purchase rice, beans, wheat flower, maize flower, soda and drinking water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise such as starch, cooking oil, eggs wood, cheese, etc.

loans.name: Erico

texts.es:
El señor Erico tiene 41 años, está casado y tiene 2 hijos, su actividad diaria es la de vender chipas, pan, galletas, pan dulce, etc. en su local propio y en algunas oportunidades en forma ambulante, la elaboración de la misma se encarga su esposa con la ayuda de su hija, quién en forma paciente produce una buena cantidad de estos productos .
En el oficio esta dedicado desde hace mas de 20 años y es muy conocido en la zona porque su calidad de persona y por las delicias de sus chipas y pan caseros.
Con los préstamos que obtuvo de la Fundación Paraguaya, lo invirtió en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de chipas y panes, tales como almidón, queso, aceite vegetal, leñas, harinas, levaduras, entre otros productos, esto le permitió tener una buena cantidad de producción lo que hace que los costos de producción bajen y por ende le genera la posibilidad de bajar el precio de venta de sus producto sin descuidar su utilidad.
texts.en:
Mr. Erico is 41 years old, and is married. He has two children. Erico sells chipas, bread, cookies, sweetbread, etc. from his home and also sometimes as a street vendor. Erico's wife and daughter patiently bake these foods in large quantities. Erico has been working in this business for 20 years, and he's well known in the area for his good character and his delicious chipas and bread. Erico has invested past loans from Fundación Paraguaya in prime materials to make chipas and breads, such as starch, cheese, vegetable oil, firewood, flour, and yeast, among others. This has allowed him to produce in large quantities and thereby lower the costs of production. He is then able to lower the price of his products without decreasing his profits.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise such as cheese, eggs, milk, starch, vegetable oil, flour, yeast, etc.

loans.name: Nelson Franklin

texts.es:
Nelson se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno y  la producción de legumbres, cereales y flores cuya producción  lo comercializa en uno de los mercados mas populares de la ciudad de La Paz.
 
Vive. en la comunidad Palomar de la Provincia Murillo del departamento de La Paz ubicado  a dos horas de la ciudad de La Paz.

Vive junto a su madre, la cual posee una carnicería en el pueblo con lo que colabora a los ingresos de la familia. Quien por descuido y la falta de atención medica se fue agravando una infección en el ojo, pero con la ayuda de médicos cubanos que generalmente hacen su recorrido por las comunidades le hicieron una operación gratuita y ya se encuentra en proceso de recuperación
 
El crédito lo destinara en la compra de una vaca lechera de  mediana calidad y así incrementar  la producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo
texts.en:
Nelson raises dairy cattle and also grows vegetables, grains and flowers which he sells in one of the most popular markets of the city of La Paz. He lives in the Palomar community of the province of Murillo of the department of La Paz, which is located two hours from the city of La Paz. He lives with his mother, who has a meat market in the town which adds to the income of the family. Due to carelessness and lack of medical care, his mother had an eye infection that was getting progressively worse. With the help of Cuban doctors, who travel through the communities, she had a free operation and is in the process of recuperating. The loan will be used for the purchase of a dairy cow of average quality. This will increase the milk production and therefore his income. This is the first loan with Impro. The credit evaluation qualifies him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Evarista

texts.es:
Evarista tiene 27 años está casada y tiene 1 hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de ropas, y zapatos, además como actividad adicional vende bebidas de todas las marcas.
El negocio lo tiene desde hace más de 6 años y posee clientela fija a quienes en algunos casos le vende sobre pedido, su proveedor principal de zapatos se encuentra en la zona del mercado 4 en la capital  Asunción.
Comenta Evarista, que hace aproximadamente 3 años incorporo a su negocio la venta de bebidas heladas de todas las marcas, esta actividad le permitió tener un ingreso adicional muy especialmente los fines de semanas y en temporada de verano, con lo que le permite ayudar a su marido a poder hacer frente a los compromisos de la familia, como así también cubrir los gastos de la educación de sus hijos.
Del préstamo que solicita a la Fundación Paraguaya lo invertirá una parte en la compra de bebidas, y la otra parte en la compra de ropas y zapatos para la temporada de verano, el capital que recibirá le permitirá surtir más su negocio y así poder evacuar los pedidos de su clientela.
texts.en:
Evarista is 27, married, and has one son. She sells clothing and shoes and in addition she also sells various brands of beverages. She has operated her business for over 6 months and has a steady clientele. She takes orders in some cases. Her principal supplier of shoes is located in the zone of Mercado 4 in the capital Asuncion. Evarista comments that she started up her business selling all types of brands of beverages about three years ago. This allows her some additional income especially on weekends in in the summertime. This allows her to help her husband with family expenses and it also covers her son's education. With the loan she has requested from Fundacion Paraguaya she will invest a portion of it into the purchase of beverages, and the other portion will be used for the purchase of clothing and shoes for the summer season. The capital which she will receive will allow her to keep her business well-stocked so that she can fill the orders of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of merchandise such as clothing for children, ladies, and men, wallets, shoes, and all types of beverages, etc.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Marco Antonio   vive en la Avenida “chacaltaya “  de la zona de Achachicala en la ciudad de La Paz.
 
Vive junto a su hijo y esposa, la cual se dedica al comercio y de esa forma ayuda con los gastos del hogar.

Se dedica transporte urbano como chofer asalariado de taxi en una ruta central de la ciudad.

El crédito lo destinara en la reparación de la parte electrica del vehiculo que conduce. 
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Marco Antonio lives in Avenida "Chacaltaya", of the zone of Achachicala in the town of La Paz. He lives with his son and wife who is a merchant and this way helps with the family expenses. He is a taxi driver with the public transportation on one central route of the town. The loan will be spent on repairing the electric part of his vehicle. This is his first loan with Impro, and the evaluation qualifies him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair a taxi.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
El señor Gregorio, es propietario de una despensa él es casado y tiene 2 hijos, su señora es modista y también trabaja en su domicilio, la despensa que poseen esta muy bien surtida y también lo tienen en su mismo domicilio en la ciudad de San José.
 Comenta el señor que con los préstamos que le otorgó la Fundación Paraguaya pudo surtir de gran cantidad de productos de rotación rápida, como ser azúcar, yerba, carne vacuna, pollo, aceite, fideo, arroz entre otros productos de consumo diario, esto genero  más atracción a los clientes potenciales por lo bien surtido que esta su negocio.
Su objetivo a corto plazo y es la comprar materia prima para la elaboración de chipas y venderlo en su despensa, así también desea incorporar la venta de helados y comidas rápidas, ya que en años anteriores en época de verano ya experimento con estos productos y le fue muy bien, entre las comidas a ofertar son hamburguesas, empanadas, pollo, milanesas, etc.
texts.en:
Gregorio owns a grocery store. He is married with 2 children; his wife is a dressmaker and both work out of their home. Their well-stocked grocery is in their home in the city of San José. Gregorio tells us that the loans he has received from Fundación Paraguaya have allowed him to buy high turn-over products in bulk, such as sugar, tea, beef, chicken, oil, noodles, rice among other daily foods which made the store more attractive to potential customers given that it is so well stocked. His short-term goal is to buy the raw materials to make chips to sell in his store; he would also like to begin selling ice cream and fast-foods as he has experimented with these in previous Summers and found that they sold well. He plans to offer food as well, such as hamburgers, empanadas, chicken, milanesas (breaded beef), etc.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as sugar, tea, milk, cookies, a variety of drinks, etc.

loans.name: Juan Ernesto

texts.es:
Juan se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno y  la producción de legumbres cuya producción  lo comercializa en uno de los mercados mas populares de la ciudad de La Paz.
 
Vive. en la comunidad Palomar de la Provincia Murillo del departamento de La Paz ubicado  a dos horas de la ciudad de La Paz.

Vive junto a su esposa, la cual colabora en los trabajos del hogar . 
 
El crédito lo destinara en la compra de una vaca lechera de raza mejorada y así incrementar  la producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo
texts.en:
Juan is dedicated to raise cattle and the production of vegetables which he sells at one of the most popular markets of the city of La Paz. He lives in the Palomar community of the Murillo province of the La Paz department. It is located 2 hours from the city of La Paz. Juan lives with his wife who collaborates with the house chores.

The loan will be used to buy a better breed milk cow and in that way increase the milk production as well as his earnings. It is their second loan with Impro. The evaluation made qualifies him for the loan.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cattle

loans.name: Hery

texts.es:
El señor Hery tiene 28 años, está casado y tiene 2 hijos, su negocio está ubicado en una zona de mucha concurrencia al costado de la ruta 2 a la altura del Km. 52, comenta que los conocimientos de como manejar una casa de repuestos lo adquirió de su padre y hace más de 6 años su padre le cedió el negocio quedándose como propietario.
Al inicio fue difícil porque los clientes estaban acostumbrados a tratar con su Papá, pero a medida iban conociéndole empezaron a tenerles confianza e inclusive les recomendaban a otros clientes para que compren del negocio.
Su principal logro dice ser el hecho de haber mantenido su clientela y haber dotado de más repuestos y esto facilitó evacuar los pedidos de los clientes  mas exigentes en tiempo y forma.
Con los préstamos que le otorgó La Fundación Paraguaya pudo comprar repuestos como ser ruedas, faros, cables, casco, bujías, filtros, aceites, etc.
texts.en:
Hery is 28 years old. He is married and has 2 children. His business is located at a very highly visited area next to route 2, Km. 52. He learned the business of how to manage a spare parts shop from him father. Six years ago, he father left him the shop being Hery the current owner. It was hard at the begining because customers we used to deal with his father, but after meeting him they began to trust him and even to recommend his business to other customers. Its main achievement has been to have been able to maintain the shop's clientele and to expand the business into more spare part items which enabled him to satisfy all this customers' requests in time and form. With these loan granted by the Fundación Paraguaya he was able to purchase spare parts, such as wheel, headlights, cables, helmets, filters, oil, pistons, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de accesorios tales como faros, casco, aceite, caño de escape, ruedas, filtros, etc.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche lo comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche). Además trabaja como albañil en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive. en la comunidad Chojasivi de la Provincia Loa Andes del departamento de La Paz ubicado  a cuatro horas de la ciudad de La Paz.

Vive junto a su esposa y sus cuatro hijos. 
 
El crédito lo destinara en la compra de una vaca lechera y así incrementar  la producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo
texts.en:
Pedro is dedicated to raise cattle. His milk production is sold to PIL Andina (Milk Industrialization Plant). He also works as a bricklayer in the city of El Alto. He lives in the Chojasivi community of the Loa Andes province of the La Paz department located 4 hours from the capital city of La Paz. He lives with his wife and four children.

The loan will be used to buy a milk cow and increase the milk production and his earnings as well. It is his first loan with Impro and the evaluation done qualifies him to receive the loan.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cattle

loans.name: Rudy Alberto

texts.es:
Rudy se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno y  la siembra de legumbres, cereales y flores cuya producción  lo comercializa en uno de los mercados mas populares de la ciudad de La Paz.
 
Vive  en la comunidad Palomar de la Provincia Murillo del departamento de La Paz ubicado  a dos horas de la ciudad de La Paz.

Vive junto a su madre, la cual colabora en los trabajos del hogar y la agricultura. 
 
El crédito lo destinara en la compra de una vaca lechera de de mediana calidad y así incrementar  la producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo
texts.en:
Rudy is dedicated to raise cattle, planting vegetables, cereals, and flowers which are sold in one of the most popular markets of the city of La Paz. He lives in the Paloma r community of the Murillo province of the La Paz department which is located 2 hours from the capital city of La Paz.

He lives with his mom who helps with the household chores and with the agriculture. The loan will be used to buy a milk cow of medium quality and increase the production of milk as well as their earnings. It is their first credit with Impro. The evaluation conducted qualifies him for the loan.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cattle

loans.name: José

texts.es:
El señor José, tiene 58 años, está casado y tiene 4 hijos, posee una despensa en su domicilio, el negocio lo habilitó hace más de 25 años y es muy conocida su despensa en el barrio, ya que gracias a los préstamos que le otorgó la Fundación Paraguaya pudo surtir  bien su negocio. 
Tiene pensado para este verano ampliar su despensa ya que nó está pudiendo exhibir todas las mercaderías que tiene en stock, por el espacio muy reducido con  que cuenta actualmente dentro de la despensa.  
Don José, dice que es un luchador por lo sacrificado que es éste rubro porque uno trabaja de Lunes a Lunes y no se tiene fin de semana, a parte la atención se inicia desde las 05:00 hs. de la mañana, pero se siente muy contento porque maneja su propio negocio y con esto mantiene los gastos de su familia y también le  permite dar una buena  educación  a sus hijos.
Sus principales clientes son las personas que trabajan en oficinas de  la zona, como así también los chiperos y obreros de la fábrica de cerámicas del barrio a quiénes también les provee de los servicio de comidas y desayunos.
texts.en:
José is 58, married, and has 4 children. He owns a grocery store, which he runs from his home. He opened the business 25 years ago and his store is very well known in the neighbourhood, as he has been able to keep his store well stocked thanks to loans from Fundación Paraguaya. He plans to expand his store this summer as he is not able to display all the merchandise he has in stock, given the limited space in the store as it is now. José tells us he is a fighter who has sacrificed much working 7 days a week and never having a weekend off. He opens at 5 A.M. but he has very happy to be working for himself and thanks to his business he is able to pay the household expenses as well as give his children a good education. His customers are mostly people who work in local offices, as well as chiperos (street vendors who sell a typical cheese bun) and factory workers from the local ceramics factory to whom he provides meals and breakfast.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meat, sugar, milk, flour, beer, wine, cheese, eggs, starch, vegetable oil, etc.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche lo comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche). Además trabaja como albañil en la población.
 
Vive. en la comunidad Chojasivi de la Provincia Loa Andes del departamento de La Paz ubicado  a cuatro horas de la ciudad de La Paz.

Vive junto a sus ocho hijos  de los cuales los dos mayores le ayudan en su trabajo y así colaboran con el sustento de la familia. 
 
El crédito lo destinara en la compra de una vaca lechera,  de mediana calidad  y así incrementar  la producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo
texts.en:
Eduardo is dedicated to raise cattle. His milk production is sold to PIL Andina (Milk Industrialization Plant). He lives in the Chojasivi community of the Loa Andes province in the La Paz department which is located four hours from the capital city of La Paz.

He lives with his eight children which two of them help him with work and collaborate with sustenance of the family. The loan will be used to buy a milk cow of medium quality and increase the production of milk as well as their earnings. It is their first credit with Impro. The evaluation conducted qualifies him for the loan.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cattle

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia, es una señora joven casada y no tiene hijos aún, ella es propietaria de un negocio que se dedica a la venta de plantas, abonos, macetas, entre otros productos  para el jardín, su negocio esta ubicado en uno de los barrios de Caacupé.
Lucia comenta, que aparte de la venta de plantas también vende ropas, para damas, caballero y niños, así también ocasionalmente productos de platería como cadenillas, pulseras y anillos. 
Con el préstamo que le otorgará la Fundación Paraguaya pudra comprar gran cantidad de plantas abonos, semillas y accesorios como mangueras, bolsas, maceta, y una parte lo invertirá en la compra de joyas de platas entre otros artículos 
Sus principales cliente son los visitantes de la villa serrana, y su gran movimiento lo registra los fines de semana, el negocio lo heredó de sus padres y afirma que se siente muy satisfecha por el hecho de que tiene la responsabilidad de continuar la microempresa que sus padres le dejo.
Tiene pensado a corto plazo ampliar su casa y ver la forma de abrir una mercería dónde pueda exponer las ropas a ser ofertada como si también las joyas de plata y así ofrecerle mayor comodidad a sus clientes potenciales.
texts.en:
Lucia is a young married woman who does not yet have children. She owns a business where she sells plants, fertilizer, pots, as well as other gardening products. Her store is in a suburb of Caacupé. Lucia tells us that in addition to selling plants, she also sells clothing for ladies, men, and children as well as silver chains, bracelets, and rings from time to time. With the loan which she will receive from Fundación Paraguaya she will be able to buy a large number of plants, fertilizer, seeds and accessories such as hoses and fittings, bags and pots. She will also invest part of the loan in the purchase of silver jewelry among others. Her clients are mainly visitors to the mountain village and her sales peak on weekends. She inherited the business from her parents and is very satisfied that she has been able to continue the business which her parents left her. Her short-term goal is to expand her home and find a way to open a clothing store to display clothing for sale as well as silver jewelry and thus make her potential clients more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seeds, plants, fertilizers, pots, etc.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
La señora Luisa tiene 26 años, está casada y tiene 2 hijo. Ella posee una pequeña fabrica de chipas y  la misma esta dedicada hace mas de 9 años, además de esta actividad también vende en su domicilio artículos de mercería, también ropa especialmente para dama, etc.
Con estas actividades consigue  generar ingresos, y así aportar para cubrir los gastos de la familia, por supuesto se siente muy satisfecho en ayudarle a su marido para hacer frente a los compromisos familiares. 
Los préstamos obtenidos de la Fundación Paraguaya, lo invirtió en la compra de mercaderías en cantidad como ser almidón, quesos, leñas, aceites entre otros productos.
El objetivo de la señora Luisa es la instar frente a su domicilio un puesto de venta de chipas durante esta temporada de festividades de la virgen de Caacupé, ya que en años anteriores le fue muy bien y  logro registrar muy buena venta de sus productos.
texts.en:
Luisa is 26 years old. She is married and has 2 children. She has owned a small chipa (local cheese cakes) factory for more than 9 years. She also sells notions items and clothes, especially bed sheets, etc. With all these activities she manages to make some income and cover her family expenses. She is very proud of being able to help her husband to fulfill the family obligations. She used the previous loans obtained from the Fundación Paraguaya to purchase supplies such as starch, cheese, firewood and oils among other products. Luisa’s purpose this time is to open a shop in front of the home to sell chipa during the festivities for the Caacupé Virgin, as business was very successful on previous years and she managed to sale a large amount of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies such as starch, milk, cheese, eggs, vegetal oil, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
Marcos, tiene 25 años, está casado y tiene 1 hijo, en la actividad de venta de materia prima para elaborar chipas se dedica hace más de 5 años, y el negocio lo heredo de sus padres y comenta que gracias a éste trabajo, él y su señora pueden darle una buena educación a sus hijos y con contar con su casa propia.
Sus principales clientes son las chaperías de la zona quiénes en forma diaria compran los productos que ellos venden como ser almidón, queso, aceite vegetal, entre otros. El barrio San Francisco de Caacupé es una zona eminentemente productora de chipas, por lo que su movimiento de ventas es muy bueno especialmente en los días próximos al fin de semana.
En los meses de Diciembre fecha de la Virgen de Caacupé el movimiento de producción de chipas es incesante, ya que la venta es muy buena en esa época y genera un dinamismo en el barrio, casi en todas las casas elaboran chipas para venderlas.
Con el préstamo que obtendrá de la Fundación Paraguaya podrá comprar, almidón, queso, maíz, entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Marcos is 25 years old. He is married and has a son. He has been working selling raw material to make chipa (local cheese cakes) for more than 5 years, business he inherited from his parents, and he says that thanks to this job, him and his wife are able to provide his son with a good education and pay for their own house. Their main clients are the local chipa stores who buy their products every day. They sell starch, cheese, vegetal oil, and others. The San Francisco de Caacupé neighborhood is a mainly chipa producer area, for which sales there are very successful especially at the beginning of the weekend. In December during the Caacupé Vigin festivities, chipa production is nonstop, and sales are very good and the neighborhood receives a lot of visitors, so most homes makes chipa. With the loan obtained from the Fundación Paraguaya Marcos will be able to purchase starch, cheese, corn, and other products.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw material such as milk, cheese eggs, milk, starch, oil, sugar, sodas, flour, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase raw material such as starch, oil, eggs, firewood, cheese, etc.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El señor Miguel tiene 36 años, está casado y tiene 2 hijos, su actividad diaria es la de atender su pequeño consultorio de masajes terapéutico y rehabilitación, la misma lo tiene en su mismo domicilio, en uno de los barrios mas popular de la ciudad de Caacupé. 
Se dedica a esta actividad hace ya más de 10 años, y gracias a este trabajo puede mantener a su familia y cubrir los gastos propios diarios y la educación de sus hijos.
 Con este préstamo el podrá adquirir una camilla. Su esposa en algunos casos también le ayuda debido a que hay día dónde tienen gran cantidad de clientelas quiénes solicitan turno en forma anticipada, gran porcentaje de sus clientelas son jugadores de futbol y siguen con él su proceso de recuperación y rehabilitación, otra cantidad importante son los niños quienes frecuentemente se presenta por algunas dificultades óseas.
texts.en:
Mr. Miguel is 36-years old, married with 2 children, and operates a therapeutic massage clinic out of his house in a well-known neighborhood in Caacupé city. He has owned his business for more than 10 years, and it allows him to cover his family’s basic needs and pay for his children’s schooling. With this loan he will be able to buy a massage table. His wife sometimes works with him on the days he has more clients than he can handle. Most of his clients are soccer players undergoing rehabilitation; he also treats a number of children who suffer from medical conditions affecting their bones.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of massage table for rehabilitation clinic

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of inventory (sugar, tea, milk, pasta, rice, meat, beverages, vegetables, etc.)

loans.name: Ramón

texts.es:
El señor Ramón tiene 26 años, esta casado y tiene 1 hijo, posee una despensa anexo mercería, se inicio en esta actividad hace mas de 7 años, como todo inicio fue difícil ya que empezó con un pequeño capital, producto de unos préstamos que le realizo unos parientes con ese capital se inicio y actualmente su despensa lo tiene en un barrio muy populoso de la ciudad de Caacupé. 
Los préstamos que le otorgo la Fundación Paraguaya pudo surtir su negocio con la compra de mercaderías y en esta ocasión desea volver a aumentar su stock de mercaderías ya que la demanda aumenta en las épocas de fin de año. Entre las mercaderías que desea adquirir están pan, azúcar, leche, carne, carbón, gaseosas, fideos,  y también artículos de mercería como ser ropas, productos de bellezas, útiles escolares entre otros. 
Su principal logro dice ser el hecho de sacrificarse y haber perseverado en su objetivo de contar con un negocio propio que le permite  ayudar y mantener los gastos de la familia.
texts.en:
Ramón is 26-years old, married with 1 son, and owns a storeroom attached to a general store that he set up more than 7 years ago. Like many small businesses, it was difficult to start. With a little money borrowed from relatives, he began his storeroom in a densely populated neighborhood in Caacupé city. Loans from Fundación Paraguaya have enabled Ramón to purchase merchandise for his store. To meet the heightened demand at the end of the year, he would like to restock his inventory with bread, sugar, milk, meat, coal, sodas, pasta, and other items such as clothes, beauty products, and school supplies. His greatest achievement has been persevering and making the sacrifices necessary for his business, which allows him to provide for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for store (milk, bread, tea, cheese, eggs, cornstarch, oil, flour, sugar, soda, etc.)

loans.name: Rosalino

texts.es:
El  señor Rosalino tiene 33 años, está casado y tiene 2 hijos, el se dedica a la actividad de venta y plantación de flores para jardín, esta en el oficio hace mas de 17 años, Actualmente tiene mucho trabajo porque la ciudad de Caacupé recibe gran cantidad de visitantes y por su puesto se convierte en potenciales clientes, las plantas de mayor movimiento de ventas son las flores de todo tipo, y son las que  requieren mayor atención y cuidado, especialmente en su etapa de florecimiento.

Este préstamo que solicita desea invertirlo en la compra de más semillas, plantas, abonos, mangueras, etc.  
Tiene pensado invertir en la ampliación del negocio y para el efecto ampliara el techo llamado media sombra ya que aun posee un espacio suficiente, de esta forma tendrá mas metros cuadrados para cultivar  rosas, clavel y  otras flores, que son las que requieren de un cuidado muy especial y son las de mayor movimiento de ventas.
texts.en:
Rosalino is 33 years old, married and has two children. He dedicates himself to selling garden plants, an occupation he has carried out for more than 17 years. Currently, he has a great deal of work because the city of Caacupé experiences many visitors, which translates into potential customers. The plants that he sells the most of are all types of flowering varieties, which are the ones that require the most care -- especially when they are in bloom. This loan he requests is to invest into purchasing seeds, plants, fertilizers, hoses, etc. He is thinking about investing in expanding his business, including his shade roof. Even though he has plenty of room, this will allow him more square meters in which to grow his roses, carnations and other flowers, which are the ones that require special care and sell the most.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seeds, plants, fertilizers, hoses, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy toys and fireworks

loans.name: Karina Virginia

texts.es:
La señorita Karina  es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Villa del Lago II” del distrito de Puno, provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno. Tiene 25 años de edad, es soltera sin hijos. Karina con el primer préstamo de S/ 500 compró productos de belleza de unique para vender. Tiene casi 4 año trabajando con el banco. Nos cuenta que estudia nutrición en la universidad.
Con este préstamo de S/.2500 que pagará en 4 cuotas comprará mayor cantidad de productos de belleza de Unique.
Karina desea continuar trabajando para llegar a ser directora de su empresa de productos de belleza y montar un restaurante de comida andina nutritiva.
texts.en:
Señorita Karina is a member of the community bank “Women from the Village on the Lake II” from the neighbourhood Puno, in Puno Province, in the Department of Puno. She is 25 years old and is single with no children. With her first loan of S/500, Karina purchased Unique beauty products to sell. She has worked with the bank for almost 4 years. She tells us that she studies nutrition in the university. With this loan of S/.2500 that she would repay in 4 installments, she would buy a larger quantity of Unique beauty products. Karina wants to continue working in order to become a director of her business of beauty products and to start a restaurant of nutritious Andean food.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products

loans.name: Keyttel Januaria

texts.es:
La microempresaria Keyttel Januaria C. M. tiene 26 años de edad, es casada con una hija menor de edad, es originaria de esta ciudad de Bluefields y se dedica desde hace más  de 4 años a la venta de prendas de oro laminado y con dicho negocio aporta a los gastos del hogar.

La señora C. es vendedora ambulante y visita desde oficinas privadas y estatales hasta casas particulares ofreciendo sus productos los cuales los vende con facilidades de pagos de dos y tres cuotas por cada producto.

Es de mencionar que además de cadenas, pulseras y anillos también oferta chapas y cosméticos tales como perfumes, desodorantes, pinturas de labios entre otros. Sin embargo para poder comprar sus productos y venderlos con facilidades de pago requiere el financiamiento para comprar los siguientes productos:

8  anillos de oro laminado de hombres a US$ 15 dólares cada uno, 5 cadenas de oro laminado de hombre a US$ 30 dólares cada una, 3 pulseras de oro laminado de hombres a US$ 25 dólares cada una, 8 anillos de oro laminado de mujeres a US$ 10 dólares cada uno y 3 cadenas de oro laminado de mujeres a US$ 25 dólares cada una.
texts.en:
The microentrepreneur Keyttel Januaria C. M. Is 26 years old, married and with a young daughter who is a minor. She is from the city of Bluefields and she has been dedicated to sell laminated gold jewelry for more than 4 years. With this business, she is able to contribute to the household expenses. Mrs. C. is a street vendor and visits private and state offices as well as particular households offering her products which she sells offering payment installments of two or three installments for each product. It's good to mention also that besides chains, bracelets, and ringsm she also offers badges and cosmetics like perfumes, deodorants, and lipsticks among others. However, to be able to buy her products and sell them with the facility of the payment installments, she requires financing to buy the following products: 8 men laminated gold rings at $15 dollars each 5 men laminated gold chains at $30 dollars each 3 men laminated gold bracelets at $25 dollars each 8 women laminated gold rings at $10 dollars each and 3 women laminated gold chains at $25 dollars each

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying jewelry to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Eveling Scarlet

texts.es:
La Señora Evelyn Scarlet G. tiene la edad de 33 años, su estado civil es soltera, Doña Evelyn tiene 2 hijos con las siguientes edades su hijo menor de 12 años cursa el 4 grado de primaria y su hijo mayor de 14 años cursa el 3 año de secundaria, sus propósitos son de diversificar su negocio para de cualquier forma mantenerlo activo sus sueños son de tener otros negocios como lo es una pulpería y una tienda de ropa en general para así obtener mas ingresos para su familia en sus deseos esta darle una mejor preparación a sus hijos para darle un mejor futuro y estos no dependan de otras personas y puedan valerse por si mismos.


La actividad económica la que se dedica es el alquiler de videos juegos, la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación, el tiempo que tiene de poseer el negocio es de 4 años, al principio inicio con mercadería en general por lo que necesitaba sacar adelante a su familia por lo que decide actualmente ha ampliado un poco y decide instalar un negocio de videos juegos y es así como se decide salir adelante con este negocio y que tiene que proporcionar la manutención de sus hijos, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que ya que tiene realizar la compras de los diferentes productos como   discos.
texts.en:
Evelyn Scarlet G. is 33 years old. She is single and has 2 children, a 12 year old boy who is in 4th grade in primary school and a 14 year old boy that is in 3th year in secondary school. Her goal is to diversify her business to keep it active. Her dream is to open other businesses such as a grocery store or a general clothes store to generate a larger income for her family. She would like to provide her children with a better education and a better future so they don't have to depend on other people and they can be independent. Her main activity is to sell video games at home. She's been on this business for 4 years. At first, she started selling products in general but as she needed to generate more income to support her family she decided to focus on a specific business and so she opened a video game store. She will use this financing for work capital as she needs to purchase different products, such as CDs or disks.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
La Señora de nombre Maria de los Ángeles U. Solís tiene la edad 53 años, su estado civil es casada, Doña Maria tiene 2 hijos de los cuales sus edades son las siguientes su hijo mayor 33 años que cursa el 4 año de secundaria y asiste a clases por la noches ya que el trabaja y su hijo menor de 14 años y cursa el 5 grado de primaria, su compañero de vida labora es comerciante y tiene un  negocio propio donde vende los productos de gas butano y licorería, sus propósitos son de sacar adelante a su hijo para que pueda de ser un buen provecho para el día de mañana  sus deseos son tener mas vida para terminar la tarea de educar a sus hijos y no sean personas irresponsables y puedan ser provechosas para la sociedad y sus sueños proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda para que esta permanezca bonita para sus hijos y estos puedan vivir cómodamente y que obtengan las mejores condiciones de vida.


La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería donde vende los productos como: golosinas, gaseosas, refrescos naturales y pan, la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación en chichigalpa, el tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 5 años, ella inicia este negocio por la necesidad de obtener un trabajo y decide establecer un pequeño negocio por lo que necesitaba mantener a su familia y salir adelante y decide invertir en golosinas de lo que recibió una excelente repuesta de los clientes que en su mayoría eran niños y así es como decide empezar un medio de trabajo para lograr que este le genere ganancias a su familia, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita realizar la compra de sus productos y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y seguir proporcionando ingresos a su familia.
texts.en:
Maria de los Ángeles U. Solís is 53 years old. She is married and has 2 children. The older one is 33 years old and he’s attending his 4th year at night secondary school as he works during the day. She has another boy, a 14 year old attending his 5th year in primary school. Her husband is a business man. He owns a liquor store and he also sells butane gas. Her purpose is to provide his younger son with a good education so he can take advantage of that in the future. Her wish is to have a longer life, to educate his children to be responsible and useful to society. She also wants to make home improvements so their children can have a nice house to live in, a house where they can feel comfortable and to have better living conditions. She owns a grocery shop at home where she sells products such as, candy, sodas, natural beverages and bread. The shop is located in the city of Chichigalpa. She's had this business for 5 years. She opened this business because she needed a job. She stated selling candy in a small shop to support her family. As the business stated to improve and she became popular among her customers, mostly children, she decided to expand the business to generate a better income. Financing will be used for work capital as she needs to purchase more products to satisfy her customer's demand.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Mrs. Sa Mai Sor Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank group, which consists of seventeen people is located in Phum Thmey village in Kampong Chhnang province. Mrs. Sa Mai S. is the group president who has been selected by the members. She is a housewife who cooks delicious foods for her family. Her husband, Mr. Deam Von, is a construction worker who makes a small income that supports the family. They have six children, four of whom are working in a garment factory, while the others attend the local school. Although Mrs. Sa Mai S.’s family members work hard, they still live in an old house that is in poor condition. In order to improve these conditions, Mrs. Sa Mai S. decided to ask for a loan which along with her savings, will allow her to build a new house for the family.

Village bank group loans consist mainly of end-of-term loans. Five members have had end-of-term loans and the rest have had monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To build a new house for the family.

loans.name: Mrs. Dalin Pich Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eighteen people who live in Phum Thmey village in Kampong Chhnang province have formed a village bank group and are requesting a loan for a variety of purposes. Mrs. Dalin P. is the village bank group president. She is a farmer who earns a small rice farming revenue which cannot support the famiL. very well. Her husband, Mr. Hem Sambo, is an immigrant worker in Korea, working in a garment factory. Mrs. Dalin P. is 32 years old and the mother of five children, four are attending the local school while the youngest one is two years old. Although Mrs. Dalin P.'s famiL. members work hard, they still do not have enough money to build a fence for her house. Mrs. Dalin P. decided to ask for a loan to buy wood to build the fence for her house.

This is a village bank group loan consisting of mainL. end-of-term loans. Thirteen members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthL. payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financialL. able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of onL. 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% at Kiva.

loans.use: To buy wood to build a fence for her house.

loans.name: Pich

texts.en:
Pich D. is a single, 28-year-old resident of Kompong Tom Province. He currently lives with his elderly mother who is a rice farmer. In addition, he lives with two other relatives who work as dealers at a casino; by doing so, they earn approximately $100 per month to help cover some of the family's living expenses.

Pich, meanwhile, is a blacksmith. Specifically, he provides services to his customers by making windows, doors, and other such structures for houses. He notes that he started his business more than eight years ago, and that he has gained a great deal of experience over that time span. To make it easier on his family members for transportation purposes, Pich is now applying for a loan in order to purchase a motorcycle (so that his family members can get where they need to go faster).

loans.use: To help his family members get around town by purchasing a motorcycle

loans.name: Porng

texts.en:
Porng S. is 38 years old and the mother of six children, who are all single and attending school. She has been growing rice since 1995 to earn a living. She produces rice crops twice a year, once during the dry season and once during the rainy season. Her husband is a local fisherman that relies on catching fish in the general area. He currently earns an average of $4 per day. The family lives in Kompong Tom Province.

Porng S. is requesting a loan to buy a cow to help her plow her farmland and provide her family with an additional asset.

loans.use: Buy a cow

loans.name: Las Rosas Group

texts.es: EL GRUPO " LAS ROSAS" ESTA REPRESENTADO POR LA SEÑORA NATALI Y POR 12 MIEMBROS, ENTRE EL GRUPO EXISTE UN PARENTESCO FAMILIAR ENTRE LA SEÑORA PAULA Y BERNARDA LAS CUALES SON HERMANAS, AMBAS DECLARAN TENER INGRESOS TOTALMENTE INDEPENDIENTES UNA D. LA OTRA. LOS SOCIOS (AS) SE DEDICAN A DIFERENTES ACTIVIDADES COMO AL SERVICIO D. LIMPIEZA, MENSAJERÍA, TRABAJOS EN CERÁMICA, AL TRANSPORTE PUBLICO, A LA COMERCIALIZACIÓN D. LECHE, COMIDA Y COSMÉTICOS, ACTIVIDADES EN LAS CUALES EXISTE LA COMPETENCIA PERO LOS SOCIOS (AS) TIENEN EXPERIENCIA EN EL TRABAJO Y SABEN COMO SACAR A FLOTE SUS NEGOCIOS Y SUS TRABAJOS CON TRANQUILIDAD. EN GENERAL EL DESTINO DEL CRÉDITO ES PARA EL INCREMENTO D. SUS INSUMOS Y AL MEJORAMIENTO D. SUS FUENTES D. TRABAJO PARA SER MAS EFICIENTES Y AHORRAR TIEMPO PARA DEDICARSE A SU FAMILIA. LOS SOCIOS (AS) TIENE EXPERIENCIA EN GRUPOS SOLIDARIOS POR LO QUE SABEN ADMINISTRAR LOS FONDOS OTORGADOS CON RESPONSABILIDAD Y CON MIRAS A UN OBJETIVO COMÚN QUE ES EL D. MEJOR SU CALIDAD D. VIDA Y LA D. SUS FAMILIAS.
texts.en:
The Las Rosas group is represented by Natali and 12 other members, two of whom are related: Paula and Bernarda who are sisters. Both say that their incomes are totally independent of one another. The members operate various business such as cleaning services; messaging services; ceramic works; public transportation services; and milk, food and cosmetics sales. All of their businesses face stiff competition but the members are experienced and know how to manage their businesses and work with equanimity. Generally, the loan will be used to buy basic supplies, make the businesses more productive and allow the members to spend the time they save with their families. The members have experience with cooperatives so they know how to responsibly manage the funds allocated to them. Their common objective is to improve their lives and the lives of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operations.

loans.name: Virgen De Urkupiña Group

texts.es: LAS SOCIAS DEL BANCO COMUNAL "VIRGEN D. URKUPIÑA"  SE ORGANIZARON BAJO LA DIRECCIÓN D. SU PRESIDENTA LA SEÑORA JAHANA VANESSA PARA ACCEDER AL FINANCIAMIENTO QUE LES OTORGA AGROCAPITAL CON LA FINALIDAD D. RESPALDAR EL CRECIMIENTO D. LAS ACTIVIDADES QUE DESARROLLAN DENTRO D. LA COMERCIALIZACIÓN D. PRODUCTOS METALÚRGICAS, COMIDA, COSMÉTICOS Y ALGUNO D. LOS SOCIOS DESEA INDEPENDIZARSE Y EMPEZAR UN NUEVO NEGOCIO SIENDO SU ACTIVIDAD ACTUAL CUIDADOR D. VIÑEDOS Y EMPLEADAS DOMESTICAS TODO CON EL AFÁN D. BUSCAR NUEVAS OPORTUNIDADES D. MEJOR SU CALIDAD D. VIDA Y LA D. SUS FAMILIAS, DENTRO DEL GRUPO EXISTEN SOCIAS QUE NO TIENE EXPERIENCIA EN GRUPOS SOLIDARIOS PERO BAJO LA TUTELA Y RESPONSABILIDAD D. SUS COMPAÑERAS D. GRUPO QUIENES ESTÁN DISPUESTAS A RESPONDER POR LAS NUEVAS INTEGRANTES.
texts.en:
The Virgen D. Urkupina community bank was organized under the direction of its president, Jahana Vanessa, to gain access to Agrocapital financing with the goal of backing the growth of its members' businesses. The members operate businesses such as metalurgical product sales; food sales; and cosmetics sales. Some of the members who now work tending vineyards or as domestics, want to strike out on their own and start new businesses, all with the hope of looking for new opportunities to improve their lives and the lives of their families. There are some in the group who have never belonged to a cooperative before but they have the support and guidance of their co-members who are willing to answer for them.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital.

loans.name: Unidas San Geronimo Group

texts.es: EL GRUPO "UNIDAS SAN GERNIMO"  ESTÁN REPRESENTADAS POR LA SEÑORA YESICA Y CONFORMADA POR 12 INTEGRANTES D. LOS CUALES EXISTE UN PARENTESCO FAMILIAR ENTRE LA SEÑORA NELLY QUIEN ES MADRE D. RINA PERO AMBAS TIENEN INGRESOS TOTALMENTE INDEPENDIENTES. LOS SOCIOS (AS) SE DEDICAN A DIFERENTES ACTIVIDADES COMO A LA EDUCACIÓN URBANA, AL SERVICIO DOMESTICO, ELABORACIÓN D. MASITAS, A LA VENTA D. COMIDA, Y JUGOS FRUTALES.  EL DESTINO DEL FINANCIAMIENTO ES PARA EL INCREMENTO D. INSUMOS Y MATERIALES D. TRABAJO Y PARA COMENZAR CON UN NEGOCIO PROPIO PARA PODER TENER UNA ALTERNATIVA MAS PARA SUS INGRESOS. LOS SOCIOS (AS) DEL GRUPO CUENTAN CON EXPERIENCIA EN GRUPOS SOLIDARIOS YA QUE CURSAN SU SEGUNDO CICLO DEMOSTRANDO HONESTIDAD Y RESPONSABILIDAD EN SUS ANTERIORES PAGOS.
texts.en:
The Unidas San Geronimo ['San Geronimo Unit"] group is represented by Yesica and is maD. up of 12 members. Two of the members--Nelly and her daughter, Rina--are related but they have totally independent incomes. The members operate various businesses including: urban education; domestic service; and food and drink sales. The loan will be used to buy basic supplies and work materials and to start businesses in order to have extra means to make money. The members of the group have experience with cooperatives because they're starting on their second cycle, having demonstrated honesty and responsibility in repaying a past loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital.

loans.name: Comadritas Chapacas Group

texts.es: EL GRUPO "LAS COMADRITAS CHAPACAS" REPRESENTADOS POR DOÑA MARÍA VIRGINIA SON UN GRUPO BIEN DINÁMICO Y DIVERSIFICADO, ELLAS TIENEN LA ACTIVIDAD D. LA COMERCIALIZACIÓN D. PRODUCTOS ALIMENTICIOS COMO EL ARROZ, FIDEO, HARINA TAMBIÉN COMERCIALIZAN LICORES, COSMÉTICOS, COMIDA AL PASO, DULCES Y AL TRANSPORTE PÚBLICO D. PASAJEROS. EL CRÉDITO ESTA DESTINADO AL CRECIMIENTO COMERCIAL D. LOS MIEMBROS DEL BANCO PARA LOGRAR UN MEJORAMIENTO CONJUNTO CUYOS BENEFICIOS SEAN PARA LOS MISMOS COMPONENTES Y SUS FAMILIAS, ASÍ MISMO EL BANCO CUENTA CON BUENOS ANTECEDENTES CREDITICIOS YA QUE VAN CURSANDO SU SEGUNDO CICLO Y CUENTAN CON LA CONFIANZA D. LA FUNDACIÓN AGROCAPITAL DEMOSTRANDO PUNTUALIDAD Y RESPONSABILIDAD EN LA ADMINISTRACIÓN D. LOS FONDOS OTORGADOS.
texts.en:
The Las Comadritas Chapacas group, represented by Maria Virginia, is a very dynamic and diverse one. They operate businesses including: sales of food items such as rice, pasta, and flour; liquor sales; cosmetics sales; take-out food sales; sweets; and public transportation services. The loan will be used to support the growth of the members' businesses so that they can improve their incomes and, in turn, their lives and the lives of their families. The bank is building on a good credit history because the members are starting on their second cycle and they've demonstrated to Fundacion Agrocapital that they can repay their loan responsibly and punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital.

loans.name: Las Kantutas Group

texts.es: EL GRUPO "LAS KANTUTAS" ESTA REPRESENTADO POR EL SEÑOR BERNARDINO Y CONSTITUIDOS POR 16 MIEMBROS LOS CUALES SE DEDICAN AL COMERCIO D. PRODUCTOS COMO ROPA, TEJIDOS, SANDALIAS, COSMÉTICOS  A LA ELABORACIÓN D. PAN, AL TRANSPORTE PÚBLICO Y A LA CONSTRUCCION D. VIVIENDAS. COMO EN TODO RUBRO COMERCIAL SIEMPRE EXISTE LA COMPETENCIA Y LA OFERTA D. PRODUCTOS A BAJO COSTO, POR LO QUE LOS SOCIOS (AS) TIENEN QUE TENER LOS PRODUCTOS D. MAYOR DEMANDA A MENOR PRECIO, UNA D. LAS VENTAJAS DEL GRUPO ES QUE SUS PUESTOS D. VENTA SE ENCUENTRAN ALEJADOS D. LA CIUDAD POR LO QUE TIENEN MAYOR POSIBILIDAD D. VENTA, PERO LA DESVENTAJA D. ELLO ES LA EDUCACIÓN RURAL PARA SUS HIJOS POR LO QUE ELLOS TIENE LA ESPERANZA D. ENVIAR A SUS HIJOS A LA CIUDAD EN DOND. RECIBIRÁN UNA MEJOR EDUCACIÓN.  EL DESTINO DEL CRÉDITO ES PARA EL INCREMENTO D. MERCADERÍA E INSUMOS PARA CUMPLIR CON LAS DEMANDAS DEL MERCADO. LOS SOCIOS VAN CUMPLIENDO SU TERCER CICLO POR LO QUE CONOCEN DEL TRABAJO CON GRUPOS SOLIDARIOS ASÍ COMO LA RESPONSABILIDAD Y  HONESTIDAD QUE SE REQUIERE PARA UN FINANCIAMIENTO COMO EL OTORGADO POR LA FUNDACIÓN AGROCAPITAL.
texts.en:
The Kantutus group is represented by Bernardino and is maD. up of 16 members who operate various businesses including: clothing sales; fabric sales; footwear sales; cosmetics sales, sales of baked goods; taxi services; and construction services. As in all commercial endeavors, there's competition and offers to sell similar products at lower costs, so the members have to have products for which there's a lot of demand and sell them for less. One advantage for the group is that their businesses are located outsiD. of the city which gives them greater opportunities to sell. The disadvantage of that for them is that their children can only get a rural education. They hope to send their children to the city where they would receive a better education. The loan will be used to buy merchandise and supplies to meet the demands of the market. The members will be completing their third cycle so they know how to work within a cooperative and have demonstrated the responsibility and honesty required to get financing like that provided by Fundacion Agrocapital.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital.

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: Sen S. is 26 years old and lives in the Kompong Tom Province. She makes a living raising female cows and selling their offspring, as well as growing rice. She started her businesses more than eight years ago and is currently earning approximately $2 a day. S. is married to Sin Sarat, a local fisherman. She now cares for one young child and her old mother. S. hopes to expand her business; thus she is applying for a $500 loan to purchase more cows to raise and use them to help her in her farming. The loan will help to make her family's life a little more comfortable. (S.'s mother is pictured because she was not available that day)

loans.use: To purchase more cows

loans.name: Chamroeurn's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chamroeurn Y. is the leader of a group of five people, all of whom live in the village of Kraing Sromor in Kampong Chhnang province. Her husband, Mr. Brok P., helps her on the plantation. She is 45 years old, and she is the mother of five children; three of her children are employed in a garment factory, while the other two children are currently attending the local school.

Mrs. Chamroeurn Y. is a pig breeder who is currently raising one pig. Because her business has been doing rather well, she wants to expand and improve the business. Accordingly, she decided to ask for a loan in order to buy two more piglets for her breeding business.

This group loan primarily consists of what are referred to as "end-of-term" ("EoT") loans. Indeed, three members are seeking such EoT loans, while the other group members are seeking monthly payment loans. More specifically, with the EoT loans, the borrowers are not required to repay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan's term (i.e., the maturity date), whereas the monthly payment loans require the borrowers to make regular monthly payments. EoT loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor people; in particular, such loans allow the borrowers to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Interestingly, most clients start to make principal payments on EoT loans many months before the end of the loan's term. Further, almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time: AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09%, and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva loans.

One group member, Mrs. Sovann Y., is not seeking a loan, but her husband is applying for a loan; as a result, he is captured in the picture rather than her.

loans.use: To expand and improve her pig breeding business by purchasing two more piglets

loans.name: Mrs. Yet Tol Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank group consists of fifteen people who live in the village of Spean Pau in Kampong Chhnang province. The group is collectively seeking a loan, but all of the members will use the loan proceeds for different purposes, depending on their individual business needs.

Mrs. Yet T. is the village bank president. She owns a small restaurant where she sells Khmer noodles to both residents of and visitors to her local village. Her husband, Mr. Prak Noeurn, is a carpenter who makes beds, chairs, and other such wood products. Mrs. Yet T. is 39 years old, and she is the mother of two children, both of whom help their parents with their current businesses. Although she and her husband (and their children, for that matter) work extremely hard, they still do not earn sufficient income to properly support the family. As a matter of fact, they do not have enough money to purchase rice to keep in stock to feed the family. Thus, Mrs. Yet T. decided to ask for a loan in order to purchase rice.

One group member, Mr. Chandara H., is not seeking a loan, but his wife is; so, his wife is captured in the picture rather than him.

loans.use: To purchase rice in order to continue to feed her family

loans.name: Mrs. Sok Len Phan Village Bank Group

texts.en: Sixteen people who live in Spean Pau village in Kampong Chhnang province have formed a village bank loan group. Mrs. S. Len P. is the village bank loan group president who has been selected by the members. She owns a small store where she sells grocery products in the local market. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery products for her inventory. Her husband, Mr. C. Reth, is a fisherman who catches fish locally. Mrs. S. Len P. is 30 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is five years old and too young to work or study. Mrs. Sarom C. husband is shown in the picture instead of her.

loans.use: Buy additional grocery products for inventory.

loans.name: Prak

texts.en: Prak C. is a 34-year-old resident of the Kompong Tom Province. She earns a living by sewing clothes as a local tailor. She is running her business very well and a lot of clients recognize her good service. She started her work in 2005, and currently earns a profit of $5 a day. C. is a mother of three children, all of whom are single and are employed. Her son is a construction worker; her two daughters assist with her farm business, and her husband is also a construction worker. C. now requests a $250 loan to buy oxen to raise. Oxen is a main source of raising income for renting by farmers. (C.'s husband appears in the picture because she was not available)

loans.use: To buy oxen to raise

loans.name: Mr. Chen Bou Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eight people who live in Andoung Chros village, in Kampong Chhnang province, have formed a village bank loan group. Mr. C. B. is the village bank loan group president who has been selected by the members. He is a farmer who owns a small plot of land and cultivates rice to earn for living. His wife, Mrs. Khum Lay, works in a garment factory and contributes a small salary to the support of the family. Although they work hard, they still cannot support the family well. In order to improve their living conditions, Mr. C. B. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to start a breeding business. Mr. C. B. is 29 years old and the father of two children who attend the local school. Mr. C. B.'s wife is shown in the picture.

Two members in this village bank loan are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a cow and start a breeding business.

loans.name: Mrs. Sine Keo Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan group consists of nine people, located in Andoung Chros village in Kampong Chhnang province. Each of the members in this group will use this loan for different purposes. Mrs. Sine K. is the village bank loan group president. She owns a small restaurant where she sells rice soup to villagers and passerbys in the local village. Her husband, Mr. Leang Pinh, is a rice wine maker in the local village. Aside from this business, he is a breeder and raises fourteen pigs. Since this business is going well, he wants to expand it, so Mrs. Sine K. decided to ask for a loan to buy three more piglets for breeding. Mrs. Sine K. is 27 years old and the mother of five children. Three  are attending the local school while the others stay at home as they are too young to work or study. 

Two members in this village bank group loan are end-of-term loans and the rest are monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy three more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Maryam Abdul Sattar Group

texts.en:
Maryam baji is a 45 year old married lady who lives in Kot Radha Kishan, which is 24km away from the city of Kasur, Pakistan. She lived there for the past 30 years. She is an uneducated lady because of her father’s lack of financial resources. Her husband's name is A. S., and he is an electrician by profession. He has 20 years of experience in this business. Most people call on him to repair fans and other electrical items. She is the mother of four kids: three daughters and one son. Her son and her elder daughter read in 10th standard. Her next daughter is in 8th standard, and her younger daughter is in 5th standard. Maryam baji has a milk selling business which she handles independently. She does this work to improve the financial situation of her family and pay the school fees for her kids. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy another buffalo to expand her milk selling business. 

She is a group leader of some more women. Zubaida baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Seema baji wants a loan to repair her vehicle named “Shahzore”. Sugran baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk selling business. Salma baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for milk selling business

loans.name: Samon

texts.en: Mrs. Samon N. was born in 1981 and lives in Khsom village in Kandal province. She is employed at a garment factory. Her husband, Mr. Sing Rith, is a pig breeder. Even though they try to work hard, they can't earn enough income to provide a better life for their family, or for the family members who also live in their old house. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Samon N. decided to request a loan to repair the house for her family. Her husband is presented on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To repair the house for her family.

loans.name: Bushra Subah Sadiq Group

texts.en:
Bushra baji is a 34 year old widow who lives in a place named Kot Radha Kishan, which is 24km away from the city of Kasur, Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house, where she has lived for the past 20 years. She has spent 10 years of her life as a widow. Her husband died of a heart attack. He left behind three kids: two sons and one daughter. Her elder son is a milkman and has been selling milk for the past 5 years. Her younger son works in a factory. Her daughter is 10 years old and reads in 5th standard. Bushra baji did lots of hard work to raise her children. She sews clothes day and night to earn an income. Her children give her a lot of respect a lot and call her the world’s greatest mother. She is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo to expand her son’s milk selling business. 

She is joined in her loan group by some other women. Sugran, Parveena, and Nursrat baji each want a loan to buy buffalo for their milk selling businesses. Sajida baji wants a loan to buy clothes to resell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for milk selling business

loans.name: Ghalam Nabie

texts.en:
Ghalam Nabie is the son of S. A., and lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. Ghalam, 54, lives near the Afghan Hotel and is married with five children. He has a small restaurant in the city and has good experience in this field and would like to expand his business to support his family.

He is requesting an individual loan of 50,000 Afghans ($1050) for a term of 18 months to enlarge his business and to buy a new desk and table and other necessary things for his shop in order to further his business with more success.

Ghalam is very happy to be involved in this loan process and is especially grateful for the help of the AFSG and Kiva. He thanks all lenders around the world.

loans.use: Enlarge his business and purchase furniture and items for it

loans.name: Yoeurn

texts.en: Yoeum S. is 25 years old and lives in the Kompong Tom Province where she makes a living by collecting chickens to store and then sells them from village to village in her community for profit. She also sells wood carvings. S. currently earns a profit of $4 a day. She is married with one young child, and her husband, aged 23, raises pigs from home. The young couple hopes to earn additional income to help provide the family with food and enlarge their businesses; thus they both need to request a loan of $500 to buy more chickens to sell and piglets to raise. (S.'s husband with her child are pictured because she was not available)

loans.use: To buy more chickens & piglets to raise then sell

loans.name: Kosar M. Jamil Group

texts.en:
Kosar baji is a 39 year old married lady who lives in a place named Kot Radha Kishan, which is 24km away from the city of Kasur in Pakistan. She has lived there for the past 15 years. Her husband's name is M. J., whose profession is selling milk, which he has done for the past 10 years. She is the mother of five daughters. All of her daughters are attend the local school near their house. Kosar baji is a very hardworking housewife. First she gets up early in the morning and helps her husband get milk from the buffalo, then transfers the milk into milk pots. Then she prepares the breakfast for her family, gets her daughters ready for school, and then cleans the whole house. She performs her duties without taking any breaks. Her family is very happy with her. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo to expand her husband’s business.

She is joined in her loan group by some more women. Barkat baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for a milk selling business. Sharifan baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Shazia baji wants a loan to buy artificial jewelry to resell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for milk selling business

loans.name: Sarikakeo

texts.en: Mrs. Sarikakeo P. is a villager in Damnak Sangke village in Kandal province. She is a wedding chef who has been hired by the villagers to cook at wedding ceremonies, parties, and so on. She is a 26 year old widow with a child who is attending the local school. She now wants to purchase a motorbike to go to work; unfortunately, she does not have enough money. In order to deal this problem, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to go to work.

loans.name: Songambele Group

texts.en:
Juma S., 32, is married with four children ages 12, 9, 6, and 2. He owns a general store where he sells various items. He has been in this business for five years now and works daily from 6am until 10pm. He is able to earn a monthly profit of about US$ 114.

This will be Juma’s sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous five loans to increase the inventory of his shop, and he bought some land. He has paid the loans back successfully. He now hopes for a new loan to start developing his land.

Juma will share this loan with subgroup A of the Songambele group. The subgroup has 6 members who run shops, a video library, sell soap, and sell fish. These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Juma is the 1st on the right.

loans.use: To  develop his land by  starting building a house

loans.name: Srey Pao

texts.en: Mrs. Srey Pao S. is 29 years old and she now lives in Chek village in Kandal province. She is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Thon Phat, is farmer who owns a plot of land where he cultivates rice. In the plantation, he faces some problems because he does not have enough rice seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides to support his field. Additionally, he does not have enough money to purchase fuel for the pump in order to water or to hire laborers to work on the field. Thus, Mrs. Srey Pao S. decided to ask for a loan for her husband's purposes. She hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides

loans.name: Houn

texts.en: Mrs. Houn S. is 57 years old and a widow with two children, one of whom is a laborer while the other is attending the local school. She lives in Chrouy Dang village in Kandal province. She is a clothes seller who owns a small stall in the market. Since she has a lot of customers who want new fashions, she decided to request a loan to buy more fashionable clothes for her customers. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: to buy more fashionable clothes for her customers

loans.name: Hos

texts.en: Mrs. Hos N. is 51 years old and a widow with two children who are employed in garment factory. She is a farmer in Angk village in Kandal province. She owns a 1-hectare field where she cultivates rice. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because her field has infertile soil which has a bad effect on her crop. In order to solve this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer; she plans to use the rest of the money to hire laborers to work on the field.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and hire laborers to work on the field

loans.name: Srieng's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Srieng T. is the group leader for five people who all live in Sram Angkam village in Kampong Cham province. She and her husband, Mr. S. Phorn, are farmers who own a small piece of land where they cultivate rice. In the plantation, they can earn only a little rice revenue, not enough to support the family. In order to improve their living standard, Mrs. Srieng T. decided to ask for a loan to purchase some piglets to start a pig-breeding business.

Mrs. Srieng T. is the mother of five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another is a construction worker. Two of her children are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Mrs. Srieng T. did not come to take her loan but her husband did, so he is in the picture instead of his wife.

All the members in this group loan have end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loans' term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase some piglets to start breeding pigs

loans.name: Domingos Xavier

texts.pt:
Domingos Xavier T. é natural da Matola um dos distritos da província do Maputo, tem 75 anos de idade, é casado e pai de 25 filhos, com 37 netos.

Domingos estudou até 4ªclasse e parou quando foi escolhido para ir tirar o curso Bíblico pela igreja qual teve que interromper quando a sua mãe ficou gravemente doente, dai que começou a trabalhar nos Caminhos de Ferros de Moçambique com segundo oficial e mais tarde foi a Portugal como jogador tendo permanecido por três anos e volta a Moçambique e continuou a trabalhar nos C.F.M tendo reformado em 1990.

Domingos depois da reforma iniciou um negócio que consistiu na compra e venda de produtos da primeira necessidade actividade que desenvolve até data hoje. Com um estabelecimento comercial e trabalha durante 12 horas por dia e conta com ajuda de um dos seus filhos. Desta consegue um rendimento mensal líquido de 7000,00mt. Não faz poupança.
texts.en:
Domingos Xavier T. is a native of Matola, one of the districts of the province of Maputo. He is 75 years old, married, and the father of 25 children. He has 37 grandchildren. Domingos studied until the 4th grade and stopped when he was chosen to take a bible course through the church which he had to interrupt when his mother became gravely ill. From there he started working on the railways of Mozambique as a second official. Later he went to Portugal as a soccer player for three years then returned to Mozambique and continued to work the railways. He retired in 1990. Domingos, after retiring, began a business that consisted in the purchase and sale of staple products, an activity that he continues to develop today. He has a commercial establishment and works 12 hours per day with the help of one of his children. He is able to earn a liquid monthly income of 7,000MT. He does not have any savings.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of staple products

loans.name: Hanifan M. Ramzan Group

texts.en:
Hanifan baji is a 43 year old married lady who lives in Kot Radha Kishan, which is 24km away from the city of Kasur, Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house, where she has lived with her family for the past 30 years. Her husband's name is M. R., and he runs a grocery shop in the community. He has 20 years of experience in this business. Hanifan baji has five kids: three sons and two daughters. Her elder son works with his father. The next to him is a welder. The other kids attend school near their house. Hanifan baji spends her time knitting clothes for her neighbors. She is saving her income and plans to renovate the house. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy groceries to diversify her husband’s grocery shop into a store. 

She is a group leader of some more women. Sharifan baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy products (cooking oil, lentils and spices) for her food selling business. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy wood to resell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop.

loans.name: Mrs. Chantha Tuy Village Bank Group

texts.en: Twenty-one people from the village of Kandal Kraom in Kandal Province formed a group to apply for a village bank loan. They will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Chantha T. is the village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice. However, she does not have enough rice seeds to grow on her land. So she decided to request a loan for this purpose, and will use the rest of the loan to purchase fertilizer to make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. PH. Phally, sells icecream in the local village. Mrs. Chantha T. is 42 years old and the mother of four childR., one of whom helps with the father's business while another is employed in a garment factory and the others attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Ruqaiya M.yunas Group

texts.en:
Ruqaiya baji is a 39 year old married lady who lives in Kot Radha Kishan, which is 24km away from the city of Kasur, Pakistan. She has lived there for the past 20 years. Her husband's name is M., and he sells dried fruit. He has 15 years of experience in this business. She is the mother of six kids: four sons and two daughters. Her elder son runs a store in a school. The next to him has a food selling business. Another son is a fruit seller. Her youngest son is in 9th standard. Her daughters do household work and take care of the family. Ruqaiya baji is a seamstress and completes the orders with the help of her daughters. She takes orders from her neighbors, and gets lots of orders on occasions such as the Muslim Eid Day. She is saving her income and plans to marry off her eldest daughter when she has saved enough. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy products (biscuits, chips) for her son’s canteen. 

She is a group leader of some more women. Sugran baji wants a loan to buy products (tea and sugar) for her tea stall. Khursheed baji wants a loan to buy wheat to resell. Siddiqan baji wants a loan to rent land to grow seasonal vegetables. Suraiya baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk selling business.
