This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy biscuits and chips for her son's canteen.

loans.name: Mrs. Koen Meas Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of fifteen people located in Kandal Kraom Village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Koen M. is the village bank president and was selected by the group members. She sells clothes in the local market. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it; thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fashion clothes to resell. She hopes to increase her income and improve their living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Noeun Socheat, is a goldsmith in the local market. Mrs. Koen M. is 30 years old and the mother of a young child.

loans.use: To buy more fashion clothes to resell.

loans.name: Shapoor

texts.en:
Shapoor K. is 33 years old.  He is married and lives with his family, in Ningarhar province .  Shapoor has 2 children, who go to school.  His brother works with him on the agricultural lands that they own. They share a single house. After his father died, Shapoor became the responsible person for the household.

Besides farming, Shapoor is a teacher .  He teaches in a public school in the morning, and in the afternoon he works as a farmer in his village. He grows different kinds of vegetables and sells them in the bazaar.  Along with the farming, he has livestock.  His small son brings grass for the animals.
 
Shapoor is a hardworking man, but there are 14 members in his family and supporting that many people with only 500 Afghanis ($10) a day income is almost impossible.  He therefore has to expand his business.  He thinks that if he buys more livestock and seed for his land, he can increase his income. He has requested AFSG for a 50000(AF) ($1,075) loan.  He has decided to buy a cow and with the remaining loan, purchase seed and pesticide. 

Shapoor K. dreams of the day that he solves all his economic problems and can concentrate on teaching.

loans.use: Purchase livestock of seed

loans.name: João

texts.pt:
João B. é natural de Maputo e tem 42 anos de idade, casado e pai de 2 filhos ainda estudantes, para alem dos filhos sustenta uma prima que vive com ela.

João estudou até 10ªclasse e parou quando perdeu o seu pai e não tinha alguém para o custear os estudos, assim viu se obrigado a procurar emprego para o seu sustenta e mais tarde tirou o curso de professor primário e neste momento dá aulas. Funcionário do estado e tem um salário mensal de 4600,00mt.

Para João este é o terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva com qual pretende continuar com a construção da sua obra. Desta maneira diz que vai procurar pagar antes do tempo para voltar solicitar outro empréstimo de forma a concluir mais rápido a sua casa.
texts.en:
João B. is a native of Maputo. He is 42 years old, married, and the father of 2 children who are both still students. Besides his children he also supports a cousin who lives with them. João studied until the 10th grade and stopped when he lost his father and had no one to pay for the costs of his schooling. As such he was obliged to search for work to sustain himself. Later he took a course to teach elementary school, and now he teaches classes. He is an employee of the state, and he earns a monthly salary of 4,600MT. This is João's third loan through Hluvuku and his first with Kiva. He intends to use the proceeds to continue with the construction on his home. In this way he says he will try to pay off the loan before the term so he can return and borrow another loan with the hopes of finishing his home more quickly.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en: Mrs. Chhun Y., 60, is sells groceries from her house in Siem Reap Province. She sells a variety of products such as oil and other foods items. She is widowed with one daughter, who is married. Her business is doing well and she has many clients. She would to increase her business to provide her with more income. Therefore, Chhun Y. would like to request a loan to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mrs. Phalla Choung Village Bank Group

texts.en: Ten people living in Anlong Romeit Choeng Village in Kandal Province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. For example, Mrs. Phalla C., the 44-year-old village bank president, owns a small grocery store in the local village. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more grocery goods, hoping to increase income and improve family living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Touch Sokea, is a wedding chef who has been hired by villagers to cook for wedding ceremonies, parties, etc.  They have three children, two of whom are attending the local school.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery goods for her business.

loans.name: Vannak's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Vannak C., the 37-year-old group leader of four people who live in Anlong Romeit Choeng Village in Kandal Province, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land upon which she cultivates rice. She is requesting a loan to hire laborers to harvest rice.  Her husband, Mr. Preap Sareoun, is a policeman. They have four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To hire laborers to harvest rice.

loans.name: Mrs. Nara Den Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan is granted to sixteen people located in Anlong Romeit Choeng Village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Nara D. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a grocer who does not earn enough income to support her household. Since she has a lot of customers who need many varied items, she wants to expand her grocery store. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase more grocery goods for her inventory. Her husband, Mr. Suos Vanna, is a construction worker. Mrs. Nara D. is 43 years old and the mother of four children, three of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods for her inventory

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase grocery inventory for sale

loans.name: Sen's Group

texts.en:
This small loan request is being made by five borrowers, all residents of Siem Reap Province. Mr. Sen S. is 32 years old and the leader. He makes a living by selling carving wood out of his home. He can earn a profit of approximately US$ 2 per day to cover his family's living expenses. He is married to Nor Chaom, 22, a grocery seller. She runs a store from their house selling various kinds of groceries to neighbors, which allows her to earn about US$ 2 a day. Besides this, she is a good housewife who takes time to care for her one young child. Mr. S. has humbly requested a loan for his wife to purchase various grocery items for sale.

The four other borrowers are

Bon S., 26 years old, a carving wood seller. He is seeking a loan to buy piglets to raise.

Te Toeun is 50 years old and is a wine distiller. He requests a loan to purchase poultry for breeding.

Khon P., 24, sells carving wood out of his home and he is asking for a loan to buy piglets to raise.

Dib C. is age 45 and makes a living distilling wine for sale. She would like to ask for a loan to purchase piglets to raise. (C.'s husband is pictured, because she was not available.)

loans.use: To purchase  grocery items for sale

loans.name: Mr. Den Mao Village Bank Group

texts.en:
FourteE. people who live in Anlong Romeit Choeng Village in Kandal Province make up this village bank and they will use the loan which they obtained for different purposes. Mr. DE. M. is the village bank president. He is a village chief who makes only a small salaR. to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Say Soth, is a farmer who owns 0.2-hectare where she cultivates rice. Although they cultivate rice, they still make only a little rice revenue which cannot support the family. In order to support them, Mr. DE. M. decided to ask for a loan to buy rice to eat. He is a 59-year-old and the father of two childrE., one of whom is employed in a garment factoR. while the other is staying at home to do housework.

Two members in this village bank loan have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Those who have EoT loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the veR. end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to buy rice to eat

loans.name: Meth

texts.en: Mr. Meth L. lives in Kaung Kang Tie Muoy village in Kampong Cham province. He sells ice-cream. In this business, he faces an obstacle because he does not have a motorbike to transport the ice cream to sell door-to-door. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to add to his savings to buy a motorbike for his business. He hopes to increase his income and improve the living conditions of his family with this loan. His wife, Mrs. Mouk Meth, is a housewife. Mr. Meth L. is 55 years old and the father of ten children, two of whom are farmers while another is employed in a garment factory. One of his children is a laborer while the others are attending the local school. Mr. Meth L. is not in the picture because he was busy with his work so his wife is shown instead in the picture.

loans.use: to add to his savings to buy a motorbike to transport ice cream to sell door-to-door

loans.name: Nader

texts.en:
Nader K. is a 52 year old man.  He is married and the father of four children.  The household has lived in Ningarhar province for a long time.  Nander has worked as a farmer for the last several years in his village. His children go to school and he is the sole breadwinner for his family.

Nader grows different kinds of vegetables on his land and sells them in the central market of the city.  However, his current $8 a day income is not sufficient to support the family; he needs at least $20.  Besides their schooling, his sons help him on the farm  but Nader doesn’t allow them spend to much time working the farm, as he wants them to do well in school and pursue a bright future.
 
Nader K. has been thinking about how to solve his problems for a while now. He finally decided to purchase a water pump and increase his livestock.  He knows that this business is quite profitable in his area. There are a lot of grasslands in his village and he would be able to provide sufficient food for the stock. He believes that with the purchase of a water pump he could sell water to other farmers in his village.  With this plan in mind, he has applied for 50,000 Afghanis loan to be repaid over 27 months.
 
Nader K. wants to expand his business, buying more livestock and start a livestock selling business in future. He thanks the lenders for their assistance.

loans.use: Pruchase a water pamp for his farm

loans.name: Rosa Cacilda

texts.pt:
Rosa Cacilda D. é natural da província do Maputo e tem 51 anos de idade, mãe de cinco filhos onde apenas um que vai para escola, outros já são maiores de idade e já formaram suas famílias. É separada a treze anos. 

Rosa estudou até segunda classe diz que na altura era difícil ir a escola primeiro na sua zona uma mulher ia a escola com dez anos e aos 17 anos era obrigada a ir ao lar, desta forma ela não conseguiu estudar. 

Rosa pois a separação teve que iniciar com o negocio para o sustento dos filhos negocio que consiste na compra e venda de produtos da primeira necessidade, actividade que desenvolve até data hoje com ajuda de um empregado, tem um rendimento mensal de 9800.00mt  e consegue poupar algum periodicamente.

Este é o terceiro empréstimo da Rosa no Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva, outros também aplicou na compra de mercadoria e pretende pagar antes do tempo para solicitar outro afim de fazer arranjos na sua casa.
texts.en:
Rosa Cacilda D. is a native of the province of Maputo. She is 51 years old, the mother of 5 children only one of which goes to school. The others are already adults and have formed their own families. She has been separated for 13 years. Rosa studied until the 2nd grade and says that at the time it was difficult to go to school in her area because a girl would go to school as a 10 year old and at 17 she would be obligated to be at home. In this way she was not able to study. Rosa, after her separation, had to begin a business to sustain her children. The business consists of purchasing and selling staple products, an activity she continues today. She has one employee, a monthly income of 9,800MT, and is able to save some money periodically. This is her third loan through Hluvuku and her first with Kiva. The others also were applied to the purchase of merchandise, and she intends to pay this loan off before the maturity so she can solicit another loan to make arrangements in her home.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of staple products

loans.name: Noeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Noeurn C., 48, lives in Ta Sen Village in Kampong Cham Province where she sells Khmer noodles door-to-door. Her husband, Mr. Vong Ny, is a construction foreman lacking sufficient funds to buy construction equipment to support his career, so Noeurn is requesting a loan for that purpose. They are the parents of three children, one of whom is a construction worker while the others are enrolled in local school.

loans.use: To buy construction equipment for her husband's business.

loans.name: Hom

texts.en: Mr. Hom U., 57, is a construction foreman living in Ta Sen Village in Kampong Cham Province. Because he needs more construction equipment, he is requesting a loan to make the necessary purchases. His wife, Mrs. Chork Im, is a housewife, and they have two children, one a driver and the other a fruit seller.

loans.use: To buy construction equipment.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en: Mrs. Sokha N. is 21 years old and lives in Ta Sen village, in Kampong Cham province. She and her husband, Mr. Yoeun Kimyan, are fish breeders. They do not earn sufficient income with their business, to support their household. In order to improve their standard of living, Mrs. Sokha N. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike so that her husband could start a business as a motorbike taxi driver. They hope to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan. Sokha is 21 years old and the mother of one child who is too young to work or study. Her husband is presented with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Srey Aonn

texts.en: Mrs. Srey Aonn R. lives in Ta Sen village in Kampong Cham province. She is a fruit seller. Her husband, Mr. Thy Ra, is a motorbike taxi driver. The couple does not earn enough income to support their household. To improve their living conditions, Mrs. Srey Aonn R. decided to ask for a loan to buy some piglets and start a business breeding pigs. She would use the rest of money to purchase pig feed. She is 25 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study. Her husband is with her on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy some piglets to start a business, breeding pigs..

loans.name: Bieng

texts.en:
Mr. Bieng B. is a farmer in Krodass Kor village in Kampong Cham province. He owns a plot of land and cultivates rice to earn a living. On this plot of land, he must deal with the problems that his land is infertile and that he does not have enough money to buy fuel for a pump, to water his field. He has requested a loan to solve these problems. 

Mr. Bieng B. is a 47-year-old widower with five children, one is a laboror in the Thailand and another is a fisherman. One child is a farmer and helps his father out while the others attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy fuel for a pump to water his field.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.pt:
Fernando C. é natural de Boane um dos distritos da província do Maputo, tem 35 anos de idade, é casado e pai de três filhos com idade entre o primeiro com 12 anos e o segundo com três e ultimo com um ano de idade respectivamente.

Fernando estudou até segunda classe e não continuou por falta de condições financeiras da família, muito novo teve que desenvolver actividade comercial para poder se sustentar teve como seu primeiro negocio a venda de pão e mais tarde investiu num pequeno estabelecimento comercial e começou a vender produtos da primeira necessidade. Hoje tem um estabelecimento maior tipo mercearia. Tem um rendimento mensal aproximadamente 24000,00mt e consegue poupar 2000,00mt.

Para Fernando este é o segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva, o primeiro foi de 8000,00mt e aplicou na compra de mercadoria, este também pretende fazer o mesmo. Futuramente pretende solicitar outro empréstimo para permitir mais poupança para mais tarde comprar uma viatura afim de ajudar nas compras de mercadorias.
texts.en:
Fernando C. is from Boane, one of the districts in the province of Maputo. He is 35 years old, married, and father of 3 children aged twelve, three, and one respectively. Fernando studied until the second grade, after which he had to stop because his family lacked the financial resources. From a young age Fernando had to work to support himself. His first business was selling bread, and later he invested in a small commercial establishment and started selling basic goods. Today he has a larger, general store type of establishment. His monthly income is approximately 24,000.00 MT and he is able to save 2,000.00 MT. This is Fernando’s second loan through Hluvuku and his first with Kiva. His first was for 8,000.00 MT, which he used to buy supplies. He intends to do the same with this loan. In the future he would like to request another loan that would permit him to save more money so that he can later buy a vehicle to help in purchasing supplies.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying and selling basic goods

loans.name: Mrs. Boeurn Krouch Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan, which consists of sixteen people, is located in Chrey Bak village in Kampong Chhnang province, and all the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Boeurn K. is the village bank president. She and her husband, Mr. Nith Veasna, are farmers who own a plot of land for cultivating rice. It is now harvest season, and Mrs. Boeurn K. does not have enough money to hire laborers to harvest the rice.Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. She is 56 years old and the mother of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory, two help their parents on the plantation, and the youngest one is attending the local school. Mr. Saret R. did not come to take a loan but his wife did, so she is presented in the picture instead of him.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Four members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09%, and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To hire laborers to harvest the rice

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: for a purchasing motorcycle to use for her business and family

loans.name: Natércia Da Conceição

texts.pt:
Natércia da Conceição T. é natural de Maxixe um dos distritos da província de Inhamabene, tem 37 anos de idade, casada maritalmente e mãe de três filhos, com idade entre o primeiro 16, 8 e 3 anos respectivamente. Para alem dos filhos sustenta 4 pessoas sendo três irmão e sua mãe enviando valor mensalmente.

Natércia estudou até 8ªclasse e não continuou por falta de condições financeiras na família. Natércia mudou se da província de Inhambane na companhia da família em 1978.  para Natércia este é o terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva os dois primeiros também aplicou na compra de material de construção nos seguintes valores o primeiro 8000,00mt e o segundo 10800,00mt. Para sustentar o reembolso é feita na base de negocio que consiste em venda de Bolos e doces diversos quais vende por encomenda principalmente para as festa onde tem tido um rendimento mensal liquido de 3600,00mt.

Natércia futuramente pretende solicitar um empréstimo para abrir um salão de cabeleireiro.
texts.en:
Natércia da Conceição T. was born in Maxixe, one of the districts in the province of Inhamabene. She is 37 years old, married, and mother of 3 children aged 16, 8, and 3 respectively. Besides her children, she supports her 3 brothers and her mother by sending monthly allowances. Natércia studied until the 8th grade and then couldn’t continue because her family didn’t have sufficient financial resources. She and her family moved from Inhambane province in 1978. This is Natércia’s third loan through Hluvuku and her first with Kiva. The first two loans of 8,000.00 MT and 10,800.00 MT were used to purchase construction materials. She reimburses her loans by selling various cakes and sweets that are ordered mostly for parties. Her monthly liquid income is 3,600.00 MT. In the future Natéricia intends to request a loan so that she can open a hair salon.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction material

loans.name: Mrs. Sameth Muth Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twelve people who live in Chrey Bak village in Kampong Chhnang province formed the village bank loan, and they will use the loan that they obtained for different purposes. Mrs. Sameth M. is a village bank president. She is a farmer who owns one hectare to cultivate rice to eA. a living. She is a 50-year-old widow with three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory, while the youngest one is attending the local school. Although Mrs. Sameth M. and her children work hard, they still live in an old house in poor conditions. In order to improve these conditions, Mrs. Sameth M. decided to ask for a loan to add to build a new house for her family. 

One member in this village bank loan is an end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. This client is not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to build a new house for her family

loans.name: Lang

texts.en: Lang O. is 30 years old and a resident of Kandal Province, where she earns a living by selling Khmer fritters to her neighbors, since 1988. She can earn around of $5 each day to support her family's expenses. She is married and has six children, five of whom are single, and one is married. Three of her daughters are employed as garment workers, and they currently get a salary of $240 a month to help meet the family's needs, while her husband is a motorcycle taxi driver. Lang O. needs for her son to have a job, thus she would like to apply for a loan to purchase fishing tools such as nets, traps, and a fish boat for her son to begin a new business as a fisherman.

loans.use: To purchase fishing tools

loans.name: Sas' Group

texts.en: The group leader of this group is Mrs. Sas R., and they all live in Phum Lor village in Kampong Chhnang province. Mrs. Sas R. owns a small store where she sells drinks to the villagers and passengers. Since this business is going well she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more drinks to resell. Her husband, Mr. Sos Math, is a beef seller in the local market. Mrs. Sas R. is 36 years old and the mother of a child who is attending the local school.

loans.use: to buy more drinks to resell.

loans.name: Sábado Samuel

texts.pt:
Sábado Samuel M. é natural da província de Gaza, tem 39 anos de idade, pai de 8 filhos onde todos vão a escola. Para alem dos filhos sustenta os seus avos paternos enviando géneros alimentícios.

Sábado estudou até 4ªclasse e não continuou por que os pais não deixaram dado que na zona o nível ia até 4ª e para continuar era preciso sair da zona assim proibiram para que ficasse a cuidar do gado.

Mudou se da província de Gaza para Maputo quando ficou muito doente onde ficou numa casa da irmã e quando ficou bem conseguiu emprego nos caminhos de ferros de Moçambique, emprego que veio a terminar quando a empresa decidiu reduzir o pessoal e ele foi abrangido e pago indemnização e com este valor comprou talhão e construiu a sua casa e uma parte iniciou negócios, sendo um de criação de frangos e outro de venda de produtos da primeira necessidade este que com o empréstimo pretende aumentar a sua mercadoria. Consegue um rendimento mensal de 15000,00mt e ainda não faz poupanças.

Sábado solicita empréstimo pela terceira vez na Hluvuku e primeira no Kiva, onde sonha ampliar o seu negocio e futuramente pretende abrir outro estabelecimento numa zona vizinha.
texts.en:
Sábado Samuel M. was born in the province of Gaza. He is 39 years old and the father of 8 children, who are all in school. Besides his children, he also supports his paternal grandparents by sending them food supplies. Sábado studied until the 4th grade and then his parents made him stop because their zone only went until the 4th grade and to continue meant to leave the zone. So they prohibited him from continuing so that he would stay and take care of the cattle. Sábado moved from Gaza province to Maputo when he got very sick and went to stay at a sister’s house. When he got better he was able to get a job with Mozambique railways, which ended when the company decided to reduce the number of employees. He was given severance pay and with that money he purchased a plot of land where he built his house and a small business raising chickens and selling basic goods. With this loan he intends to increase his stock. Sábado is able to earn a monthly income of 15,000.00 MT, but is still not able to save any money. This is Sábado’s third loan through Hluvuku and his first with Kiva. His dream is to increase his business so that in the future he can open another establishment in a neighboring zone.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying and selling basic goods

loans.name: Math's Group

texts.en:
This is a small loan group with five members that has selected Mrs. P. as leader.

Mrs. P. is a 43-year-old fish seller who delivers her catch to customers' homes. She has been in this line of work since 2000 and can earn around $3.20 per day. Her husband, Mr. Sorn Sek, 42, is oxen trader. Mrs. P. and her husband work every day as well as care for four children, all of whom are young and live at home. Because her business is her family's main source income, P. would like expand her operations with a loan to buy more fish to sell.

The other four members of her group are: Mrs. Ma D., 35, sells perfume and wants a loan to buy more items to sell. Mrs. Math M., 63, sells roasted chickens and needs a loan to buy more poultry to buy and cook. Mrs. Rim RohiM., 29, sells used clothes and needs to buy more items to sell. Mrs. No S., 51, sells rice cakes and would like to start a new business selling home products.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea V. is 49 years old who lives in Kandal Province, where she owns and runs a medium-sized shop that makes Khmer Noodles. She has one employee who helps her meet customer demand. Her company is doing very well, with many regular customers, and she earns about $20 a day. She has been in this line of work since 2003, and her income helps support her six children, four of whom are single and two of whom are married. Two of her children are employed; one sells groceries, and the other helps with this business.  V. has applied for a loan to expand her business by buying more rice that she can use to make noodles.

loans.use: To buy more rice to make noodle for sale

loans.name: Eid_E_Qurban Group

texts.en:
Parwyen is the group leader of the Eid-e-Qurban group. There are four members in this group. All of them would like to use the loan for his/her own business.

Seyweta and Latefa want to take out a loan for their tailoring business . Parwyen wants to use the loan for her husband and Salaha wants the loan for her bakery shop, which she has in her house. They all want to expand and progress in their businesses and earn more money to support their families. 
 
With this loan they can increase the size of their business and support their families. They are very happy to have this loan process in their country.

loans.use: To increase and strengthen their businesses

loans.name: Sao's Group

texts.en: This is a small group of three members. Mrs. P. is selected to be the group leader. Mrs. Sao P., 51, is a hairdresser and provides laundry services. Her business is located in Battambang Province. She is widowed with three children, one of whom is married and two who are single. Her son, Mr. Sao Sony, 19, works a lathe and can earn money to support the family's expenses. To increase her son business, P. needs a loan for her son to purchase a lathe for his own business. Other two members are: Mrs. Kim C. T., 48, on staff at a local NGO, who needs a loan to run a new business of a decorating business, and Mrs. Chim B., who is selling noodle soups. She needs a loan to expand her business by purchasing ingredients.

loans.use: to purchase lathe for her son's business

loans.name: Roki Group

texts.en:
Zelikha is the group leader of the Roki group. All the group members live in Kabul, Afghanistan and each of the group members wants to take a loan for his/her own business.

Zelikha wants to take out a loan for her beauty parlor business.  Roki would like the loan to buy fabric and Afghani cloths. Ghulam Mustafa requests it to stock up his mobile shop. Parween would like the loan to assist his brother's   business, and Sediqa who lives in 5th district, wants to take out a loan for for her seamstress business..

They all expect to expand their businesses through the loan, support their families and earn a good income.. Finally, they all would like to thank Kiva lenders that assist the entrepreneurs with starting and to sustaining businesses.

loans.use: To increase business activity

loans.name: Chhom's Group

texts.en:
There are three members that jointed this small loan, and Mrs. Chhom M. is the group leader. She is 39 years old and earns a living by selling different kinds of fruit in the local market. She started her business more than ten years ago and is currently earning around $4 a day. She has five children, all of whom are single; three are students and two are employed, while her husband is a local chef for wedding parties and ceremonies. M. plans to expand her business, thus now she decided to apply for a loan to purchase additional fruits to resell. 

The other two borrowers are:
Phon R. is 40 years old and is selling fruits for a profit. She needs a loan to buy more kinds of fruit for sale.
Sar S. is 29 years old and is selling electronic materials. She requests a loan to purchase piglets to raise. 

They all live in Odombang Commune in Battambang Province.

loans.use: To purchase additional fruits for sale

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a 44-year-old woman who lives in Bourj el Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon, with her husband and their four children. She has been doing handicrafts for twenty-two years. She does crochet and some woolen projects. Salma requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise. Salma has been a microcredit client for three years now and has always paid on time.

The loan had a good influence on her and her family's lifestyle. Salam is special for her work because her business is rare. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. She decided to do this business in order to help support her family.

loans.use: Salma needs the loan to purchase materials

loans.name: Vong's Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan that has five people . Mrs. K. is one of the group and is selected to be the group leader. Mrs. K., 56, sells vegetables in the market, while her husband, Mr. Heu Sok, grows vegetables to sell. They both work hard everyday and can earn around $2 per day. K. has four children; one is married and three are single, working as construction workers and helping to support the family's living conditions. 

To improve vegetable growing and increase their income, K. would like to ask for a loan to purchase a pump machine (for irrigation). Other members: Mrs. Vong D., 38, who sells souvenirs. She needs a loan purchase more products to sell. Mr. Srun O., 45, sells chinese cakes. She needs a loan run a new business of groceries. Seun C. sells groceries. She needs a loan purchase more groceries to sell. Mrs. Bun S., 27, sells vegetables that she grows. She needs a loan to buy a pump machine. Mrs. K. was not available for photographing and her husband was instead.

loans.use: purchase a pump machine for water to irrigate

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
This small loan request is being made by three borrowers, all residents of Kandal Province. The group leader, Mrs. S. K., is 45 years old and a widow. She runs a small restaurant and sells boiled eggs and roasted sausages to neighbors. She can earn average of $3 per day, and has been doing this since 2005. She is responsible for five children, all of whom are single. To help provide more for the family, one daughter is working as a garment worker. K. is applying for a loan to buy furniture to use in the family home. 

The another two borrowers are:
Pheng C. is age 22 and is single. She is a garment worker who is requesting a loan for her sister to use as capital to expand her business.
Bou S. A. is 56 years old and makes a living selling rice and foods. She requests a loan to purchase a motorcycle for her family to ride.

loans.use: To buy furniture to use in family home

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Khady N., 55 ans, mariée, 08 enfants et 03 autres en charge est membre du banc villageois de Khodoba depuis 5 ans et demi. Elle veut renforcer son commerce de cola, de petit cola et de gâteaux. Khady participe à la dépense quotidienne de sa famille  Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
55-year-old Khady N. is married and has three children in her care in addition to her own eight. She has been a member of the Khodoba village bank for five and a half years. Khady wants to bolster her trade in kola nuts, petit kola nuts and cakes. She shares in the daily expenditures for her family, and is asking for a loan that will be repaid in a lump sum payment at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of kola nuts, petit kola nuts and cakes

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa N., 53 ans, mariée, 09 enfants et 01autre en charge est membre du banc villageois de Khodoba depuis 4 ans. Elle veut renforcer son petit commerce de fruits locaux et saisonniers (orange, clémentine, mandarine).Ses revenus lui permettent de participer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille  Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
53-year-old Awa N. is married and cares for one child in addition to nine children of her own. She has been a member of the Khodoba village bank for four years. Awa wants to bolster her small business in local and seasonal fruit (oranges, tangerines and mandarin oranges). The income permits her to share in improving her family’s standard of living. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid in a lump sum at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and resale of local and seasonal fruit

loans.name: Seynabou Ablaye

texts.fr: Seynabou Ablaye, 45 ans, mariée, 08 enfants et 02 autres en charge est membre du banc villageois de Khodoba depuis 7 ans et demi. Elle veut renforcer son petit commerce de fruits locaux et saisonniers (orange, clémentine, mandarine).Ses revenus lui permettent de participer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille  Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Seynabou Ablaye, age 45, is married and has eight children, plus two others in her care. She has been a member of the village loan group of Khodoba for seven years. She wants to bolster her small-scale scale business in local and seasonal fruit (oranges, clementines, mandarin oranges). Her income helps her improve her family's living conditions. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell local seasonal fruit

loans.name: Fatou Adama

texts.fr: Fatou Adama C., 44 ans, mariée, 07 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Mbirdiam depuis 7 ans et demi. Elle veut renforcer son activité de vente de fruits (orange, mandarine, pastèque) et légumes. Ses revenus lui permettent d’aider à la prise en charge des études de ses enfants  des conditions de vie de sa famille  Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Fatou Adama C., age 44, is married and has seven children to look after. She has been a member of the village loan group of Mbirdiam for seven and a half years. She wants to bolster her business selling fruit (oranges, mandarin oranges, watermelon) and vegetables. Her income helps her to address the school fees for her children and her family's living conditions. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Maty

texts.fr: Maty F. est membre du banc villageois de Mbirdiam depuis 7 ans et demi. Elle veut renforcer son activité de vente de fruits  saisonniers (orange, mandarine, pastèque). Ses revenus lui permettent de participer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille  Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Maty F. has been a member of the village association of Mbirdiam for seven and a half years. She wants to bolster her business selling seasonal fruit (oranges, mandarin oranges, watermelon). Her income helps her to improve her family's living conditions. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell seasonal fruit

loans.name: Yacine

texts.fr: Yacine D., 49 ans, mariée est membre du banc villageois de Mbirdiam depuis 7 ans et demi. Elle veut acheter et revendre des fruits  saisonniers (orange, mandarine, pastèque). Ses revenus lui permettent de participer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille  Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Yacine D. is 49 years old, married, and has been a member of the Mbirdiam village bank for 7 and a half years. She wants to buy and sell seasonal fruits (oranges, mandarins, watermelons). The money she makes helps to improve the living conditions of her family. She is requesting a loan to be repaid in one lump sum at the end of 6 months.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruit for resale:  oranges, mandarins, and watermelons

loans.name: Martha Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Martha Cristina T. B. tiene la edad de 38 años, su estado civil es soltera, Doña Martha tiene 1 hija de la edad de 15 años que cursa recientemente el 3 año de secundaria, sus propósitos son de mantener activo su negocio por lo que necesita sacar adelante su familia sus deseos son de hacer crecer su empresa de tortillas para tener cada día mas ingresos para darle mejor mantenimiento a su negocio y en su casa de habitación y proporcionarle a su hija un porvenir lleno de estudios para que el día de mañana sea una profesional y pueda salir adelante en la vida ante cualquier situación sus sueños son de viajar al extranjero para darle a conocer la calidad del producto que ella produce como lo son las tortillas y mostrarle a las personas que se encarga de brindar la ayuda para los respectivos financiamiento.



La actividad económica es la venta y elaboración de tortillas, la ubicación es el mercado central y en su casa de habitación, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 20 años, sus inicios del negocio se dan por su Mama quien era la pionera en este negocio pero debido a la edad de ella decide dejar el negocio en las manos de su hija y es así como obtiene quedarse con el negocio y los vecinos ivan en busca del producto por lo que también se quedo con los clientes de su Mama y ahora trata rebuscar el fondo suficiente para mantener este negocio y no perderlo ya que este le proporciona los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia y los compromisos contraídos con la Fundación León 2000, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que realiza las compras de su materia prima como lo es maíz, leña y cal por lo que tiene que recurrir a los diferentes lugares para buscar toda la materia prima necesaria
texts.en:
Martha Cristina T. B. is 38 years old and single. Martha has a 15-year old daughter who is in her 3rd year of high school. She wants to keep her business going because she needs to improve her family's situation. She wants to expand her tortilla business in order to make more money every day so that she can make improvements to her business and to her home as well as to ensure that her daughter can continue her studies, that she may one day have a career and make a good future for herself. She dreams of travelling abroad to show others the quality of her tortillas, especially to those who have supported her by lending to her. She prepares and sells tortillas in the main market and in her home. She has been doing so for 20 years. Her mother started the business but due to her age she decided to leave the business in her daughter's hands and this is how Martha ended up in the business. She sells to her neighbours and to her mother's customers and is now trying to get working capital to keep the business and not lose it as it is the business which provides the income necessary to support her family and to repay the commitments she has made to Fundación León 2000. The loan is for working capital so that she can purchase raw materials such as corn, wood, and lime as she has to source the materials from a number of different places.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Erika Lissette

texts.es:
La Joven Erika Lissete Manzanares R. tiene la edad de 27 años, su estado civil es acompañada ella tiene 2 hijos de las edades de 7 años su hijo mayor y cursa el 2 grado de primaria y su hija de 3 años que recientemente no estudia, su compañero de vida labora como taxista, sus propósitos son de prosperar en su negocio para que este en un futuro pueda ampliarse mas en sus deseos esta predominar en su negocio a pesar de la competencia que existe y acumular a un sin numero de clientes y sus sueños son de proporcionarle a sus hijos una casa propia donde puedan vivir con las condiciones adecuadas y no sufran necesidades para el día de mañana.




Su actividad económica es el destace de cerdo, la ubicación de su negocio es en el reparto Rigoberto López Pérez capilla santa Ana ½ al sur, el tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 4 años, ella inicia este negocio por que en su familia ya existía este oficio ya que su tío fue el que se encargo para que aprendiera este oficio y a la edad de de 25 años decide independizarse y establecer su propio negocio y al principio no le resulto muy fácil por lo que tenia que realizarlo ella sola pero mas tarde consigue adaptarse a este negocio, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que realizaría las compras de mas cerdos ya que tiene que buscar donde le oferten de forma mas favorable para escoger a los cedos.
texts.en:
Erika Lissete Manzanares R. is 27 years old and in a relationship. She has 2 children: a son age 7 who is in grade 2 and a 3-year old daughter who does not attend school yet. Her partner is a taxi driver. Her goal is to have a successful business in order to expand it in the future. She wants to dominate in business despite stiff competition and have a large customer base. Her dream is to provide her children with their own home where they can have good living conditions and not lack for basic necessities in the future. She has been in business selling pork for 4 years in "Rigoberto López Pérez capilla santa Ana ½ al sur". She started the business as her family worked in this business which her uncle taught her. She decided to open her own business at the age of 25, which was not easy in the beginning as she had to do everything on her own but got used to it in time. The loan is for working capital so that she can buy more pork as she is looking for a less expensive supplier.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rokhaya

texts.fr: Rokhaya N., 58 ans, mariée est membre du banc villageois de Bayakh 1 depuis 7 ans et demi. Elle veut acheter du bissap, du sucre, arome et autres  pour faire des crèmes glacées, du jus et renforcer sa boutique.  Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Rokhaya N., age 58, is married and has been a member of the village association of Bayakh 1 for seven and a half years. She wants to buy bissap (dried hibiscus flowers), sugar, flavoring, and more to make ice cream and juices, so that she can provide a boost to her shop. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bissap, sugar, and other ingredients for making juices and ice cream

loans.name: Carla Mariela

texts.es:
La Señora Carla Mariela Ríos C. tiene la edad de 31 años, sus estado civil es acompañada, esta Señora tiene 1 niña de la edad de 14 años y cursa recientemente el 3 años de secundaria, su compañero de vida labora como chofer, sus sueños son de establecer un mejor lugar para ofertar sus comidas ya que así obtendría mas afluencia de clientes, sus propósitos son que su negocio se mantenga activo para que este le siga proporcionando ingresos, sus deseos son de sacar adelante a su hija para darle un buen porvenir de estudios a su hija ya que en sus deseos esta que su hija sea una profesional para el día de mañana.


Su actividad económica es la venta de desayunos y almuerzo: huevos enteros, tacos, gallo pinto, bistec, arroz, frijoles y maduro, la ubicación de su negocio es en el mercado Santos Barcenas, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 8 años, su negocio inicio por cuenta propia y decide realizar la venta de comida en el mercado y comienza instalando una vitrina cocinando cosas sencillas como huevo y gallo pinto y al ver que tuvo la repuesta de los clientes decide invertir mas en su negocio, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita invertir en la compra de arroz, gaseosa y carne para ofrecer una variedad de comidas.
texts.en:
Carla Mariela Ríos C. is 31 years old. She has a partner and a 14 years old daughter that is attending her 3 year in secondary school. Her partner works a driver. Her dream is to open a better place to server her food, so she can make a better impression on her customers. She would like to keep her business active so she can continue making a good income. She also wants to provide a good education for her daughter so she can become a professional in the future. She sells breakfast and lunch packs: boiled eggs, tacos, beans and rice, steak, and others. Her business is located at the Santos Barcenas market. She’s owned this business for 8 years. She decided to start this business on her own installing a small counter at the market where she used to cook simple meals such as eggs and beans and rice, but as the business stated to grow she decided to invest more money on it. Financing will be used for work capital as she needs to invest the money to purchase rice, sodas and offer a larger variety of food.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Binta

texts.fr: Binta D., mariée est membre du banc villageois de Bayakh 1 depuis 7 ans et demi. Elle veut acheter du riz, de l’huile, du savon et autres  pour  renforcer sa  boutique. Binta fait aussi de l’aviculture.  Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Binta D. is married and has been a member of the village association of Bayakh 1 for seven and a half years. She wants to buy rice, oil, soap, and more to provide a boost to her shop. Binta also raises poultry. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply her shop with rice, oil, soap, etc., and to bolster her poultry business

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa Dramé, 42 ans, mariée, 08 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Bayakh 2 depuis 2 ans. Elle veut acheter du niébé, du sucre, du lait, des spaghetti et divers  pour faire de la restauration. Awa vend le petit déjeuner et désire renforcer son activité pour avoir plus de revenus.  Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Awa Dramé, age 42, is married and has eight children to look after. She has been a member of the village association Bayakh 2 for two years. She wants to buy niébé (black-eyed peas), sugar, milk, spaghetti, and more to do catering. Awa offers breakfast for sale and wishes to bolster her business in order to have more income. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy provisions (niébé, sugar, milk, spaghetti) for catering

loans.name: Myra Lorena

texts.es:
La Señora Myra Lorena Gómez Torrez tiene la edad de 40 años, sus estado civil es casada, Doña Myra tiene 2 hijos de los cuales sus edades son una niña de 13 años que cursa el 3 año de secundaria y un niño de 5 años que cursa el 1 primer grado de primaria, su compañero de vida labora en una agencia en el guasaule, sus propósitos son incrementar sus ventas para que su negocio se mantenga activo para seguirle ayudando a sus hijos que lo necesitan, sus deseos son de proporcionarle a sus hijos un futuro en los estudios para que estos sean un profesionales para el día de mañana y lograr educarlos para la vida y para la resolución de sus problemas.



La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una librería y alquiler de video, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 5 años, la ubicación de su negocio es de ENITEL 2 cuadras al oeste ½ al sur, ella inicia este negocio por cuenta propia por lo que este fue un medio de trabajo para ella por lo que decide realizar el financiamiento para sacar adelante su negocio y mantenerlo de esta forma activo y empieza con una vitrina con los productos como: borrador, lápices, y cuadernos y al ver la buena acogida de sus clientes decide invertir mas en su negocio, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que quiere estar preparada cuando se avecine la entrada a clases y realizar las diferentes compras como: cuadernos, lapiceros, borradores, tarjadores y cartulinas.
texts.en:
Myra Lorena Gómez Torrez is 40 years old. She is married and has two children, a 13 year old girl attending her 3rd year in secondary school and a boy of 5 attending his 1st grade in primary school. Myra’s husband has an agency in the city of Guasaule. Her goal is to increase her sales to keep her business active so she can continue helping her dependent children. She wants to provide them with a better education so they can become professionals in the future so they don’t have to face great problems. She’s owned a bookstore and video store for 5 years. Her shop is located at ENITEL, 2 blocks west half block south. She stated this business on her own as she needed a job and she requested for a loan to keep it active. She stated with a small counter with products such as erasers, pencils, notebooks and others. As she became more popular among her customers, he decided to invest more money on her business. She will use this loan for work capital to get ready for the upcoming school season. She wants to buy more supplies such as notebooks, pens, erasers, maps and large cards.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Demecio

texts.es:
El señor Demecio Alfredo tiene 52 años de edad oriundo de la ciudad de Carapegua  esta casado hace mas de 24 años con la señora Celsa Espínola  de 58 años de edad tienen juntos dos hijos uno de 24 años que ya es profesional, mientras el otro esta cursando la secundaria  y también  ayuda  a su  padre en la  curtiembre.  
    De  joven el Sr  Demecio trabajó por  mucho  tiempo en una  entidad publica ,más adelante viajo a  la  Argentina en  busca de trabajo ya que  en  nuestro  país eran  muy  pocas las  posibilidades  y allí conoció a la  Sr. a Celsa su actual  esposa trabajaron arduamente  y  lograron  reunir  un  poco de capital  y  volvieron   al Paraguay , mandaron a  construir  una  pequeña  casita  y  dieron  inicio  a una  pequeña  curtiembre  donde hacían  compra de cuero vacuno y equino crudo  que los  procesa y lo vuelven a vender, Gracias a este trabajo y al esfuerzo de los dos pudieron comprar varias maquinarias  para el trabajo y también una camioneta para transportar su producto. 
                 Solicita el crédito para compra de más cuero.
texts.en:
Demecio Alfredo is 52 years old, a native of the city of Carapegua, and has been married to Celsa Espínola, age 58, for more than 24 years. They have 2 children: one is 24 years old and a professional, the other is still in high school and also helps his father in the tannery. When Demecio was a young man, he worked for a long time for an organization. He later traveled to Argentina in search of work as there were very few job opportunities in our country. There, he met Celsa, his wife, and they worked very hard and were able to save a little money to return to Paraguay where they had a small house built and opened a small tannery. They buy cattle and horse leather and process it to sell. Thanks to their hard work they have been able to buy machinery for their business as well as a van to transport their product. They are asking for a loan to purchase more leather.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy leather

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La Sra.Gladys C. de Dure,tiene 40 años de edad, está casada con el Sr. Aberto Dure Almada, juntos tienen tres hijas 2 en edad escolar y una es mayor de edad.
           Hace 15 años que se dedica a la venta ambulante de diferentes artículos hacia la zona de San Bernardino (ciudad muy concurrido en épocas de verano).
      La señora manifiesta que gracias a su sacrificio pudo lograr muchos objetivos previstos.
    Además de viajar los días sábados y domingo con sus mercaderías, tiene otro ingreso que le genera  su  kiosco bien  surtido que tiene  montado en su domicilio todos se ayudan en la familia para salir adelante.
       Con el crédito  comprará colchas  artesanales.
texts.en:
Señora Gladys C. de Dure is 40 years old and is married to Señor Alberto Dure Almada. The couple has three children, two of whom are school aged, while the third is now an adult.

Gladys has worked as a street vendor for the past 15 years. She sells a variety of items in the San Bernardino area (a city that becomes very busy in the summertime).

Gladys says that thanks to the sacrifices she has made, she has been able to achieve many of her goals.

In addition to traveling to sell her wares on the weekends, Gladys has additional income from a small store she runs from her home. Gladys's whole family works hard so that they can get ahead in life.

Gladys will use this loan to buy handmade bedspreads.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy handmade bedspreads

loans.name: Emprendedoras Unidas Group

texts.es:
En la Ciudad de Carapeguá en el Barrio María Auxiliadora distante a 3km de la oficina de Carapeguá uñas señoras de escasos recursos se enteraron del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y decidieron reunirse para recibir una información sobre el mencionado programa. 
Estas Señoras son activas la mayoría de ellas se dedica a la venta de los ya mencionados mas arriba .Ellas buscando un poco mas de apoyo para fomentar a través del crédito sus ingresos familiares y mejorar su calidad de vida . 
Los distintos tipos de actividades que desarrollan son: 
Mirtha Graciela C.	Mercería
Gladys Z.	Vendedora ambulante 
Marta C.	Venta de ropas
Isabel V.	Venta de remedios yuyos
Daisy V.	Venta de productos Avon
Heriberta Britez	Empleada de servicio
Ma-Elena González	Empleada de servicio
Mirta M. 	Vendedora ambulante
Aida Báez	Tejedora
Pánfila C. 	Venta de verduras
Rosana P.	Venta de Comidas
Inés F.	Venta de chipas
Liliana Z.	Vendedora ambulante 
Patrocinia E.	Empleada de servicio
Lourdes M.	Empleada

Necesitan de esta operación crediticia para invertir en sus respectivos trabajos y así poder lograr un crecimiento sostenible que les haga crecer como grupo y en forma individual. 
No pudo asistir para la foto  Pánfila C.
texts.en:
In the Maria Auxiliadora neighborhood of the city of Carapeguá, three blocks from Fundación Paraguaya's Carapeguá office, a group of low-resource women found out about the Enterprising Women Committee and decided to get together to find out more about the program. These women are very active. Most of them are vendors, and they sell the goods listed below. They are looking for a little more support, in the form of credit, to increase their families' incomes and improve their quality of life. The women work in the following areas: Mirtha Graciela C., Haberdashery Gladys Z., Street vendor Marta C., Clothing sales Isabel V., Herbal remedies Daisy V., Avon products Heriberta Britez, Service worker Ma-Elena González , Service worker Mirta M., Street vendor Aida Báez, Weaver Pánfila C., Vegetable sales Rosana P., Food sales Inés F., Cheese pastry sales Liliana Z. , Street vendor Patrocinia E., Service worker Lourdes M., Maid The women need these loans to invest in their respective businesses in order to attain sustainable growth, both on a group level and a personal level. Pánfila C. was unable to attend the meeting at which the group's picture was taken.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy thread, dustcloths, clothing, flour, pasta, vegetables, fruits and herbal remedies

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
El Sr.Hernan O., tiene 35 años de edad, vive en la  ciudad de Quiindy es propietario de una librería, la  mas  concurrida de la  zona es  soltero y  también es estudiante de Universidad. 

             Desde muy joven empezó a trabajar con su padre vendiendo mercaderías  por la ciudad y así ayudaba   para  mantener la casa,  anhela seguir  progresando para  poder   mandar  construir  una casa  propia y  mas adelante  formar  una familia  y tener  hijos. 

                Con el crédito comprara  cuadernos  y  bijouterie.
texts.en:
Mr. Hernan O. is 35 years old and lives in the city of Quiindy. He owns the most popular bookstore in the area. Hernan is single, and also studies at the local university. From a very young ago, he began working with his father selling merchandise around the city in order to earn income to support the family. Hernan hopes to continue to make progress so that he can build a home to share with the family and children he hopes to have in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy notebooks and jewelry

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey Group

texts.es:
En la Ciudad de San Roque González en el Barrio Inmaculada Concepción distante a 13kmde la oficina de Carapeguá 
El Comité esta integrada por 15 señoras muy trabajadoras y activas este Comité esta en el quinto ciclo con calificación excelente. Cada integrante desarrolla una actividad comercial diferente, para lograr obtener ingresos para sus familias. Estas actividades son: 
Candida S. 	Limpiadora de colegio
Mirian González	Despensa 
Ninfa C.	Vendedora ambulante
Reineria G.	Cantinera
Laura C.	Venta de ropas
María V.	Macatera
Gladis C.	Venta de comidas
Lilian A.	Despensa
Mauricia V.	Vendedora ambulante
Eugenia S.	Venta de chipa
Petrona S.	Despensa mercería
Lujeria C.	Almacén
Cinthia C.	Vendedora ambulante
Herminia C.	Despensa
Adorina F.	Almacén


Este grupo es muy unido y trabaja en forma conjunta ellas no presentan inconvenientes con el pago de sus cuotas ni en relacionamiento entre ellas. Buscando un poco mas de apoyo para fomentar através del crédito sus ingresos familiares y mejorar su calidad de vida

No pudieron asistir para la foto:
 Gladis C.
 Lilian Ávalos
texts.en:
The Committee is made up of 15 hard-working members and is in its fifth cycle with excellent qualifications. Each member has her own unique business to provide for her family's income. The Committee is located in the city of San Roque González in the Inmaculada Concepción neighborhood, 13km from the the Carapeguá office. Their businesses are as follows: Candida S., school janitor Mirian González, retail Ninfa C., street vendor Reineria G., barkeep Laura C., clothing sales María V., street vendor Gladis C., food sales Lilian A., retail Mauricia V., street vendor Eugenia S., chipa bread sales Petrona S., notions store Lujeria C., retail Cinthia C., street vendor Herminia C., retail Adorina F., retail This group is very close and works well together. They have no problems with their monthly payments nor with each other. They are seeking a bit of support to foster, via the loan, their family incomes and improve their quality of life. Two members were unavailable at the time of the photo: Gladis C. and Lilian Ávalos.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sundries: milk products, sugar, noodles, herbs, clothing, linen, eggs, starch, cheese, flour, carbonated beverages, oil, etc.

loans.name: Lina

texts.es:
Lina B.  es una señora de 41 años de edad oriundo de la ciudad de Roque González está casada hace más de 22 años con el Sr. Francisco Montiel  de 43 años de edad, tienen 5 hijos  3  en edad escolar y  2  ya son  mayores de edad y gracias a sus padres ya son profesionales.
          Se casaron  muy  jóvenes  y emprendieron  viaje a la Argentina en  busca de trabajo la  Señora  trabajo  como empleada  domestica y  el Señor como  albañil  trabajaron  incansablemente y  lograron reunir  un capital  importante  como para  regresar al  país  ,a su  regreso  buscaron una actividad  para  poder  invertir y  con  los  ingresos   poder sobrevivir  y dieron apertura  a  un  pequeño almacén  que  hoy  día es el  sustento de la familia  
             Con el  crédito   comprará: Harina, azúcar, yerba, fideos  arroz y otros.
texts.en:
Lina B. is a 41 year old woman living in the city of Roque González. She has been married for 22 years to Mr. Francisco Montiel, who is 43 years old. They have 5 children, 3 of which are in school and 2 who are older and thanks to their parents are professionals. Lina and Francisco married very young and traveled to Argentina in search of work. Lina worked as a domestic employee and Francisco worked as a bricklayer. They worked tirelessly and successfully gathered important capital necessary to allow them to return to their country. Upon their return they searched for business to invest in and with the income be able to survive. They were give an opportunity with a small general store that sustains their family to this day. With the loan they will purchase: flour, sugar, herbs, noodles, rice and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of flour, sugar, cooking oil, noodles, and meat.

loans.name: Maria Liz

texts.es:
La Sra. María Liz de Vera vive en la compañía Espartillar de Carapeguá es una persona muy conocida en la zona por ser muy trabajadora, se dedica a la elaboración de frazadas y hamacas  artesanales se dedica a esta actividad hace mas de  15 años.
	La Sra. realiza el trabajo de artesanía en su propia  casa,  algunas mercaderías son para su marido Felipe Vera que actualmente es el encargado de trasladar sus productos hacia varios lugares del país para su comercialización. También  otras  personas se encargan de la distribución de  los  productos elaborados  por la Sra. María Liz,  de esta  manera también  da  un  poco de ayuda  a sus vecinos que trabajan en  venta ambulante 
	Con el crédito comprará  hilos y trapos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Liz de Vera lives in the Espartillar de Carapeguá and is well-known in the area for being very hardworking. She makes artisan blankets and hammocks, which she has done for over 15 years. She practices her artisan craft in her own home. Some merchandise is for her husband, Felipe Vera, who is actually responsible for transporting the products for sell to various places in the country. Also, other people are responsible for the distribution of the products made by Mrs. Maria Liz. In this way, she gives a little help to her neighbors that work in ambulatory sales. With this loan she will purchase thread and material.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of thread, dyes, and material to make blankets

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El Señor Mario  S. tiene 56 años de edad es soltero y vive en una de las  compañía de Carapeguá llamado  Espartillar.   
             Desde los 17 años de edad empezó con esta actividad que  consiste en salir a vender las colchas que ellos mismos producían con su mamá, después de 10 años se independizó y empezó a trabajar por cuenta propia; lleva los productos artesanales de la zona a venderla  por las ciudades de Villarica, Caazapa y Yuty. Gracias al  ingreso que  le genera esta actividad  logró mandar  construir  una  pequeña  casa  en donde vive en compañía de su madre ya que  el  se  encarga de la manutención de la  misma . 
                Con el préstamo comprará sobrecamas, sabanas, hamaca.
texts.en:
Mr. Mario S. is 56 years old, single, and lives in one of the Carapeguá neighborhoods called Espartillar. Since he was 17 years old he has gone out to sell quilts made by his mother. After 10 years he became independent and started to work on his own. He brings artisan products from the area and sells them in the cities of Villarica, Caazapa, and Yuty. Thanks to the income that his work generates, Mario was able to have a small house built where he lives with his mother, since he is responsible for taking care of her. With the loan he will purchase bedspreads, sheets, and hammocks.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise like bedspreads, sheets, hammocks, etc.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es:
El Sr.Rogelio B., tiene 45 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Roque Gonzalez está casado  con la Sra. Delicia de B. tiene un  hijo  y  viven en casa propia.  

           El mismo es propietario de un negocio dedicada a la producción de sobrecamas, actividad que realiza hace varios años con la ayuda de su señora esposa e hijo siendo una microempresa manejada a nivel familiar.
                  La empresa surgió de la iniciativa de su propietario quien anteriormente tejía las sobrecamas para terceros, llegando gracias a su esfuerzo a conformar su propia empresa.
                 El cliente comento que gracias al préstamo obtenido pudo adquirir más materia prima para la producción de hamacas y aprovechar una oferta de trabajo que le dejo una buena rentabilidad.
texts.en:
Mr. Rogelio B. is 45 years old, married, and together with his wife, Delicia de B., and son, lives in their own home in the city of Roque Gonzalez. He owns a family-run business weaving coverlets, which he has done for various years with the help of his wife and son. He started the business weaving coverlets for third-parties, and thanks to his efforts, was able to create his own business. Our client has noted that thanks to the previous loan he was able to acquire raw materials for the production of hammocks and take advantage of a job offer that provided a good profit.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy weaving yarn

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
La Sra. Susana Ines R. de Zárate es de la ciudad de Quiindy esta casada con el Sr. Hugo José Zárate, tiene tres hijos y habita en casa propia.

                La familia es propietaria de una casa  comercial dedicada a la venta de muebles y electrodomésticos con una antigüedad de más de diez años, empresa que surgió de la iniciativa de la Señora teniendo en cuenta que en ese entonces había pocos comerciantes que se dedicaban a este rubro.
                Con el crédito obtenido pudo realizar la compra de una oferta de electrodomésticos para la temporada de verano, que le dejará un buen margen de utilidad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Susana Ines R. de Zárate is from the city of Quiindy; she's married to Mr. Hugo José Zárate, has three children and they live in their own home. The family has owned their furniture and appliance store for ten years. Mrs. R. de Zárate started the business back when there were few businesses like it. With this loan she will be able to to advantage of an offer on electric appliances for the summer season which will provide her with a good profit margin.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy electric fans

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
El Sr.Victor González, tiene 43 años de edad, es padre de un  niño  pero  no está casado vive en  el barrio San José.

             Desde muy joven empezó a trabajar con su padre en la curtiduría, y hoy en día gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación al trabajo pudo independizarse.

                El cliente manifiesta que con el crédito comprará de cuero  fresco.
texts.en:
Victor González is 43 years old, has a son, is unmarried, and lives in the San José neighborhood. When he was very young, he started worked with his father in his leather shop and thankfully his efforts and dedication to this job has enabled him to support himself. Victor says that he will buy a new leather hide with this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase leather hides

loans.name: Quintín

texts.es:
El Sr. Quintín Antonio B., de 48 años de edad, reside en la ciudad de  San Ignacio Misiones desde su infancia, casado, con María Graciela Rodríguez, tiene 6 hijos, 4 mayores de edad y 2 menores.
 La esposa se encarga del negocio, mientras que el Sr. Quintín va a trabajar como chofer de tractor en una estancia. En época verano se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras de la estación.  
 Solicitó de este préstamo en nuestra institución para comprar mercaderías para estas fiestas.
texts.en:
Mr. Quintín Antonio B. is 48 years old and has lived in the city of San Ignacio Misiones since he was born. He has 6 children, four of which are adults and two are minors. His wife manages their business while Quintín goes to work as a tractor driver on a ranch. In the summer he sells seasonal fruits and vegetables. He applied for this loan at our institution to buy merchandise for the holidays.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits, vegetables, cider, sugar breads, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Ndèye Mame

texts.fr: Ndèye Mame S., 48 ans, mariée avec 09 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Boucotte Peyrissac depuis 4 ans et demi. Elle veut acheter des sacs de pain de singe (fruit du baobab), du bissap, du sucre,  des haricots, des condiments, et de l’huile pour renforcer son activité de restauration. Ndèye Mame vends du jus, des glaces, des crèmes glacées et le petit déjeuner. Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Ndèye Mame S., age 48, is married and has nine children to look after. She has been a member of the village association Boucotte Peyrissac for four and a half years. She wants to buy sacks of monkey bread (the fruit of the baobab tree), bissap (dried hibiscus flowers), sugar, beans, condiments, and oil for bolstering her catering business. Ndèye Mame sells juices, ice, ice cream, and breakfast foods. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries and provisions for selling breakfasts

loans.name: Ramón

texts.es:
El Sr. Ramón Timoteo Marin, de 30 años de edad, reside en la ciudad de  San Ignacio Misiones.,en pareja, con Teresa Lared, tiene 1 hija menor de edad. Mensualmente recorre varios kilómetros para distribuir su mercadería ya que es vendedor ambulante. Su pareja posee un negocio de mercería sobre la avenida principal de esta ciudad. 
 Solicitó de este préstamo en nuestra institución para comprar mercaderías para aprovechar las fiestas.
texts.en:
Mr. Ramón Timoteo M. is 30 years old and lives in the city of San Ignacio Misiones with his partner, Teresa Lared, and has a young daughter. As a traveling merchant, he covers various kilometers monthly selling his merchandise. His partner owns a notions store on the main avenue in the city. He applied for this loan with our institution to buy merchandise to take advantage of the holidays.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pots, sheets, and housewares

loans.name: Mai

texts.fr: Mai Cissé, 40 ans, mariée est membre du banc villageois de Petit Kandé depuis 6 ans. Elle veut acheter du niébé, de l’huile, des œufs, du sucre,  du pain de singe (fruit du baobab), du café touba et des chaussures pour renforcer son activité de restauration et de vente de chaussures. Mai vends le petit déjeuner. Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Mai Cissé, age 40, is married and has been a member of the village association of Petit Kandé for six years. She wants to buy niébé (black-eye peas), oil eggs, sugar, monkey bread (the fruit of the baobab tree), café Touba (spiced coffee), and shoes for bolstering her work in catering and selling shoes. Mai offers breakfast for sale. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy provisions for catering and shoes to sell

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr: Coumba S., 75 ans, mariée est membre du banc villageois de Petit Kandé depuis 7 ans et demi. Elle veut acheter de l’huile de palme, du citron, des légumes et du poisson séché pour renforcer son commerce. Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Coumba S., age 75, is married and has been a member of the village association of Petit Kandé for seven and a half years. She wants to buy palm oil, lemons, vegetables, and smoked fish to boost her commerce. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell vegetables, palm oil, lemons, and dried fish

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
El Sr. Víctor  B., de 66 años de edad, reside en la ciudad de  San Juan Misiones. Casado, con Vilma Galarza Arias, tienen 3 hijos ya mayores de edad. El Sr. Posee una gomería, venta de cubiertas nuevas y usadas, también una fabrica de hielo y venta de carbón. Su señora tiene un copetín y hospedaje con 5 habitaciones en la misma ciudad. 
 
 Solicitó de este préstamo en nuestra institución para comprar mercaderías para las  fiestas.
texts.en:
Victor B. is 66 years old and lives in San Juan Misiones. He is married to Vilma Galarza Arias and they have 3 adult childen. Victor owns a shop that sells new and used tires, carbon coals, and he also has an ice machine. His wife has a bed and breakfast with 5 rooms. He asks for this loan to purchase merchandise for the holidays.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of tires, carbon, cleaning supplies, and utensils

loans.name: Ndèye Marie

texts.fr: Ndèye Marie N., 39 ans, mariée avec 05 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Petit Kandé depuis 7 ans et demi. Elle veut acheter des recharges de crédit à vendre au niveau de son télécentre pour renforcer son commerce. Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Ndèye Marie N., age 39, is married and has five children to look after. She has been a member of the village association of Petit Kandé for seven and a half years. She wants to buy mobile phone cards to sell at her tele-center in order to boost her commerce. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell phone cards in a tele-center

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a massage table

loans.name: Awa Dabo

texts.fr: Awa Dabo S., 46 ans, mariée avec 06 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Petit Kandé depuis 6 ans. Elle veut acheter de l’huile de palme, du citron et des provisions pour la préparation du petit déjeuner qu’elle vend (huile végétal, niébé et autres) pour renforcer son commerce et son activité de restauration. Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Awa Dabo S., age 46, is married with 6 children to support. She has been a member of the Petit Kandé village bank for 6 years. She wants to buy palm oil, lemons, and other food (vegetable oil, cowpeas and more) for preparing breakfast, which is the meal she sells, in order to bolster her business and for her restaurant. She will repay the loan in one lump sum at the end of 6 months.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food and provisions for her restaurant.

loans.name: El Trapiche Group
