texts.es: El grupo "El Trapiche" esta representado por la señora Elvira. La mayoría D. los miembros del grupo se encuentra cursando su tercer ciclo con responsabilidad y cumpliendo con sus planes D. pago, son gente trabajadora y con ganas D. crecer en sus negocios D. venta D. cosméticos. verdura, gas, comercio D. productos D. la época y los dedicados al transporte público. El destino del Financiamiento es para la compra D. materiales e insumos y a la reparación D. las herramientas D. trabajo actuales. los socios (as) tienen experiencia en grupos solidarios ya que llevan con la Fundación agrocapital ya varios ciclos por lo que se han ganado la confianza gracias a su honradez y empeño en su trabajo.
texts.en:
The group, El Trapiche, is represented by Elvira. The majority of the group members are in their third cycle, (showing) responsibility in completing their loan payment plans. They are hardworking people with dreams of growing their businesses of selling cosmetics, vegetables, gas, and seasonal items, as well as providing public transportation. The loan will be used to buy materials needed for their businesses. The members have experience in groups like this and have already worked with Kiva partner Fundacion Agrocapital several times, so they have gained the Foundation's confidence thanks to their honor and determination in their work.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating expenses

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama G., 52 ans, mariée, 05 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Boucotte Peyrissac depuis 6 ans. Elle veut acheter  du poisson séché et des légumes pour renforcer son  petit commerce. Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Mariama G., age 52, is married and has five children to look after. She has been a member of the village association of Boucotte Peyrissac for six years. She wants to buy dried fish and some vegetables to boost her modest business. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell vegetables and dried fish

loans.name: Las Magnificas Group

texts.es: El grupo "las Magnificas " están representados por la señora Julia ella al igual que sus compañeras D. grupo es muy trabajadora y responsable. Los socios (as) D. este grupo se dedican al comercio D. productos como perfumes, cosméticos refrescos, comida y al comercio D. productos D. cuerdo a la época y la demanda del consumidor. El destino del financiamiento es para el incremento D. capital D. trabajo y para la compra D. productos e insumos para mejorar los ingresos por venta D. productos. Las socias tuvieron malas experiencias en trabajos con grupos solidarios pero eso no les impiD. seguir adelante y trabajar con la fundación agrocapital para mejor la calidad D. vida D. sus Familias.
texts.en:
The Las Magnificas group is represented by Julia who, along with the other members of the group, is very hard-working and responsible. The members of this group operate businesses selling perfume, cosmetics, cold drinks, and food, as well as products that depend on the season and consumer demand. The loan will be used to increase working capital and to buy products and supplies for increasing the members' sales and, in turn, their incomes. The members had bad experiences working with cooperatives in the past but that isn't stopping them from forging ahead and working with Fundacion Agrocapital to improve the lives of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital.

loans.name: Cristobal

texts.es:
El Señor Cristobal C. de 50 años de edad es separado con dos hijos ya mayores que culminaron sus estudios secundarios y vive en casa propia en el Barrio Pacu Cua hace mas de 25 años.

Cabe destacar que es propietario de una gomería que funciona hace mas de 5 años en el ramo y que realiza su vez servicios de parches y ventas de cubiertas para todo tipo de vehículos por la zona de Encarnación y por la zona de las colonias.

El crédito solicitado es para la compra de cubiertas usadas que le ofertaron y quiere aprovechar la oferta de la misma para así poder tener mejor margen de ganancia.
texts.en:
Mr. Cristobal C. is 50 years old, separated, and has two adult children who finished secondary school. He has lived in his own home in the Pacu Cua neighborhood for more than 25 years.

Cabe notes that he is the owner of a tire store that has been open for more than 5 years in the field. He performs tire-patching services and sells covers for all kinds of vehicles in the Encarnación and the Las Colonias zones.

The loan he is requesting is to buy used covers that were offered to him and that he wants to take advantage of selling himself so that he can make a good earnings margin.


Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of used automobile covers

loans.name: Paraizo Group

texts.es: El grupo "Paraizo" esta compuesto por persona que viven en el mismo barrio (barrio Paraizo) de la comunidad de saavedra, donde todas las socias se conocen y se dedican a la actividad del comercio como ser venta de ropa, venta de comida, venta de refrescos y los hombres trabajan de moto taxistas. este grupo tienen la mentalidad de crecer en sus actividades del comercio y son personas muy responsables que están dispuestos a cumplir con nuestra entidad y así demostrar la capacidad de pago que tienen cada una de ellas.
texts.en:
The Paraizo group is made up of people who live in the same neighborhood (Paraizo) in Saavedra. The members all know one another and operate businesses selling products such as clothes, food and cold drinks and, by the men, taxi services. This group is willing and able to grow their businesses. They are responsible men and women and they've all demonstrated their willingness to comply with the requirements of our institution.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El Señor Miguel S. de 44 años de edad es soltero y vive en casa propia en la ciudad de San Juan del Parana hace mas de 20 años y que esta retirado a 12 km de la ciudad y tiene un hijo varón de 8 años que va al colegio publico.

Cabe mencionar que el señor es vendedor independiente de mercaderías como ser ropas y calzados para Damas, Caballeros y Niños, recorre por toda la zona de Encarnación y las Colonias Unidas con una antigüedad con mas de 8 años en el ramo con una buena clientela formada y a medida que pasa el tiempo su cartera de cliente va creciendo considerablemente.

El crédito solicitado es para la compra de ropas y calzados que trae del Brasil por que tiene mejor aceptación de sus clientelas y si compra en mayor cantidad le deja mejor margen de ganancia.
texts.en:
Miguel S. is 44 years old, single, and has lived in his own home in the town of San Juan del Parana for more than 20 years, 12 km outside of the city. He has an 8-year old son who goes to public school. It is worth mentioning that Miguel is an independent seller of merchandise such as clothes and footwear for ladies, men and children. He travels throughout the areas of Encarnación and the Colonias Unidas. With more than 8 years in the industry, he has built up a good clientele and continues to gain new clients. He will use the loan to buy clothings and footwear which he brings from Brazil as these are more popular with his clients and if he buys in greater quantities he will have a greater profit margin.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and footwear from Brazil.

loans.name: San Juan Bautista Group

texts.es: Las socias del grupo " San Juan Bautista" esta representado por la señora Olga. Son un grupo que se dedica a diferentes actividades como el comercio D. productos ropa, abarrotes a la sastrería, zapatería y comercialización D. productos en general, son gente con experiencia en el manejo del mercado que les rodea por lo que no tiene miedo a la competencia ya que son gente dinámica y con ganas D. trabajar. el destino del financiamiento es para la compra D. materiales e insumos para agrandar su mercadería y producto terminado para tener una mayor rentabilidad y poderle dar un mejor futuro a su familia. Los socios (as) tienen experiencia con grupos solidarios por lo que son responsables y cumplidos en sus pagos.
texts.en:
The members of the San Juan Bautista group is represented by Olga. The members of the group operate various businesses selling products and services such as clothes sales, grocery sales, tailoring services, footwear sales and other miscellaneous products. They are experienced at working the market around them so they don't worry about competition. They're dynamic people and eager to get ahead. The loan will be used to buy materials and supplies so they can increase their sales and, in turn, be able to give their families a better future. The members have experince with cooperatives and are responsible and diligent about repaying their loans.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital.

loans.name: Asistentes Group

texts.es: El grupo "Asistentes " esta representado por la señora Maria Teresa son un grupo dinámico y con ganas D. trabajar, en general los socios (as) se dedican al comercio D. productos como cosméticos, comida, empanadas y otros D. dedican a actividades como la chaparía y pintura D. vehículos y al servicio domestico. Dentro del rubro comercial siempre existe la oferta y la demanda pero gracias a la experiencia en el trabajo ellas saben salir adelante. el destino del financiamiento es para el mejoramiento D. sus herramientas D. trabajo y a la compra D. insumos y materiales. Las socias tienen experiencias en grupos solidario ya que trabajaron como miembros D. grupos diferentes y ahora se unen para formar un grupo mas responsable.
texts.en:
The Asistentes group is represented by Maria Teresa. The members of the group are dynamic and hard-working. Generally, the members operate commercial businesses selling products such as cosmetics and food or services such as painting vehicles or cleaning houses. In the commercial world there's always supply and demand, but thanks to their work experience the members of the group know how to overcome any obstacles in their way. The loan will be used to improve their work tools and buy supplies and materials. The members have experience in cooperatives because they worked as members of various groups in the past and now they've come together to form an especially responsible team.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
El Sr Edgar D. el mismo es soltero vive con su mamá en la colonia Yatytay de 32 años de edad es soltero de profesión Médico clínico el mismo presta servicios en el Hospital de la ciudad de M.AUX. Con 4 años de antigüedad percibiendo un salario fijo. También posee una pequeña empresa de prestación de servicios de trabajos de construcción de empedrado en la zona de San Pedro del Paraná.
El mismo solicito la suma de 5MM a 12 meses para gastos de combustible que estaría comprando de la ciudad de Posadas a menor precio lo que le estaria siendo más rentable para su negocio por el menor costo de combustible.
texts.en:
Edgar D. is single and lives with his mother in the town of Yatytay. He is 32 years old, single, and a medical professional working in a hospital. He has been receiving a fixed salary for 4 years. He also has a small business offering construction services (paving) in the San Pedro del Paraná area. He is requesting a loan of 5MM for 12 months for fuel: he will buy fuel for resale in the city of Posadas where prices are lower in order to make greater profits.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fuel and maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
El sr Lucio V. es casado con 57 años de edad posee casa propia con todas las comodidades necesaria de un hogar es de la Ciudad Itapua Poty de profesión maestro de obra albañil independiente y dueño de una pequeña granja ventas de cerdos, leche, huevos, verduras. El cliente cuenta con 10 años en rubro lo que le permite contar con buenos clientes he ingresos según referencias y visita realizada al cliente se ha verificado excelentes obras de construcción como casa particulares y la Municipalidad de Itapúa Poty. 
Es una persona muy sacrificada además posee una granja cuidado por el y su cónyuge. Tienen 3 hijos en España quienes fueron a buscar mejor vida y que también le envian remesas.

El cliente solicito la suma de 5MM a un plazo de 12 meses para inversión ampliación de vivienda, mejoramiento infraesctrura de la granja como de compra de cerdos madre y para engorde para generar otros ingresos.
texts.en:
Mr. Lucio V., age 57, is married and has a comfortable home in Itapúa Poty city. He is a skilled builder and also owns a small farm that sells pigs, milk, eggs, and vegetables. Lucio has 10 years of experience in excellent construction projects, such as private homes and Itapúa Poty’s municipal center. He is very selfless; along with his building he and his wife take care of their farm. They also receive some support from their 3 children who went to Spain looking for a better quality of life. Lucio asks for 5MM PYG, to be repaid in 12 months, to invest in expanding his home and buying young pigs for the farm, which will generate additional income.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding house and purchase of pigs for farm

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Maria Cuba la misma es casada tiene 1 hijo es microempresaria se dedica al venta de ropas en la zona Baja y en la Feria Municipal Local 52 cuenta con 10 años de antigüedad en el rubro lo que le permite contar con muy buena clientela e ingresos. No esta demás mencionar que su cónyuge también aporta a la unidad familiar ya que atiende en el otro local que posee en la Zona baja , y la misma en su nuevo local que es propio en La Feria Municipal. Cabe destacar que opera únicamente con Fundación Paraguaya desde el 2005.
Solicito la suma de 5MM a 12 meses para compra de mercaderías de temporada verano y aumentar stocks de mercaderías lo que estaría adquiriendo de la ciudad de Posadas Argentina con menor costo y lo que estaría dando un mayor margen de ganancia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Maria Cuba is married and has 1 son. She is an entrepreneur, selling clothes in the Baja area and the city public market (Local 52) for the past 10 years. She has many customers and is able to earn a good living. Her husband also helps support their family, working in another location in the Baja district market. It is worth noting that Rosa has been a loyal client of Fundación Paraguaya since 2005. She asks for a loan of 5MM PYG, to be repaid in 12 months, in order to buy seasonal summer clothing and stock inventory with merchandise purchased at lower prices in the city of Posadas, Argentina, thus improving her profit margin.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of summer clothing (shorts, casual dresses, children's clothing)

loans.name: Zulma

texts.es:
La señora Zulma N. la misma es cliente recurrente de la Fundación Paraguaya es casada es micro empresaria se dedica a la confección de vestidos de alta costura como también uniformes de colegio y otros.
 Actualmente ha recurrido a la institución para compras de telas para confección de vestidos de fiestas ya que estamos en época de mucha frecuencia en acontecimientos como ser colación, recepciones, fiesta navidad, año nuevo. La misma es casada,  cuenta con todas las maquinarias que se necesita para dicha actividad como maquina de coser. Ovelo, tipo industrial lo cual le facilita mucho los trabajos. Cuenta con 8 años de antigüedad en el rubro lo que le permite contar con muy buena clientela he ingresos lo que le permite contar con la capacidad de pago de dicha operación de 5MM a 12 meses.
texts.en:
Mrs. Zulma N. is a loyal client of Fundación Paraguaya. She is married, a dressmaker specializing in fashionable dresses as well as school uniforms. With this loan she wishes to buy cloth to make into party dresses for the many Christmas and New Years’ events of the upcoming holiday season. Zulma has all of the necessary equipment, such as industrial sewing machines, to complete her work. She has worked in her business for 8 years and has many customers, which ensures she can repay her loan of 5MM PYG back in 12 months.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cloth for holiday dresses

loans.name: Ramóna

texts.es:
La señorita Ramona D. Almeida D. 23 años D. edad, D. carácter acompañada vive en casa propia con la hermana mayor en la Ciudad D. Coronel Bogado, ya es independiente, sus padres son D. la ciudad D. Coronel bogado.

Cabe mencionar que la señorita Ramona realiza compra venta D. ropas (damas, caballeros y niños acorD. a la estación) ayudado por el joven Rolando Javier hace más D. 2 años, y posee un incremento muy considerable D. clientes.

El crédito solicitado lo invirtió en la compra D. ropas para incrementar stock y variedades acorD. al clima actual.
texts.en:
Ramona D. Almeida is 23 years old, in a relationship, and lives in a house together with her older sister in the city of Coronel Bogado. She is independent. Her parents come from Coronel Bogado. Ramona buys and sells seasonal clothing for women, men, and children. She has been helped by Rolando Javier for more than 2 years and has a considerable customer base. She will invest the loan in the purchase of clothing to increase her stock and variety based on the weather.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise (clothing for ladies, men, and children).

loans.name: José

texts.es:
El señor José P. tiene 45 años, vive en pareja con la señora Miriam Trinidad desde hace muchos años. Ellos tienen su propia casa en el Barrio Quiteria de la ciudad de Encarnación. 

El señor José es propietario de su carpintería que posee en su domicilio desde hace más de dos años, el es muy trabajador y mediante eso ha progresado, ya que ha realizado mejoras en su carpintería y gracias a su trabajo también siempre ha podido cubrir los gastos de hogar. Su cónyuge, la señora Miriam, es ama de casa y se dedica a realizar los trabajos que el hogar requiere diariamente.

Este señor ha solicitado el crédito en Fundación Paraguaya para la compra de más insumos para su carpintería, debido a que esta teniendo muchos pedidos y desea cumplir acabadamente con cada uno de ellos.
texts.en:
José P. is 45 years old and has lived with Miriam Trinidad for many years. They own their own home in the Barrio Quiteria neighbourhood in the city of Encarnación. José has had a carpentry workshop in his home for more than 2 years. He is a very hard worker and has made a lot of progress as he has made improvements to his workshop. Thanks to his work he has always been able to pay the household expenses. His common-law wife, Miriam, is a housewife and she takes care of the day-to-day household chores. This client has requested a loan from Fundación Paraguaya in order to buy more wood for his carpentry business, as demand is strong and he wants to fill every single one of his orders.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy material to make furniture.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La señora Lucila L., es viuda, tiene 30 años y vive en una casa con sus padres en la ciudad de General Artigas. Tiene 2 hijos pequeños que viven y dependen económicamente de ella.

La señora Lucila es propietaria de una Despensa con Carnicería que posee en su domicilio desde hace varios años, y es atendida por ella misma. Esta actividad a ella le permite criar y educar a sus hijos, cubrir todos los gastos que se presentan en el hogar y mediante esto llevar una vida digna y sin preocupaciones, ya que desde que su esposo ha fallecido ella ha tenido que luchar sola para poder salir adelante. Su madre, quien vive en el mismo lugar, es una docente jubilada que también le apoya en todo momento.

Esta señora actualmente esta solicitando el crédito para surtir más su negocio con mercaderías para la temporada de fin de año, ya que en la zona tiene mucha clientela que constantemente esta acudiendo a su comercio para realizar sus compras.
texts.en:
Lucila L. is a widow. She is 30 years old and lives in a house with her parents in the city of General Artigas. She has 2 young children who live with her and are dependent upon her. Lucila owns a grocery store/butcher shop which she opened in her home a number of years ago, and which she takes care of herself. This business allows her to raise and educate her children, pay the household expenses and thus live a respectable life without worries as since her husband's death she has had to fight alone to better her life. Her mother, who lives in the same house, is a retired teacher who supports her in all things. She is requesting this loan in order to stock her business with seasonal New Year's merchandise as she has many clients in the neighbourhood who come to her store to make their purchases.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of merchandise such as canned items, fresh bread, cider, wine, soda, candy masses, Christmas arrangements, and others.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es:
La señora Wilma C. es soltera, tiene 37 años y vive en su casa propia en el Barrio San Miguel Cambyreta.

La señora Wilma es propietaria de una Despensa que posee en su domicilio desde hace varios años y que es atendida por ella misma. Mediante este trabajo ella siempre ha podido salir adelante, cubrir los gastos de hogar y ha ampliado su despensa que cuando inicio era más pequeña. Sus hijos ya son mayores de edad y trabajan de manera independiente.

Esta señora es cliente de la Fundación Paraguaya desde hace unos años y mediante los créditos obtenidos ella ha ido ampliando su capital operativo.

Hoy día ella esta solicitando el crédito para la compra de más mercaderías por el hecho de que se acerca fin de año y necesita surtir mas su comercio, ya que tiene clientes que continuamente se acercan a adquirir sus productos.
texts.en:
Wilma C. is single. She is 37 years old and lives in her own house in the San Miguel Cambyreta neighborhood. Wilma is the owner of a small corner store that she has run herself out of her household for many years. By means of this business, she has always been able to come out ahead, cover the household expenses and expand the store, which was much smaller when she began. Her adult children work independently. She has been a client of Fundación Paraguaya for many years and with these loans, she has increased her working capital. Today she is taking out a loan to purchase more merchandise since the end of the year is approaching and she needs to better stock her store, as her clients are constantly purchasing her products.

Translated from Spanish by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase various types of merchandise: Christmas items, fruit cakes, pudding, cider, sparkling wines and other products.

loans.name: Valerio

texts.es:
El Sr. Valerio Rolón es comerciante, tiene 54 años, es casado, su señora se llama Tomasa Villalba quien tiene 46 años , tienen 3 hijos.
 
Valerio decidió abrir con la ayuda de su esposa una despensa hace más de 20 años en el mercado de la ciudad. Actualmente posee una cantidad importante de clientes y buenos precios en sus mercaderías ya que los suele adquirir al por mayor. 

Valerio pretende utilizar el crédito para la compra de verduras, aceites, gaseosas, harina, azúcar, etc. en gran cantidad y así poder ayudar a sus hijos que van a la universidad y precisan del apoyo financiero para poder pagar los costosos estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Mr. Valerio Rolón is a businessman, 54 years old, and married to Tomasa Villalba who is 46 years old. They have 3 children. About 20 years ago, Valerio, with the help of his wife, decided to open a store in the city market. He actually has an significant clientele and great prices on his merchandise since he usually acquires them in bulk. Valerio proposes to use the loan to purchase vegetables, cooking oil, sodas, flour, sugar, etc. in large quantities and thus be able to help his children who attend university and need financial support to be able to pay for their costly university studies.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of vegetables, flour,  breads, cooking oil, sodas, etc.

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
La señora Viviana Benítez es peluquera, tiene 23 años, es separada, tiene 1 hijo de 6 años de edad, vive con su madre.
 
Viviana abrió su propia peluquería hace más de dos años, luego de mucho sacrificio. Precisa del crédito para la compra de productos para peluquería tales como cremas para el cabello, agua oxigenada , tinturas y así poder tener completa su peluquería, ya que sus clientes piden a diario mayores atenciones.
texts.en:
Viviana Benítez is a hairdresser. She is 23 years old, separated, and has a 6-year old son. She lives with her mother. Viviana opened her own hair salon over 2 years ago, after much sacrifice. She says the loan will be used to buy products for her salon such as hair creams, hydrogen peroxide, and dyes so that her hair salon will be well stocked, as her customers are more exacting every day.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dyes, hydrogen peroxide, and hair creams.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Andrés tiene 44 años de edad, está casado con Delci González, quien le ayuda en el negocio, en la venta de productos del hogar casa por casa, viven en casa propia, tienen un hijo de 10 años quien está en la escuela.
Andrés estuvo trabajando desde muy joven como vendedor ambulante de su padre, y después varios años se compro para su motocicleta, y así se independizó de su padre.
Andrés comienza su trabajo todos los días a las 5:00 am recorriendo varios kilómetros en su motocicleta realizando las ventas casa por casa.
Actualmente trabaja con él  dos sobrinos a quien les remunera por los servicios realizados y cuenta con clientela formada.
Necesita el crédito para la compra de una motocicleta.
texts.en:
Andrés is 44 years old and married to Delci González who helps him in his business, selling household products door to door. They live in their own house and have a 10-year old son who attends school. Andrés has been working as a street vendor since he was very young, working with his father, and after several years he bought a motorcycle and became independent. Andrés starts work each day at 5:00 A.M. travelling many kilometres on his motorcycle in order to sell door to door. His 2 nephews are currently working for him, for which they get paid a commission for their sales and for new clients. He needs the loan in order to buy a motorcycle.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to continue working.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Andres tiene 55 años de edad, está casado con Soriana Cabral, quien le ayuda en los quehaceres domesticos, tienen 5 cinco hijos, dos de los cuales ya son profesionales, y los otros trabajan con él. Andrés se dedica a la producción y comercialización del carbón.
Andres  heredó la profesión de su padre con quien estuvo trabajando desde muy joven.
Empieza a las 5:00 am repartiendo sus productos en  una motocicleta en las principales despensas de su comunidad.
Necesita el crédito para la compra de materia prima (leñas).
texts.en:
Andres is 55 years old and married to Soriana Cabral who helps with the household chores. They have 5 children, 2 of whom have careers and the others work with him. Andrés makes and sells charcoal. Andrés inherited the business from his father with whom he worked from a very young age. He starts work at 5:00 A.M. delivering his products by motorcycle to the main grocery stores of his community. He needs the loan in order to buy raw materials (wood).

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials (wood) to make charcoal.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Delia Antonia González ,es una persona trabajadora, con esfuerzo y dedicación crió sola 2 hijos, además cuenta con casa propia.
Generalmente, busca lugares estratégicos para abrir su micro empresa y así obtener muchas ventas, estos lugares generalmente son cercas de colegios o talleres de autos y son visitados por ellas, una vez que obtiene clientela lo transporta en forma de viandas a sus clientes sus productos y trata de hacer algún agregado mas , para que no sea solamente comidas, es como un menú o un combo y así ganarse mas clientela y a mantener también.
texts.en:
Delia Antonia González is a hard-working person who with effort and dedication has raised her 2 children on her own, as well as owning her own home. She generally searches for strategic locations to open her small business and in this manner makes many sales. Her locations are usually near schools or car workshops which generate many clients. Once she has customers buying her food, she tries to partner the food so that she is not selling by item but rather a meal or combo and thereby attracting more customer and keeping the customers she already has.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an assortment of drinks and raw materials such as meat, flour, oil, etc.

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
Enrique Javier A. es un muchacho joven ,tiene apenas 20 años, emprendedor con la ayuda de sus padres tiene su propia micro empresa,y 12 personas trabajando en la misma, su sueño mas grande es comprarse el local donde tiene su negocio, que queda cerca de un mercado municipal mas grande de Asuncion.
Esta estudiando en la universidad,y se hizo una promesa a si mismo de que llegaría muy alto, para  lo cual debe ser organizado, disciplinado y responsable.
texts.en:
Enrique Javier A. is a young man barely 20 years old. With his parents' help, this entrepreneur has his own small business employing 12 people. His greatest dream is to buy the building where he has his business as it is near the largest municipal market in Asuncion. He is studying at university and has promised himself that he will go far in life, for which he needs to be organized, disciplined, and responsible.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy graphic equipment, 1 machine.

loans.name: Marcia

texts.es: Marcia tiene 43 años, es madre de una hija quien cursa estudios universitarios y vive junto a su esposo quien le ayuda en lo posible. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad, en las instalaciones de su vivienda, esta labor la viene realizando desde hace 2 años atrás, y lo que le gusta de su trabajo es conocer mucha gente, con quienes trata sobre diferentes temas. Este negocio le es rentable porque ella no paga alquiler de local, además, cuenta con una clientela selecta y fiel a su bodega. Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP, demostrando responsabilidad en sus pagos en los créditos anteriores. Con el dinero que solicita ampliará su tienda y comprará más productos para surtir mejor sus estantes.
texts.en:
Marcia is 43 years old and has a daughter studing in university. She lives with her husband who helps her as much as he can. She sells groceries and staple products from her home. She has been in business for 2 years and she enjoys meeting all the people with whom she can speak about all sorts of topics. The business is profitable because she does not have to pay rent for the premises, in addition she has a good customer base who are faithful to her store. This is her 4th loan with MFP; she has shown that she is responsible with her previous loans. She will use this loan to expand her store and purchase more products in order to better stock the shelves.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the products of her store.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es: La señora Aurora tiene 46 años, es madre de 7 hijos, siendo 4 de ellos independientes, viviendo en la actualidad con 3 de ellos que estudian, trabajan y la apoyan mucho. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para niños, esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 5 años atrás. Le gusta su trabajo porque conoce muchas personas y diferentes lugares. Además, le es rentable, porque sus prendas de vestir las lleva  a vender por diferentes lugares y le genera regulares ingresos, le va bien. Este es su 7mo préstamo con MFP, y hasta el momento ha sido puntual con sus cuotas. Con el dinero solicitado quiere comprar más ropa, y complementar su negocio con la venta de zapatos, ya que sus clientes lo solicitan.
texts.en:
Aurora is 46 years old and is the mother of 7 children, 4 of whom are independent and 3 who currently live with her, attend school, work and help her very much. She has been selling children's clothing for 5 years. She enjoys her work because she meets many people and goes to many places. In addition, her business is profitable because she brings her clothes to different places to sell and it gives her a regular income. Business is good. This is her 7th loan with MFP, and up to now she has been punctual with her payments. She will buy more clothing with this loan, and add to her business by selling shoes because this is what her customers have requested.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more clothing for resale, as well as shoes.

loans.name: Darwin

texts.es: Darwin tiene 32 años, vive con su conviviente y sus tres hijos quienes son su mayor inspiración de seguir trabajando arduamente. Se dedica al transporte de pasajeros desde hace 10 años, y gracias a su buena administración del dinero ahora es propietario de un motocarro, el cual le ayuda a fortalecer la economía de su hogar. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es el trato directo que tiene con sus pasajeros, además le es rentable porque él mismo es el chofer y no tiene que pagar un sueldo adicional. Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP, demostrando ser un cliente puntual en sus cuotas de pago. Con el dinero solicitado comprará repuestos para mandar a reparar su motocarro.
texts.en:
Darwin is 32 years old, lives with his common-law partner and his 3 children who are his main inspiration to continue working hard. He has been transporting passengers for 10 years and due to his sound money management he now owns a motocar which helps to increase his household income. What he enjoys most about his work is the direct contact he has with his passengers. His business is profitable because he himself is the driver and there is no need to pay an additional salary. This is his 3rd loan with MFP. He has proven himself to be punctual in his loan repayments. He will use the loan to buy spare parts to repair his motocar.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his motocar

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: Esther tiene 44 años, es madre de dos hijos en edad escolar, vive con su esposo quien la apoya en sus metas trazadas. Ella se dedica a vender gaseosas y cervezas, esto lo viene realizando desde hace ya 3 años atrás, para lo cual le va muy bien. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar una buena atención a sus clientes. Además le es rentable por encontrarse ubicada en una buena zona, lo difícil para ella es no contar con un local adecuado para la atención a sus clientes, ya que lo hace a las afueras de su vivienda. Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP, siendo puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita mandará a construir un local adecuado para la venta de sus bebidas, y ambientarlo adecuadamente para la atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Esther is 44 years old and the mother of 2 school-aged children. She lives with her husband who supports her in her goals. She has been selling soft drinks and beer for 3 years and business is very good. She very much enjoys taking good care of her customers. The business is profitable because it is located in a good spot. She says that her greatest difficulty lies in not having an adequate locale to server her clients as the business is not based in her house. This is her 4th loan with MFP; she has been punctual with her payments. She will use the loan to build an approprate locale for the sale of her refreshments and to create an appropriate environment for the care of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a dedicated locale for her business

loans.name: Hildebrando

texts.es: Hildebrando es padre soltero, vive con sus dos hijos quienes estudian y lo apoyan mucho. Su dedicación constante en el cultivo de yuca, plátano, maíz, arroz y otras variedades, la viene realizando desde hace más de 15 años. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es tener en buenas condiciones sus productos para luego llevarlos a vender a un buen precio. Le es rentable porque cuenta con clientes quienes están al pendiente de sus productos para comprarlos, por lo que le va muy bien. Este es su 5to préstamo con MFP, y durante este tiempo ha demostrado ser puntual y responsable en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más granos para sembrar, además, quiere mandar a cercar una parte de sus parcelas para que estén protegidos sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Hildebrando is a single father who lives with his 2 children who are in school and are of great support. For more than 15 years, he has been cultivating cassava, banana, maize, rice and other varieties. What he likes about his work is to have good produce in order to sell them for a good price. His business is profitable because he has customers who are waiting to buy his products, and so it is doing very well. This is his 5th loan with MFP and he has shown himself to be punctual and responsible in his payments. With the loan money, he will purchase more grain to sow as well as fence part of his plots of land so that his crops will be protected.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more seed to sow

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es: Humberto tiene 40 años de edad, vive con su conviviente y sus dos hijos, quienes lo motivan día a día a seguir trabajando duro. El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte público desde hace 8 años atrás, Humberto trabaja durante todo el día, a razón de sacar adelante a sus hijos. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce muchos lugares y trata con personas que le enseñan técnicas y estrategias de trabajo. Además le es rentable, ya que él mismo maneja su motocarro. Las dificultades se presentan cuando su vehículo sufre desperfectos. Este es su 6to préstamo con MFP, siendo una persona responsable en sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado quiere mandar a reparar su herramienta de trabajo y comprar algunos repuestos para trabajar tranquilo y sin preocupaciones.
texts.en:
Humberto is 40 years old and lives with his wife and their two children, who motivate him day after day to continue working hard. He is dedicated to offering public transportation service and has been since eight years ago. Humberto works all day, for the sake of his children. The thing he likes about his work is that he knows a lot of places and he works with people who teach him techniques and strategies for his job. Furthermore, it is profitable for him since he is the one who drives his motocart. He has difficulties when his vehicle gets damaged. This is his sixth loan with MFP and he is a responsible person in his payments. With the money requested, he wants to send his vehicle for repairs and buy some spare parts so he can work peacefully and without worries.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair his motocart.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
La señora Blanca Calderón tiene 37 años, es soltera, pero vive en  pareja con quien tiene dos hijas menores de edad y se encuentra viviendo en alquiler desde hace más de 5 años en el mismo lugar, el marido también le ayuda en el negocio que es un bar-copetin , posee una amplia clientela porque la zona en la que se encuentra es muy poblada y concurrida que es el Mercado Municipal Nº 4, donde ofrece sus servicios de comida tambien en mayor cantidad a sus paisanos que viven por la zona. Desea invertir en la compra de más insumos para comestibles como pollos, carnes, harinas, aceites y bebidas en general.
Una de sus aspiraciones es poder ampliar próximamente su negocio en lo que se refiere al equipamiento y mobiliario y poder ofrecer un ambiente más cómodo y ameno a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Señora Blanca Calderón is 37 years old and single, but she lives with her partner with whom she has two young daughters. They live in a rental property and have been at the same place for five years. Her partner also helps her in the business, which is an aperitif bar. She has a large clientele because the area in which she is located is very crowded and busy. It is in the Town Market Nº 4, where she offers her food services as well to the residents that live in the area. She wants to invest in purchasing the ingredients for foods, like chicken, meat, wheat, oil, and drinks. One of her aspirations is to be able to soon make her business larger with respect to her work equipment and its furniture, so that she can provide a more comfortable and pleasant environment.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chicken, meat, oils, wheat, and drinks.

loans.name: Isis

texts.es: Isis tiene 30 años, vive con sus 4 hijos y su conviviente quien le ayuda en lo posible. Su dedicación a la venta de comida logró que implementara en su propio domicilio un espacio para su negocio, por la misma razón que sus clientes le exigieron que ampliara, y ella por su buena atención y sazón, se ganó el cariño y respeto de sus comensales, esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace un año, y lo que le gusta de su trabajo es cocinar bien para que sus clientes se sientan satisfechos. Además, le es rentable, ya que se encuentra ubicada en un buen lugar. Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP, y ha sido puntual en sus créditos anteriores. Con el dinero que solicita quiere comprar mesas y sillas, para dar una mejor acogida a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Isis is 30 years old and lives with her four children and her husband, who helps her wherever possible. She is dedicated to selling food, which she does in her own home in a space made for her business. This is the reason why her clients demanded her to increase the space. Through her good attention and flavor, she won the affection and respect of her guests. She has been doing this activity since a year ago, and the thing she likes about her work is cooking so well that her clients feel satisfied. Furthermore, it is profitable for her since she is located in a good place. This is her third loan with MFP, and she has been punctual in her previous loans. With the money that she requests, she wants to buy tables and seats in order to give a better reception to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seats and tables for her food sales business.

loans.name: Jabier

texts.es: Jabier tiene 33 años, vive junto a su esposa y a sus 3 hijos en edad escolar y son su razón de salir al frente laboralmente. El se dedica a la compra y venta de yuca, producto que consigue durante las madrugadas en el puerto fluvial de su región. Esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 6 años atrás. Lo que le gusta de este trabajo es que le genera muchos ingresos, también le agrada dar una buena atención y convencer a sus clientes para que le compren. Para poder vender sus yucas se encuentra ubicado en una buena zona del mercado, le va muy bien. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP. Y con el dinero requerido construirá un almacén para tener sus productos en un lugar seguro y cómodo.
texts.en:
Jabier is 33 years old and lives with his wife and 3 school-aged children who are his motivation to go to work. He buys and sells cassava which he gets in the morning in the river port of his region. He has been doing this for 6 years. He likes that this work pays well and enjoys taking care of his customers and convincing them to buy his cassava. He is well situated in the marketplace to sell his cassava, and business is good. This is his first loan with MFP. He will use the loan money to build a warehouse in order to keep his products safe and handy.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a warehouse for his produce.

loans.name: Inocencia

texts.es:
La señorita Inocencia Otazú  tiene 24 años, es soltera, pero vive en pareja con quien tiene 1 hijo menor de edad y posee casa propia que heredó de sus padres, se inició en su actividad desde muy joven a partir de los 16 años, que es la compra-venta de artículos de mercería como zapatos para damas, blusas, bijouteries varios y otros artículos de temporada, su capital incial fue de Gs. 500.000.- que fue ampliando con el correr de los años y fue progresando gracias a la buena administración en sus negocios, ahora posee buen capital de giro y sigue creciendo por la gran demanda de sus clientes de varios años, desea invertir siempre para la compra de más prendas de temporada.
Inocencia Otazú  desea invertir en el futuro para la refacción de su vivienda y ofrecer más comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Inocencia Otazú is 24 years old, single but living with a partner with whom she has a young child. She owns her own home, inherited from her parents. She has been working since she was quite young, from the time she was 16, buying and selling clothing and shoes for ladies, blouses, costume jewelry and other seasonal articles. Her initial investment in the business was Gs. 500.000 - which has appreciated with the passing years and continues to improve thanks to her good management. She now has good working capital and continues to expand due to high demand from clients of all ages. She wishes to invest in the purchase of more seasonal clothing. Innocence Otazú wants to invest in the future by renovating her home and providing more convenience to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ladies' shoes, blouses, shorts, costume jewelry.

loans.name: Joel

texts.es: Joel tiene 33 años de edad, es padre de tres hijos y vive junto a su conviviente quien lo ayuda mucho, sobre todo en su chacra. Se dedica al cultivo de maíz y arroz, como también cría ganado, este arduo trabajo lo viene realizando desde hace 3años y lo que le gusta es cuidar bien sus cultivos y a sus animales, para que por su buena apariencia sean comprados a un buen precio. Y como sus productos, una vez en el mercado, son muy requeridos por sus clientes, le va bien. Es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, habiendo sido responsable en sus pagos anteriormente. Con el dinero solicitado comprará más granos para sembrar y abonos (guano y urea) para que sus productos crezcan fuertes.
texts.en:
Joel is 33 years old and the father of three children. He lives with his partner who is hugely helpful to him, above all on their farm. Joel grows maize and rice and raises livestock. He's been doing this difficult work since he was 3 years old. The thing that pleases him most is taking good care of his crops and animals since a good appearance might fetch a better price. And since his products, once in the market, are in much demand by his customers, he's right to take care. This is Joel's second MFP loan, having been responsible in repaying the first loan. He will use the funds to buy seeds and fertilizers (guano and urea) so that his products grow strongly.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds and fertilizers for farming business.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.es: Juanita tiene 24 años, es soltera, vive con sus padres quienes se sienten muy orgullosos de tener una hija muy trabajadora. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas regionales en la afueras de su vivienda, esto lo viene realizando desde hace 5 años atrás y le gusta estar en contacto directo con sus clientes para darles una buena atención. Este negocio le es rentable, ya que se encuentra ubicada en una zona muy transitada, y sus principales consumidores son los chóferes de los camiones de carga que tienen sus paraderos muy cerca. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, y está comprometido con sus cuotas de pago. Con el dinero que solicita incrementará la cantidad de fruta que vende, además de iniciar un nuevo negocio de venta  de comida.
texts.en:
Juanita is 24 years old, single, and lives with her parents who are very proud of their hard-working daughter. She sells regional fruit in the area outside their home, which she has done for the past five years. She enjoys being in direct contact with her clients to provide the best customer service. Her business is profitable since she is located in a high transit area and her main clients are the truck drivers whose stops are nearby. This is her first loan with MFP and she has committed to making the payments. With the loan money she will increase the amount of fruit she has for sale as well as start a new food selling business.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the amount of fruit for sale

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
El señor Leonardo E. tiene 29 años, es soltero, vive en pareja con quien tiene 2 hijos y posee casa propia, se inició en su actividad desde muy joven a partir de los 20 años, que es la reparación de motos y automóviles, su capital incial fue de Gs. 1.000.000.- que fue ampliando con el correr de los años y fue progresando gracias a la buena administración en sus negocios, ahora posee buen capital de giro y sigue creciendo por la gran demanda de sus clientes de varios años, desea invertir siempre para la compra de más repuestos, además de más motos usados y automóviles.
El señor Leonardo E. desea para más adelante invertir en la compra de más automóviles y abrir su propia playa de autos, por la gran demanda de medios de transportes propios a bajo costo.
texts.en:
Mr. Leonardo E. is 29 years old, single, and lives, with his partner with whom he has two children, in his own home. He started his business at the young age of 20, repairing motorcycles and cars, with an initial capital of 1,000,000 guaranís, which he grew over the years and progressed thanks to his adept business administration. Now he has a good cash flow and continues to grow thanks to the demand of his clients over the years. He wishes to invest in a stock of parts and more used motorcycles and cars. In the future, Leonardo wishes to buy more cars and open his own dealership due to high demand for independent low-cost transportation.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy motorcycle parts

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia de 49 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos y vive con su conviviente, quien está de acuerdo con sus propósitos de negocio. Su dedicación a la venta de abarrotes la viene haciendo desde hace 2 años atrás, en un pequeño espacio de su casa. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es tener el trato directo con sus clientes, y darles una buena atención es lo más importante, nos menciona. Este negocio le es muy rentable porque se encuentra ubicada en una buena zona  y le genera buenos ingresos, lo que quiere decir que le va muy bien. Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP, siendo puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado quiere mandar a ampliar su negocio, y posteriormente llegar a tener su minimarket.
texts.en:
Julia is a 49-year-old mother of three, living with her partner who supports her in her business endeavors. She has been selling groceries and provisions for the past two years from a small space in her home. She enjoys the direct contact with her customers and providing the best customer service is very important to her. She makes a good profit because she is located in a good zone that provides steady business and it is going well. This is her fourth loan with MFP and she has always been prompt with her payments. With the requested funds she will expand her business and later hopes to open her own mini-market.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase store merchadise

loans.name: Ketly

texts.es: Ketly tiene 22 años, es soltero, vive junto a sus padres y hermanos quienes le apoyan en todo. Es propietario de un motocarro, con el que se dedica al transporte de pasajeros por las distintas zonas de su ciudad desde hace un año atrás. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es entablar relación y darles un buen trato a sus pasajeros, le es muy rentable este trabajo, ya que él mismo administra sus ganancias diarias y no cuenta con muchas responsabilidades económicas por el momento; por lo que le va bien laboral y personalmente. Es su primer préstamo con MFP, y se ha comprometido con su banco comunal para ser puntual con sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita reparará su moto, también comprará piezas para armar otro motocarro.
texts.en:
Ketly is 22 years old, single, and lives with his parents and siblings who support him in his endeavors. He owns a motorcar, which for the past year he has used to transport passengers to various corners of the city. He enjoys the personal rapport he establishes with his clients and has earned a good profit with his business. He administers his own daily earnings and does not have much economic overhead right now so he is doing well at work and personally. This is first loan with MFP and he has committed to his communal bank to make the payments timely. With the requested funds he will repair his motorcar and buy spare parts to build up a second one.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair the motorcar

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es: Leonor tiene 42 años, es madre de 3 hijos en edad escolar y vive junto a su esposo quien la ayuda mucho. Ella  se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos y otros accesorios desde hace un año atrás en forma ambulatoria, su esposo, quien es trabajador independiente la apoya mucho en su negocio. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es levantarse muy temprano a preparar toda su mercadería para luego llevarla a vender por  los diferentes lugares de su zona, además, le es rentable porque ya cuenta con una clientela selecta que  le compran sus prendas constantemente. Este es su 3er crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete nuevamente a ser responsable con sus cuotas de pago. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más prendas, posteriormente le gustaría acondicionar en su propia casa su tienda de ropa y pasamanería, ya que se encuentra ubicada en una zona adecuada para el comercio.
texts.en:
Leonor is a 42-year-old mother of three school aged children and lives with her husband who helps her out quite a bit. For the past year her business has been selling clothing, shoes, and accessories door-to-door. Her husband, who works independently, helps her in her business. She enjoys getting up early to prepare her merchandise to take to various points in her area, which is profitable because she now has a dedicated client base who consistently purchase her wares. This is her third loan with MFP and she has committed to make the payments. With the requested funds she will buy more items and later she would like to build her clothing and lace-work shop in her own home, since she is well-situated for a business locale.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the amount of items for sale

loans.name: Sindulfo

texts.es:
El señor Sindulfo S. tiene 44 años, es soltero, vive en pareja con quien tiene 2 hijos y posee casa propia, se inició en su actividad desde muy joven a partir de los 15 años, que es la compra-venta de lubricantes y aceites para todo tipo de automóviles, su capital incial fue de Gs. 100.000.- que fue ampliando con el correr de los años y fue progresando gracias a la buena administración en sus negocios, ahora posee buen capital de giro y sigue creciendo gracias a la gran demanda de sus clientes de varios años, desea invertir siempre para la compra de más insumos como lubricantes y aceites, además de más accesorios para automóviles y motos.
El señor Sindulfo S. desea para más adelante construir otra fosa que le servirá para el mantenimiento de los automóviles.
texts.en:
Mr. Sindulfo S. is 44 years old, single, and lives with his partner with whom he has two children and owns his own home. He started his business at the young age of 15, buying and selling lubricants and oils for all types of cars. His initial capital was 100,000 guaranís, and grew over the years and progressed thanks to his adept business administration. Now he has a good cash flow and continues to grow thanks to the demand of his clients over the years. He plans to invest in the purchase of products such as lubricants and oils as well as spare parts for cars and motorcycles. Mr. S. hopes in the future to build a second shop from which to provide car maintenance.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy car lubricants, oils and spare parts

loans.name: Lizbeth

texts.es: Lizbeth tiene 35 años, es madre de 3 hijos en edad escolar, además, vive con su conviviente quien está de acuerdo con sus objetivos. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida en las afueras de su casa por las noches, lo viene haciendo desde hace 3 años, negocio con el cual está sacando adelante a sus hijos. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es preparar bien su comida y que esté al gusto de sus clientes para que los mismos se sientas satisfechos. Le es rentable, ya que cuenta con muchos clientes fieles, además se encuentra ubicada en una buena zona. Es su 6to préstamo con MFP, y es una clienta puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita mandará a construir su kiosco para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lizbeth is a 35-year-old mother of three school aged children who lives with her partner, who supports her in her endeavors. Her business is selling food in the evenings from outside of her home, which she has been doing for the past three years and has been helping to support her children. She enjoys preparing the food to her clients' tastes so they come away satisfied. She makes a good profit as she has a loyal client following and she is well-situated. This is her sixth loan with MFP and she has a punctual payment history. With the requested funds she will have a kiosk built from which to better serve her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a food-selling kiosk

loans.name: María

texts.es: María es madre soltera, vive con sus tres hijos que son solteros, trabajan y la apoyan mucho. Ella se dedicaba a la crianza de pollos, a razón de no ser una actividad muy productiva, y también decidió vender bebidas (cervezas y gaseosas), actividad que viene realizando recientemente (2 meses atrás), lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar una buena atención a sus clientes y mantener amistad con ellos, además, su nuevo negocio de bebidas es muy rentable, ya que son productos que tiene mucha demanda. Por lo general, le va bien. Con este, suman 10 créditos con MFP, y desde que inició su trabajo con su banco comunal, ha demostrado ser responsable y puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita esta vez mandará a construir un local adecuado para la venta de sus bebidas.
texts.en:
Maria is a single mother. She lives with her three single children, who work and help her a lot. She was raising chickens, but because this wasn't very productive, she also decided to sell beverages (sodas and beers), something she started doing just two months ago. The thing she likes about her work is giving her customers good service and maintaining a friendship with them. Besides, her new business of selling drinks is very profitable, as her products are in high demand. In general, it's going well for her. This loan will be her 10th loan from Kiva partner Microfinanzas Prisma, and since she began working with her communal bank, she has shown herself to be responsible and timely in making payments. With the money she is requesting this time, she will begin construction on a location for her drink sales.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction on her place of business

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
La señorita Susana Otazú  tiene 23 años, es soltera, actualmente no tiene pareja  y posee casa propia que adquirió  con la ayuda de sus padres, se inició en su actividad desde muy joven a partir de los 15 años, que es la compra-venta de artículos de mercería como pantalones y jeans para damas, blusas, remeras  y otros artículos de temporada, su capital incial fue de Gs. 800.000.- que fue ampliando con el correr de los años y fue progresando gracias a la buena administración en sus negocios, ahora posee buen capital de giro y sigue creciendo por la gran demanda de sus clientes de varios años, ella distribuye sus pedidos en su propio medio de transporte que es  una  moto, desea invertir siempre para la compra de más prendas de temporada.
Susana Otazú  desea invertir en el futuro para la refacción de su vivienda, construir un salón comercial y ofrecer más comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Susana O. is 23 years old, single, has no boyfriend, and has her own home that she bought with the help of her parents. She started her business when she was very young, at the age of 15. She buys and sells merchandise such as slacks and jeans for women, blouses, t-shirts, and other seasonal items. Her initial capital was Gs. 800,000, which has grown over the years and has continued to grow thanks to the good administration of her business. Now she has money going in and out of her business, and it keeps growing because of her customers' demands over the years. Susana delivers her customers' orders with her own form of transportation - a scooter. She always wants to invest in her business to buy more seasonal clothing. Susana O. wants to invest in the future to refurbish her home, build a sales room, and offer her customers more comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy slacks and jeans for women, blouses, t-shirts, and other seasonal items

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es: La señora Elvira W. es cliente de la Fundación Paraguaya hace 3 años, destacándose por  su pago excelente, es madre soltera por lo que sus esfuerzos se redoblan por tener el papel de jefa de hogar y no tener otro ingreso para sustentar los gastos de la casa. Se inició en el negocio de compra y venta hace 10 años , vendiendo ropa de ocasión casa por casa hasta lograr un pequeño capital para establecerse en su local propio   hasta hoy día , contando con un amplio stock de mercaderías varias lo cual le permite mirar con optimismo el periodo de fin de año donde hay mas expectativas de ventas.
texts.en:
Elvira W. has been a client of Kiva partner Fundacion Paraguaya for three years, standing out by making her payments well. She is a single mother, which is why she works doubly hard as the head of household. She has no other income to pay for her home's expenses. She began her business of buying and selling 10 years ago, selling, door to door, clothes for various occasions until she earned a little bit of money to set herself up in her own location, where she has been until now, relying on a wide stock of merchandise. This allows her to be optimistic about the end of the year, when there are more expected sales.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of shoes and items imported from Bolivia for end-of-year sales

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señorita Rosa P. es soltera , y tiene 30 años de edad . El negocio lo tiene muy bien ubicado, zona altamente comercial y su boutique es  uno de los comercios más conocidos, se inició con un capital de Gs. 5.000.000.- son $ 1000.- aproximadamente,  que fue ampliando con el correr de los años ya que cuenta con una amplia clientela, pues la zona en la que se encuentran es muy poblada y muy concurrida.
La señorita Rosa P.,  retira el préstamo para la compra de varias mercaderías como ser: prendas de vestir para  damas principalmente, y para la temporada primavera - verano.
Una de sus aspiraciones es poder ampliar próximamente su negocio, en lo que se refiere  al equipamiento o mobiliario para  poder ofrecer  un ambiente más cómodo y ameno a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Miss Rosa P. is 30-years-old and single. Her boutique has a great location in a very commercial area and is one of the best-known shops. She started out with about 5,000,000 guaraní ($1000) in capital. Her business has grown over the years and she now enjoys a healthy clientele, since her area is highly populated and bustling. Miss P. will use her loan to purchase merchandise, primarily women’s clothing, and spring and summer attire. One of her short-term goals is to be able to grow her business by buying equipment and furnishings so she can offer her customers a more pleasant and comfortable atmosphere.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase lingerie, T-shirts, pants, footwear, etc.

loans.name: Jan Mohammad

texts.en:
Jan M.  lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has four children, and he runs his general store .He has been involved in this business for more than 6 years and he wants to make his business larger. He needs more money for his business capital to become strong and help his family better. 

He has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghans for a term of 15 months. He wants to expand and move his business forward, buying the necessity materials and completing his stock for his shop so he can start working even harder.

So Jan M.  is very happy with this process of small loans in Afghanistan and wants to thank those involved, especially Kiva and all lenders around the world.

loans.use: to expand and make his business progress

loans.name: Fatana Group

texts.en:
Nabela is the group leader of the Fatana group. There are three members in this group. Each of them would like to receive a loan for her own business. Zabida and Zakara want to take a loan for the business of tailoring. Nabela wants to take a loan for her bead business. They all want to see progress in their businesses and to earn more money to support their families better in future.

They want to say that they appreciate these loans people in Afghanistan can use to further their businesses and make larger businesses. They want to thank those involved in the Kiva process to support poor people.

loans.use: to help their businesses progress

loans.name: Khalid

texts.en: Khalid A. is a Tanzania business man. He runs a workshop, making furniture and selling it to customers. He employs three professional carpenters and in total, his business has four employees. The business is located in the Buguruni wood market center and he has been in the business for seven years. He is requesting a loan of TZH 1,400,000  to buy a specialized circular saw to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy new circular saw

loans.name: Jastine

texts.en: Jastine A. is a married Tanzanian man. He runs a business of providing transport services around Dar es Salaam. He has got two mini-buses. The daily business sales for the two mini-buses are Tshs 100,000/=, which amounts to Tshs 3 million per month. From this business income generation he managed to build a residential house. He is requesting a loan of Tshs 1,400,000 to keep up his business.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Salehe

texts.en: Salehe R.  is a Tanzanian businessman. He runs a café in the Vingunguti area outside Dar es Salaam city shopping center. He has been in the business for more than four years now. He requests a loan of Tshs 1,200,000/= to expand the business so as to meet customer demand.

loans.use: to boost his business

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma Uliza is a Tanzanian micro-businesswoman. She sells clothing in a traditional clothes shop (Kanga and Vitenge) at Buguruni trading center. She purchases her inventory from Mnazi Mmoja wholesale shops and makes other clothes purchases from Kariakoo business center. She derives her income to support her family from the business. She has been in the business for five years now. She requests a loan of Tshs 1,000,000 to boost her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina S. M. is a Tanzanian woman entrepreneur. She is forty-five years old. She runs a café at Ilala in Dar es Salaam city center. Her business is six years old. Income derived from the business is used to feed her family and some for capitalization of her business. She needs a loan of 1,000,000/=   to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Hen

texts.en: Hen K. is a widowed 52-year-old living in the Pursat Province. She earns a living by selling Khmer noodles and raising poultry. K. is also a local rice farmer. She earns approximately $10 a day to support her family's living expenses from the businesses she developed beginning  in 1979. She has six children, two of whom are single and four of whom are married. To further help meet the family's needs, two of her children are employed as electricians for a company. K. requested a loan of $800 with the goal of purchasing more poultry, including ducks and chickens to raise, as well as a motorcycle to make transportation for the family a bit easier.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry to raise and a motorcycle

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea E. is 54 years old and a resident of the Kompong Tom Province. She makes a living raising pigs which she sells for slaughter in four months time after raising. She has been raising pigs for about a year and is currently earning around $3 a day. E. is married with eight children, four of whom are single and the other four are married. Two of her children are employed as company staff. Her husband is Kan Moeun, aged 51. He is a local rice trader that purchases rice from farmers to sell by using his truck. E. is applying a loan of $1,000 as capital to allow her to save financially in helping her husband to purchase more rice to store and sell and to repair his truck. (E.'s husband appears in the photograph because she was not available)

loans.use: To purchase rice to store and sell and to repair a truck

loans.name: Kum

texts.en: Kum Y. is 32 years old and a resident of Kompong Tom Province. She is a rice farmer as well as raising pigs at her home to provide income for her family's needs. She currently earns approximately  US$ 2 per day and has been running her businesses for more than three years. She takes care of two young children; both of them are single and attend school. Her husband is a construction supervisor who has employees to provide his services. Y. hopes to expand her business and ease the hard physical labor necessary for her farming, thus she needs a loan to buy more piglets to raise and a cow to use for plowing her field.

loans.use: To buy more piglets to raise and a cow for plowing

loans.name: Kalanzi B- Eva Group

texts.en:
Eva A., 35, is a single mother of three and a hairdresser by profession. After attaining a certificate in hairdressing eight years back, she raised some capital and opened up Eva’s Beauty Salon in Kibuli. She is a specialist in plaiting, weaving, treatment, retouching and curling kit. On her price list, plaiting and weaving rank highest at 15,000 Ugandan shillings (about $USD7.50) per head. In the good seasons, like the months of November, December, January, May and August, she makes an average of 200,000 Ugandan shillings per day - a little over $USD100; in lean seasons, she makes UGX20,000.

Eva will use this loan to replenish her stock of cosmetics - hair relaxers, hair treatment, deodorants, perfumes, foundation powders and nail varnishes - and hair additions - afro kinky, hi yaki, babe cut, Abuja braids, pony braids and human hair. Eva wins over her customers by ensuring good services. She works hard to ensure she provides for her family. Her dream is expanding her salon into a modern fully equipped one, hoping that it will yield more income to enable her family to live a good life.

Eva will share this loan with the four other members of her group.

loans.use: To buy additional cosmetics and hair additions for her salon.

loans.name: Kalanzi B-Prescade Group

texts.en:
Just like her other group members, Prescade N., 48, runs a restaurant in Kalanzi zone. With five years' experience in the business, she has gained popularity for her affordable but delicious and mouth-watering dishes. Her menu comprises matooke, katogo, chapatti, posho, rice, lumonde, cassava, vegetables, beef, chicken and fish among others. A plate of food goes for 1,000 Ugandan shillings (about 50 US cents) from which she earns a profit of 300 shillings.

Prescade is using the proceeds of this loan to purchase rice, green bananas for preparing matooke and maize flour for posho. She buys her supplies from Kikubamutwe market. The growth of her business is mainly attributed to good customer relationships and hygiene. She has employed two jovial, young ladies as waitresses.

Prescade is a single mother of six. She dreams of supplying green bananas to the market vendors to supplement her restaurant income. With a stable source of income, her desire will be to see her family prosper in all aspects of life.

Prescade will share this loan with the four other members of her group.

loans.use: To buy rice, green bananas and maize flour.

loans.name: Kalanzi B-Revocate Group

texts.en:
Revocate B. is 30 years old. She is a hardworking and popular fishmonger in Kalanzi zone. Every morning, she travels 15 kilometers to Ggaba – a landing site on the shores of Lake Victoria – to purchase various types of fish such as tilapia, nile perch, mukeene and kolongo. When she gets back to her stall she dries and smokes some of the tilapia and also slices some of the nile perch into small, affordable pieces of various sizes which she later deep fries in the evening from 5pm-9pm, her peak business hours. This is aimed at meeting the diverse tastes and preferences of her customers.

From fish worth 100,000 Ugandan shillings (about USD$50), Revocate gets a profit of 50,000 shillings. At the moment, she is using the loan proceeds to purchase more fish hoping for increased sales and increased profits. She is a married mother of four and she also takes care of her parents. Her ambition is to become a supplier of both fish and green bananas to the market vendors. She hopes that when her dream comes true she will build a modern residence for her family.

Revocate will share this loan with the four other members of her group.

loans.use: To purchase more fish.

loans.name: Kalanzi B-Specioza Group

texts.en:
Specioza N. is a tailor by profession. She is 27 years old, married with two children and a loving guardian to four of her orphaned nephews. She has five years' experience in making ladies garments like gomeses, bitenges and vikoi, including school uniforms for both girls and boys. In most cases, she purchases yards of materials from which she makes various designs of clothes and sells them to the immediate customers. To boost her business, Specioza is using the loan funds to purchase more materials especially silk, cotton and linen to enable her to make many clothes and meet the demands of her customers.

From sales of 60,000 Ugandan shillings (about USD$30) Specioza gets a profit of approximately 20,000 shillings. She plans well for her income and ensures she meets the basic needs of her family alongside her husband’s contribution. She aspires to open up a boutique selling imported designer wear, hoping that it will yield enough income for her to send her children and nephews to good schools.

Specioza will share this loan with the other members of her group.

loans.use: To purchase more materials especially silk, cotton and linen.

loans.name: Centarl B2- Babra Group

texts.en:
Babra N. runs a restaurant in Kabalagala, a city suburb. She has three years' experience in preparing local dishes like luwombo, matooke, groundnut sauce, smoked fish and beef among others. When she sells food worth 80,000 Ugandan shillings (about USD$40) she gets a profit of approximately 30,000. Babra will use the loan proceeds to purchase rice, flour and cooking oil.

Babra underwent a catering course in Kampala after which her husband raised some capital for her to set up the restaurant. She is a mother of three and also looks after her late sister’s daughter. Her husband is a supplier of green bananas to market vendors. Her ambition is to venture into selling secondhand shoes imported from abroad. She also desires to send all her children to boarding schools.

Babra will share this loan with the other three members of her group.

loans.use: To purchase rice, flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Central B2- Safina Group

texts.en:
Safina N., 40, sells vegetables (cabbages, spinach, lettuce, etc.) and fruits (passion fruit, oranges, avocadoes, mangoes, etc.) in Kabalagala market. She purchases her supplies from Owino and Nakasero markets. From sales worth Ush 100,000, she earns a profit of Ush 30,000. Safina is using the loan to purchase Irish potatoes and tomatoes to add to her stock.

She is a hard-working single lady, devoted to her family of 3 children, 2 nephews, and 2 nieces. Her ambition is to source fruits, vegetables, and cereals from upcountry farmers and sell them to retailers in Kampala. She hopes that when the business does well, she will be able to educate her children. Her desire is to see her family prosper.

loans.use: purchasing Irish potatoes and tomatoes

loans.name: Central B2- Sarifa Ahmed Group

texts.en: Sarifa A. is 27 years old, married with 4 children.  She has a boutique in kabalagala where she sells both new and 2nd hand clothes for ladies. She purchases her stock from owino market and the numerous shopping arcades in town.  From clothes worth Ush 600,000 she earns a profit of Ush 150,000. Sarifa is using the loan to purchase more skirts, blouses, dresses, and suits to meet the rising demands due to her increased customer base. Her prices are fair ands she is so friendly and welcoming to her customers. Her greatest ambition is to purchase her stock directly from Dubai or United Kingdom. She desires to see her children graduate from institutions of higher learning someday.

loans.use: Purchase more skirts, blouses, dresses, and suits.

loans.name: Central B1- Nalugo Victor Group

texts.en:
Forty-year-old Victor N. is a banana vendor in Kabalagala market. She sells two types of bananas, namely bogoya and ndizi. Before she started this business, she used to have a restaurant in the same locality from which she accumulated the capital to start this business. She attracts her customers by ensuring good services, attractive display, healthy fruits and a hygienic environment.

Victor is using this loan to purchase bogoya and ndizi to add to her stock. She purchases the fruits from the Masaka suppliers. When she sells bananas worth 400,000 Ugandan shillings (about USD$200), she earns an average of 100,000 shillings profit. Her ambition is to remain in the same business but as a supplier.
